*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Maria May

texts.en:
Being a mother, 57-year-old Maria May G. is very concerned about the lives of her two married children, as well as her own life and the well-being of her husband and the six children who still live with her and are dependent on her. Most of the family have an unstable source of income and are still under the umbrella of poverty. 

Instead of allowing herself to get stuck in the middle of the insecurities, in 2004, Maria May joined Kiva's field partner in the Philippines, ASHI, to access loans to enable her to be productive and flourish. She's used previous loans for her venture selling fish. The profits she makes augment her husband’s income as a fisherman. As soon as her business grows, she will be able to support her children's and grandchildren’s needs so they can enjoy the gifts of life. With this, her role as a mother will be completed. 

Maria May's membership in ASHI, and the loans she has received as a member, have assisted her in running her business. Maria May has been performing very well with her repayments, attendance, and business; thus qualifying her for a larger loan.

loans.use: To support her business selling fish

loans.name: Susanna

texts.en: Susanna G. is married with three daughters. Susanna’s husband, unable to find a job in his home country, left for Russia. Since 2006, Susanna has been trading in clothing. One of her daughters helps her hardworking mother in running the business. Susanna has applied for this loan to purchase new clothing stock.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing stock

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akofa est une femme de 29 ans, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits cosmétiques et de mèches.  Elle a commencé à exercer son activité dans sa propre boutique qu’elle appelé «  EMMAWEL’S SHOP ». Les fêtes de fin d’année approchent, elle veut accroître son stock de marchandises. Elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour acheter 2 cartons de mèches et divers produits cosmétiques. Elle est mariée et vit avec son époux dans le quartier ‘adidogomé  légbonou.
texts.en: Akofa is a 29-year old woman, who has an income-generating activity selling cosmetic products and hair extensions. She began this business in her own shop which she calls "Emmawel's shop". With the approach of the end-of-year festivities, she would like to boost her stock of goods. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy two cartons of hair extensions and various cosmetic products. She is married and lives with her husband in the Adidogomé Légbonou district.

loans.use: Purchase of hair extensions

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.


La socia es la Sra.Nerida; ella tiene 39 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de chompas, ella trabaja en forma independiente llevando las chompas a diferentes centros artesanales y por medio de este trabajo saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender las chompas. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chompas al por mayor.


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Nerida is a member of the Communal Bank “Juntas y Unidas” (Together and United), which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 39 years old, married, and has three children. Nerida divides her time between her daily activities and her business of buying and selling sweaters. She works independently by bringing the sweaters to different craft centers to sell so that her children can get ahead. Nerida wants to have a store where she can sell sweaters. She is requesting a loan in order to buy sweaters in bulk.

Nerida is grateful to those how have helped her fulfill her dream and promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

loans.use: Purchase sweaters in bulk

loans.name: Maria Lorenza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal  “LOS DIAMANTES”;  El banco comunal está ubicado en el distrito D. Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria; La socia tiene 50 años D. edad, ella es casada; y tiene 3 hijos, la socia se dedica  a la compra y venta D. artesanía, ella elabora artesanía y la venD. D. manera independiente, la socia trabajo en la municipalidad y como resultado D. sus trabajo y sus ahorros pudo apertura su negocio D. artesanías, la socia desea aumentar su mercadería y abastecerse para la época D. navidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra D. mercadería.

La socia agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “LOS DIAMANTES” ["The Diamonds"] communal bank. The communal bank is located in the Huanchac district, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

Her name is Maria, and she is 50 years old. She is married with 3 children. Her work is buying and selling handicrafts. She also makes handicrafts and sells them independently. She works for the municipality, and as a result of her work and her savings, she was able to open her handicraft business. She would like to increase her supply of merchandise and stock up for the Christmas season. She is requesting the loan to invest in buying merchandise. 

The borrower values and appreciates the loan granted to her in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Investing in buying merchandise

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. is 18 years old and lives in the town of Njeru in the Jinja region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children.  Florence has a business of selling shoes, which she has had for three years.         

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more shoes.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Florence hopes to generate greater profits and buy food.  In the future, Florence hopes to own a salon.        Florence is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by teaching her how to save money.

loans.use: To purchase shoes

loans.name: Yesenia Maria

texts.es:
Yesenia E. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Jacalito a 8 kilometros de la carretera que conduce a Guasaule frontera de Honduras-Nicaragua. Yesenia de dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, Yesenia es una mujer muy trabajadora. su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion.
Yesenia es madre de un niño que tiene 2 años, junto con su esposo trabajan duro para darle todo lo necesario a su hijo.
Todos los dias se levanta bien temprano para moler el maiz y empezar a hacer las tortillas y luego salir a venderlas.
tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas.
sus tiempos libres visita la iglesia y a familiares.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, cal y agua para la fabricar las tortillas.
texts.en: Yesenia E. is 29 years old and lives in the village of El Jacalito, about 8 kilometers from the highway that runs to Guasaule, on the border of Honduras and Nicaragua.  Yesenia is a very hard working woman who makes and sells tortillas.  Her business is located in her home.  She is the mother of a 2 year-old son, who she and her husband work hard to provide with everything he needs.  Every day, she gets up early to grind the corn and start making tortillas, and then she goes out to sell them.  She also raises chickens.  In her spare time, she goes to church or visits family.  She will use this loan to buy corn, firewood, lime, and water for making tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, firewood, and water

loans.name: Malopule

texts.en:
Malopule A. F. is 37 and married with 6 children. She owns a business venture selling snack foods, vegetables, sacks of flour, sugar, rice and then she resell it to the local community. Malopule has 2 years of experience in this business. Malopule needs a loan of 1000 WST to purchase enough supplies of sugar, salt, onions, flour and rice.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2010, Malopule joined SPBD. This is her first loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Malopule's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of sugar, salt, onions, flour and rice,snacks and tomatoes and then sell it to the local community

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba A. cooks banku at Abura for sale.  Araba is married and has two children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband to provide the basic needs of the family. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to cook banku for sale. She plans to provide a meaningful education for her children with the additional income.

loans.use: to buy more maize to cook banku for sale

loans.name: Murad

texts.ru:
Murad M. 34 qoda. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom , pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Murad jenat i imeyet 3 detey kotoriye uchatsya v shkole. Murad uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya skotovodstvom. 
On seychas nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovi dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva prodovayemoqo produkta  eto moloko iz kotoroqo Murad delayet sir,yogur i kefir i prodayet ix v magazini.
texts.en: Murad M. is 34 years old. He is an Internally Displaced Person, relocated from the town of Fuzuli now living in the Fuzuli Region together with his family. Murad is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Murad has been raising livestock for seven years. At present he needs 2000 AZN in order to buy  cows to increase the milk level production. Murad uses the milk to prepare cheese, yogurt and kefir and sells these products to stores.

loans.use: Purchasing cows

loans.name: Rammynel

texts.en:
Rammynel O. is from the village of Consuelo, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental.  She is 30 years old. Rammynel is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rammynel owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products  including fish like sardines & milk fish aside from having a retail store business in the local community. Rammynel has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rammynel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rammynelhas successfully repaid a previous loan of 9000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Rammynel is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell like milk fish & salmon. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Rammynel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish, like milk fish and salmon, to sell  purchase addiitional goods for the store

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is a 44-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari (general) store. She lives in Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1992 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari (general) store, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000. Emma is borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she can purchase more stock to sell. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Emma aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Mónica Patricia

texts.es:
Mónica Patricia C. C. motivada por las ganas de aportar a cubrir los gastos del hogar donde su esposo como pescador realiza grandes esfuerzos para sostener a sus 4 hijos, esta emprendedora decidió darle vida a su propio negocio, una tienda de diversos productos de la canasta familiar. 

Poco a poco Mónica ha ido surtiendo su negocio para lograr buenas ventas para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia pues como ella misma lo afirma con lo que gana su esposo no alcanzaba en muchas oportunidades ni para la comida.

Sus deseos de crecer son enormes, por eso, necesita de un préstamo para comparar más productos y así ofrecer diversidad a sus clientes y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en: Mónica, motivated by the desire to provide for her four children and cover household expenses along with her hard-working husband, who's a fisherman, decided to start her own business. This enterprising woman set up a convenience store with a variety of products. Little by little Mónica has been stocking her store to increase her sales and improve the quality of life for her and her family since she says that what her husband makes isn't enough to provide food or many opportunities. Her desire to grow her business is enormous, but to do so she needs a loan to purchase more products and in this way offer more variety to her customers and increase her profits.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more manure to improve his crops

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en: Onesmus is a 31-year-old, married man. He is blessed with 3 children. He uses his motorbike to supply water to homesteads.  He has sustained his business for 5 years and has employed one person. He also does dairy farming for extra income. Onesmus really appreciates Faulu Kenya because with their help, he has managed to buy a piece of land. He hopes to put up big water tanks in the future. Onesmus has requested 20,000 KES to buy water tanks.

loans.use: to buy water tanks

loans.name: Mujeres Poaquileñas Group

texts.es:
MUJERES POAQUILEÑAS
La señora María Elena S. P. como presidenta de Banco de Mujeres de Confianza día a día  desde temprano se dedica a trabajar para el sostenimiento de su familia trabajando arduamente en su casa con un pequeño negocio de venta de productos de consumo diario y un molino de nixtamal, también se dedica a la crianza de animales como pollos, cerdos y vacas, los días domingos desde temprano sale de su casa para ir al mercado porque ella tiene una venta de verduras, tiene bajo su responsabilidad a cuatro hijos que están estudiando en la escuela primaria.
Las demás integrantes del Banco se dedican a diferentes actividades como artesanía, crianza de animales, venta de refacciones, venta de verduras venta de ropas típicas, agricultura, todas trabajan y luchan para la superación de su familia y para un buen desarrollo familiar. 
Solicitan este credito para compra de insumos comestibles y asi engrandecer mas su negocio.
texts.en:
Women of Poaquileñas

María Elena S. P. is the president of the Banco de Mujeres de Confianza. Every day she works to support her family by working hard at home with a small grocery store that sells daily products and with her corn mill.  She also raises animals, such as chickens, pigs, and cows. On Sundays, she leaves her house early to go to the market because she has a vegetable stall. She has in her charge four children who are studying in primary school.

The other members of the bank work in different activities, such as crafts, raising animals, selling replacement car parts, selling vegetables, selling traditional clothing, and agriculture. Everyone works so their family can get ahead.

She is requesting this loan to buy food products so she can expand her business.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar de 32 años, vive en el barrio Carrizal de la ciudad de Barranquilla con su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 3 a 9 años; aunque  Edgar nació en Santander llegó al departamento del Atlántico con ganas de trabajar, pues su familia es muy trabajadora y  siempre su madre ha tenido tienda; así es que él tambien continuó con ese legado y una vez se instaló en la ciudad  emprendió también su tienda, donde hasta la presente,  vende ranchos, víveres y abarrotes.  Él empezó  este negocio con su hermano y con muchas ganas de cumplir su sueño, ahorrando poco a poco armó el suyo propio con resultados positivos. En la actualidad inicia su primer financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea con su credikiva comprará víveres y abarrotes y con ello aumentar sus ventas, porque su sueño mas adelante  es tener su propia casa   y ya empezó a trabajar en esa meta;  su mayor desafío fue acceder a  financiamientos porque no tenía vida crediticia, por las pocas oportunidades que tiene una persona cuando no conocen su historial financiero y ahora ya ha iniciado ese camino. Mientras construye su sueño, continua con una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de 11% y Edgar sueña con incrementarla, para poder brindarle a su familia un futuro prometedor.
texts.en: Edgar is 32 years old and he lives in the district of Carrizal in the city of Barranquilla. He lives with his partner and their two children, aged 3 and 9. Although Edgar was born in Santander he moved to the department of Altantico for work. His family is very hard working and his mother always had a store. And so he too continued in this legacy and once he settled in the city, he also started his store, one he still has today. He sells food products and grocery merchandise. He started this business with his brother, eager to accomplish his dream. With his savings he gradually established his own with positive results. This is his first loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and he plans on spending his Kiva loan on food products and groceries in order to increase his sales. His dream for the future is to have his own house and he has already started to work towards his goal. His greatest challenge was accessing a loan because he did not have a credit history. There are very few opportunities when the credit history is not known and now he has started down this path. While he builds his dream, he will continue on with a profit margin of 11%. Edgar dreams of increasing it to provide his family with a more promising future.

loans.use: to purchase food products and groceries to supply his business.

loans.name: Mahukpego 7 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHUKPEGO 7 est composé de trois personnes qui vivent toutes dans la même concession et se font mutuellement confiance. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Gbèhodé est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Gbèhodé est née en 1958 au Bénin et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Pascal. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, dont quatre sont les leurs. Aucun enfant n'est scolarisé, mais ils vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Gbèhodé vient en aide à son mari en assurant avec lui les charges de la maison, grâce au revenu issu de son activité. Gbèhodé n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Depuis quarante ans environs, Gbèhodé produit de l'huile de palme qu'elle vend, ce qui lui permet de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants. De façon secondaire, Gbèhodé vend des boissons. Gbèhodé achète ses matières premières au Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Gbèhodé sollicite un crédit, ensemble avec les autres membres de son groupe.
texts.en:
The MAHUKPEGO 7 group is made up of three persons, who all live in the same area and trust one another. This is the second time that this group is requesting ALIDé's financial support to raise their activity level. The group's representative, called Gbèhodé, is the woman raising her hand on the picture.
Gbèhodé was born in Benin in 1958, and is married to a farmer named Pascal. The couple has five dependent children, four of which are their own. None of the children go to school, but they live with their parents. Gbèhodé supports her husband by providing for the household's expenses with him, thanks to the revenues from her business. Gbèhodé never went to school. For about forty years, Gbèhodé has been selling the palm oil she produces, which makes it possible for her to provide for her and her children's expenses. As a secondary activity, Gbèhodé sells beverages. She gets her supplies from Benin.
Looking for customer satisfaction and to increase her revenues, Gbèhodé is requesting a loan, together with her group's other members.

loans.use: to purchase palm nuts and beverages.

loans.name: Busheregyenyi Bakyara Kwebeishaho Group

texts.en: Laban is 55 years old and exudes nothing but self confidence. This jolly businessman says the longevity of his veterinary business, which he operates in Bushenyi town, is due to lots of hard work, persistence and determination. Laban is happily married, has seven children and has been operating his business for the last 27 years, ever since he left the farm he used to run. He switched from farming after deciding that there was a big demand for veterinary drugs in Bushenyi, and today his weekly sales average about 50,000 shillings. He is applying for this loan to buy more veterinary drugs to sell to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more veterinary drugs to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Valya

texts.en: Valya is from the village of Isahakyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is married with three children – two daughters (thirty-three and thirty-six) and a thirty-year-old son.  Valya has a high school education and has been working in agriculture and retail trade for thirty-five years.  She would like a loan to purchase fertilizer, livestock and inventory for her shop.  Valya expects her income to increase by twenty percent with the investment.  She is saving some of the additional income to support her children’s families and also to enlarge her shop.  She was pleased with the loan disbursement process of microfinance and the terms of the loans.  Valya was born in Isahakyan and really likes to be surrounded by nature and her friendly neighbors.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, livestock and shop inventory

loans.name: G.s. Santiaga Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Santiaga, las integrantes del grupo Dora y Matilde. Doña Dora se decidió por ese negocio, ya que dice que tiene mucha demanda, y le genera muy buenas ganancias, además de que quería buscar la manera de sacar a sus hijos adelante, para darles una muy buena calidad de vida, la inversión del crédito será para la compra carnes, pollo, arroz, frijoles, refrescos, platos desechables entre otros. El sueño que tiene es que espera algún día poder cumplirlo es el de ampliar un poco mas su local y para así tenerlo muy bien surtido y proporcionarle a sus clientes comodidad.
texts.en:
The name of this group is Santiaga and its members are: Dora and Matilde.  Dora decided on this business because of the high demand and it generates good earnings, besides they also wanted to find a way to get their kids ahead and give them a better quality of life.  The loan wil be invested in the purchase of  meats, chicken, rice, beans, beverages, and disposable dishes amongst other things. 
A dream she hopes to fulfill one day is to expand her store a bit in order to keep it better stocked and offer her customers some comfort.

loans.use: to purchase: meat, chicken, rice, beans, beverages, and disposable dishes amongst other things

loans.name: Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Cristina tiene como actividad la carpintería actividad que realiza juntamente con su esposo quien es carpintero, juntos realizan diferentes trabajos para vender y también a pedido, el momento de la visita se encontraba realizando juegos de comedor  los cuales la comercializa en diferentes lugares, esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ellos, en esta ocasión solicitan financiamiento para la compra de madera para cubrir la demanda actual que tiene, la señora Cristina aprendió esta actividad de su esposo ayudándole, ella es una persona muy trabajadora dinámica con ganas de superación agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Ms. Cristina is a carpenter. She does this work alongside her husband, who is also a carpenter. Together, they build different pieces to sell. They also work on orders. At the time when Emprender visited them, they were working on dining sets that they planned to sell in different places. This work is their principal source of income. At this time, they are requesting a loan to buy wood to cover their current demand. Ms. Cristina learned carpentry through helping her husband. She is a very hard-working, dynamic person with a great desire to improve. She is very grateful for the support being offered to her.

loans.use: to buy materials (wood)

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1979. She lives in Xom Vang village. She is married with two children who are small. Her husband is a businessman. 

Mrs Thuy has a wedding dress shop (selling and renting out wedding dresses). She has this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 3,500,000 Vietnamdong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2007. 

The last time, she borrowed 7,194,000 VND and repaid punctually. For this loan, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy more new wedding dress to renting out.

loans.use: to buy more new wedding dress for renting service

loans.name: Joel

texts.en:
Joel is a married man with four children. Three attend school while one is underage. He lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past seven years, he has operated a water selling business, selling from door to door to his neighbors, using his hand cart. He also operates a restaurant business which contributes another source of income. Joel faces the major challenge of seasonality, especially during the dry hot season, because the availability of water for distribution is lower. He dreams of expanding his business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 he wants to purchase chairs and tables for his restaurant, and to purchase four hand carts for water distribution. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase chairs and tables for his restaurant, and to purchase four hand carts for water distribution.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married woman with five children, all of whom have already graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a food vending business, selling food from her home to her neighbors. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her major dream is to develop and expand her business in the future.

With the 20,000 KES loan she is requesting, she would like to purchase cereals for re-sale purposes. She decided to join Yehu so that she could have greater access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional cereals for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Dzame

texts.en:
Dzame is a married woman with six children, five of whom attend school while one is married. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  Her biggest monthly expense is food.

For the past three years she has operated a palm wine selling business, selling to her neighbors and passers-by.  Her major challenge is seasonality. She dreams of establishing a retail shop in the future.

With the Kshs. 20,000 she wants to establish a food stall business with the purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour. Dzame decided to join Yehu to access loans.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour and maize flour to establish her food stall.

loans.name: Egmedio

texts.en:
Egmedio is 57 years old and married with one child. He earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Egmedio is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

Egmedio has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from his restaurant and sari-sari  (variety) store.

He is working tirelessly toward the attainment of he dream: to build and expand his businesses to secure the future of his family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for his pigs.

loans.name: Baktygul's Group

texts.en:
Baktygul is the leader of this group. She is 42 and she brings up two daughters. Both daughters go to kindergarten, they are preschool age (under seven). Baktygul works as a secretary in a "Rural justice". In order to earn additional money to meet the family needs she breeds livestock. Ten years ago she got a livestock inheritance from her parents and since that time she has been breeding livestock. From time to time if she needs money she can sell some animals. At the moment Baktygul wants to increase the number of livestock. For this purpose she applies for the loan, with money received from the loan she plans to purchase three sheep for breeding.

 --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Flor Alejandrina

texts.es:
Flor, necesita nuevamente un préstamo, por eso se decide a solicitarlo, ya que además que recibe una buena atención. Este préstamo lo invertirá en compra de arroz, aceite, embutidos, huevos, para el negocio, estos préstamos le sirven muchísimo para mejorar la atención de la clientela, ofreciendo un amplio número de productos.
Estas inversiones la han ayudado para mejorar los ingresos a su hogar, cubriendo las necesidades cotidianas.
texts.en:
Flor needs a new loan and so decided to request one as she receives a good service.  She will invest this loan in buying rice, oil, cold cuts and eggs for her business.  These loans are very helpful as they enable her to improve her customer service and offer her customers a wide range of products.

These investments have helped Flor to improve her household income and cover her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, cold cuts and eggs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 45-year-old married man and is blessed with five children, all of whom attend school. He has been practicing dairy farming for the last ten years to support his family. Previously he practiced tea farming. The major challenge he faced was competition. He has requested a loan for 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy animal feeds. In the next five years he plans to increase the number of cows he owns. Through the loan funds he has received from Faulu Kenya, Joseph has been able to manage his business and become more business-oriented.

loans.use: to buy animal feeds.

loans.name: Mulango Shg Group

texts.en:
Janet is the facilitator of the Mulango SHG group.  Janet and her group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Janet takes care of five children at home. She joined One Acre Fund for One Acre Fund’s best prices and in order to ensure food security for her family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Janet had an excellent maize yield harvesting 12 ½ bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Janet was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½  acres of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Janet and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from her maize sales, Janet will educate her children, build a house and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Mulango SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Janet is pictured with her group members and the field officer appears at the far left of the photograph. One member is absent.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loans.name: Humberto De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Humberto a sus 51 años de edad y padre de un hijo de 16 años, se dedica a transportar en su  propia camioneta artículos de hogar y ropa para vender en los pueblos; adicional a esto también utiliza su vehículo para hacer encomiendas. Toda su vida la ha dedicado el señor Humberto a trabajar de manera independiente, en sus inicios tuvo dos tiendas que vendió porque se encontraba muy cansado.
Actualmente su carro necesita cambio de motor y algunos repuestos para que trabaje correctamente,  poder entregar los pedidos a tiempo y transportarse con más seguridad.  En un futuro desea tener otro vehículo y así generar empleos directos en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Humberto is 51 years old and he is the father of a 15 year old son. He transports home goods and clothing in his own truck to sell in small towns. In addition to this, he uses his vehicle to send packages. All of his life, he has been dedicated to working independently. He has had two stores which were sold because he was getting very tired.
Now, his vehicle needs a new engine and a few spare parts in order to work properly. They’re needed to deliver the orders on time and travel more safely. In the future, he wants another vehicle and then, he can generate jobs in his community.

loans.use: purchase an engine and spare parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Hortensia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Hortensia; La soica tiene 41 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su pareja y tienen tres hijos;La socia se dedcia principalmente a la agricultura, la socia tiene terrenos de cultivos heredados de sus padres, ella siembra hortalizas, maíz, papa, zanahorias, cebollas, entre otros vegetales; Lleva varios años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos hasta los centros de acopio situados en los poblados de Urubamba y Cusco. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de animale smenores como pollos, cuyes y de semillas para sembras vegetales y maíz.
La socia se compromete a cumplir con el pago de las cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Hortensia is a member of the “VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN” communal bank, located in the Arin district, within the Calca province and Cusco department.

Hortensia is 41 years old and is a very happy, hardworking woman who lives in her own home along with her husband.  She mainly farms and has land that she inherited from her parents.  She raises vegetables, corn, potatoes, carrots, and onions among other vegetables.  She’s been doing this for several years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting the vegetables to the supply centers located in Urubamba and Cusco.  She is asking for this loan to so that she can invest in small animals like chickens, Guinea pigs, and corn and vegetable seeds.

She promises to make her payments on time.
.

loans.use: to buy small animals and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline lives in Likoni area of the Coastal Province, Kenya. She is married and has two children. She sells clothes at the market stalls beyond the course way. Likoni has a huge number of low to middle class people. 

Caroline began her business from her personal savings. She learned about Milango from her friends, decided to join and is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase more clothes. Her main challenge is inflation, which has raised the cost of many commodities.

Caroline’s future goals include building her own business premise. She will use the additional income from this loan to purchase school shoes for sale.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Emperatriz

texts.es:
La señora emperatriz es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que le gusta mucho el negocio que tiene, cuenta con la edad de 37 años y está casada con el señor Felipe quien es mecánico, tienen 3 hijos de los cuales solo Roberto estudia cursa el primer año de preescolar, ya que los 2 mayores están casados, tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva apenas 12 años.
Ella dice que empezó con esta actividad porque quería mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, también para tener una buena solvencia económica, y así empezar a ahorrar y asegurar el futuro de su pequeño hijo, el crédito que recibió lo va a invertir en la compra de mercancía como: leche, refrescos, galletas, frijol, pastas dentales, jabón, sopas, aceite, sal y papel higiénico, para tener un mejor surtido. 
Una de las metas que tiene emperatriz es la de hacer crecer muchísimo su negocio, puesto que quiere construir un local mucho más grande, para poner su abarrotería y asi poder mejorar e incrementar sus ventas junto con sus ingresos.
Esta muy agradecida con FRAC y los donadores de kiva, por este gran apoyo que les están ofreciendo, ya que gracias a esa ayuda su negocio y vida de su familia han cambiado bastante.
texts.en:
Emperatriz is a hard-working and entrepreneurial person who likes the business she has a lot. She is 23 and is married to Felipe who is a mechanic. They have three children, of whom only Roberto is in school in the first year of pre-school since the two eldest are married. She has a grocery store, which she's had for 12 years.

She says she began with this activity because she wanted to improve her and her family's quality of life, as well as to have good economic earnings and to begin to save and secure the future of her small child. The loan that she received she is going to invest in the purchase of merchandise like milk, refreshments, cookies, beans, pastas, toothpaste, soap, soup, oil, salt and toilet paper in order to have better stock.

One of the Emperatriz's goals is to grow her business a lot since she wants to build a much bigger shop for her grocery store and be able to increase her sales and income.

She is very thankful to FRAC and the Kiva donators for the great support that they offer since, thanks to this help, her business and the life of her family has changed quite a bit.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of merchandise like milk, refreshments, cookies, beans, pasta, toothpaste, soap, soup, oil, salt, and toilet paper.

loans.name: Jovenes Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Ana Cecilia tiene 25 años es muy joven y trabajadora junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de madera que ambos sacan adelante, por su parte ella vende  ropa y zapatos,  fue la tía de su esposo quien le enseño todo lo referente a las ventas, debido a que ella lo comercializaba en provincia y le dejaba buenos dividendos, fue así que pudo juntar algo de dinero y compro su propia mercadería, sus primeras clientas fueron las madres del vaso de leche al cual pertenecía y sus amigas del gimnasio, Su carácter jovial fue una gran ayuda para ganar amistades y así obtener más clientes, actualmente ella es la presidenta del grupo “ JOVENES EMPRENDEDORES” todas las socias son amigas y vecinas del mismo lugar, Ana Cecilia tiene un proyecto que espera cumplir muy pronto compararse un puesto en algún mercado para instalar allí su negocio de ropa y bazar, con este préstamo que le otorga EDAPROSPO comprara ropa y zapatos para su negocio, lo más importante que este negocio le ha permitido es pagar la pensión del colegio de su hijo y se sentirá feliz el día que su hijo sea un profesional.

  * Ana Cecilia es la 3ra parada (derecha) viste blusa a cuadros
texts.en:
Ana Cecilia is 25 years old.  She is very young and hard working.  She and her husband have a wood business that they both run.  Ana Cecilia also sells clothes and shoes.  It was her husband's aunt who taught her everything she needed to know about selling these products as she also used to sell them in the provinces and it made her good income.  Ana Cecilia was able to get some money together and buy her own merchandise.  Her first customers were other mothers who belonged to the same 'Glass of Milk' [feeding program] as she did and friends from school.  Her cheerful character was a great help in making friendships and thereby gaining more customers.  Ana Cecilia is currently president of the 'Jovenes Emprendedores' (Young Entrepreneurs) group.  All the members of the group are friends and neighbors from the same place.  Ana Cecilia has a project that she hopes to achieve very soon which is to buy a stall in a market so that she can set up her clothes business there.  

Ana Cecilia will use this loan from EDAPROSPO to buy clothes and shoes for her business.  The most important thing that Ana Cecilia's business has enabled her to do is pay her son's school fees and she will feel happy when he becomes a professional.

* Ana Cecilia is the third lady from the left in the photo.  She is standing up and wearing a blue checkered blouse.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes for her business

loans.name: Rosa Edilma

texts.es:
Dedicación a su trabajo y amorosa con sus 3 hijos, son las dos cualidades con las que mejor se reconoce a Rosa Edilma, quien desde hace 3 años se vio en la obligación de generar los ingresos para su hogar debido a que se separó de su esposo y se convirtió en una madre soltera cabeza de familia. Rosa Edilma desde entonces se ha venido esforzando cada vez más con el objetivo de construir un negocio rentable y perdurable con el cual pueda seguir generando los ingresos para su hogar. Es por esto que hoy día se dedica a la comercialización de productos de uso personal,tales como shampoo, cremas de manos, lociones, entre otros productos de uso personal.Sus ventas las realiza generalmente a sus amigos y personas de su sector, y muy esporádicamente se consigue un cliente nuevo interesado en sus productos.
Con el ánimo de incrementar sus ventas, Rosa Edilma pretende aumentar sus ventas significativamente, y sabe que para poder hacerlo debe aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, por lo que requiere de la compra de mercancía de uso personal para hacer más atractivo su negocio.
Sin embargo, Rosa Edilma no cuenta con el capital necesario para comprar la mercancía, y es por esto que Rosa Edilma busca un préstamo el cual le permita comprar mercancía y surtir su negocio de productos de uso personal como shampoo, cremas de manos, lociones, entre otros productos, de modo que sus clientes queden mas interesados en sus productos y así aumente sus ventas.
Rosa Edilma sueña con que sus 3 hijos puedan crecer en un buen ambiente de familia, alejados de toda clase de problemas, y que ella les pueda brindar una estabilidad económica y la mejor educación posible.
texts.en:
Dedication to her work and love for her 3 children are the two qualities for which Rosa Edilma is best known. For 3 years now she has been the breadwinner for the family since she separated from her husband and became a single mother. Since then, Rosa Edilma has worked harder and harder to build a profitable and lasting business that will keep generating income for her household. For this reason she is now selling personal hygiene products. She mostly sells to her friends and people in her neighborhood, and occasionally she gets a new customer who is interested in her products.

Rosa Edilma is looking for a loan that will allow her to buy merchandise and stock her business so that her customers are more interested in her products and her sales will increase.

Rosa Edilma dreams that her 3 children will grow up in a good family environment, protected from all kinds of problems, and that she will be able to give them financial stability and the best education possible.

loans.use: to purchase personal use products like shampoo, hand cream, lotions and others

loans.name: Blanca Betty

texts.es: Blanca Betty tiene 60 años de edad, ella trabaja como conserje en el hospital de la localidad, Blanca tiene una vivienda en el cual quiere realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda, el salario no le permite realizar las mejoras de su vivienda que ha sido unos de sus sueños de mejorar. Blanca  está solicitando financiamiento para realizar las mejoras de la vivienda lo cual comprar bloque, cementó y  hierro, arena entre otros materiales de construcción.
texts.en:
Blanca Betty, age 60, works as a janitor in the local hospital.  Blanca wants to make some improvements on her home.  Her salary does not allow her to make these improvements, which has been one of her dreams.

Blanca is requesting a loan to make the improvements to her house.  She will buy block, cement, iron, and sand, among other construction materials.

loans.use: to buy block, cement, iron, and sand, among other construction materials.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en: Vardan already ended his first Kiva loan and being very pleased of his Kiva deal he decided to repeat it once again. He lives with his family in Sevan city in Gegharkunik region. Vardan is engaged is his farming as previously and with the help of his wife they take care of their farm cattle such as   cows, bulls, calves, sheep and chickens. Vardan’s wife makes testy macun (national dairy-product), cheese, milk and they also sell meat and eggs. Vardan specially takes care of his orchard which is full of apple, pear, peach and also apricot trees. All his farm products Vardan sells locally and he also uses it for his family. This time his Kiva loan of 700.000 Armenian drams Vardan needs for enlarging the number of his farm cattle and he will buy a cow and also fodder for all his farm cattle.

loans.use: for enlarging the number of his farm cattle and he will buy a cow and also fodder for all his farm cattle

loans.name: Lyubov

texts.en:
Lyubov is divorced. She has two grown up kids. Her hobby is to take care of her grandchildren. Lyubov is a art school graduate. She is a professional dancing teacher. Lyubov used to give dancing classes for living. However, soon she realized that she lacked opportunities in her field. She borrowed some money and added her personal savings to start her own business. Today she became an entrepreneur running her small kiosk selling toys and games. Lyubov is very generous. She has a kind and caring heart. Her love for children motivated her to choose this sphere of business. Being a sociable person, Lyubov manages to find common language with every client. Every time you pass by her kiosk you can see her talking to a new person who will definitely end up buying something. Lyubov has worked with “Nadiya Ukraine” since 2003. She has repaid 16 loans. She is always telling others about lending services “Nadiya Ukraine” can offer to small business owners. Lyubov needs a loan of $800 to increase on stock for Christmas season (December 25th – January 14th in Ukraine). She wants to buy stuffed toys, table games, Barbie dolls, puzzles, construction pieces etc. in bulk from wholesale distributors. Lyubov has worked in this business for over 3 years. She knows exactly what kids will like and how to make a child happy. She doesn’t have to advertise her trade stalls because attractive toy displays and bright colors draw potential clients to her kiosk. Being a good steward of the money she receives, Lyubov will manage the loan efficiently and repay it in time. Financial assistance will not only help Lyubov expand her commercial activity, it will also fill so many homes with joy and happy smiles this Christmas season.

Любов Іванівна – дуже щедра людина. В неї щире та любляче серце. Її любов до дітей підштовхнула її обрати саме цю галузь бізнесу. Любов Іванівна – дуже відкрита людина. Їй вдається знайти спільну мову з будь-яким клієнтом. Кожного разу проходячи повз її кіоск, можна побачити, як вона розмовляє з новим покупцем, який ніколи не піде без покупки. Любов Іванівна працює з „Надією України” з 2003 року. Вона отримала та сплатила 16 позик. Любов Іванівна з радістю розповідає іншим про кредитні послуги, які „Надія України” може запропонувати власникам малого бізнесу. Любов Іванівна хотіла б отримати позику розміром в 800 доларів для того, щоб збільшити асортимент товарів напередодні свят (в Україні це період з 25-го грудня до 14-го січня). Вона хотіла б придбати м’які іграшки, настільні ігри, ляльок Барбі, пазли, конструктори тощо за помірними цінами в оптових дистриб’юторів. Любов Іванівна займається цим бізнесом вже понад 3 роки. Вона знає, що до вподоби дітям, що саме може зробити дитину щасливою. Їй не треба робити рекламу своїх товарів, тому що яскраві іграшки, вміло розташовані на вітрині завжди приваблюють потенційних клієнтів. Маючи здібність мудро використовувати свій час та зароблені гроші, Любов Іванівна зможе сплатити позику вчасно. Фінансова підтримка не тільки допоможе їй розширити торгівлю, але й наповнить багато домівок радістю та щасливими посмішками напередодні Новорічних та Різдвяних свят.

loans.use: To increase on stock for Christmas season

loans.name: Jesús Elías

texts.en:
Jesús lives in San Juanito, Chihuahua and has an electronics and appliances repair business. He is married and has 4 children, who are 26, 23, 17, and 9 years old, and whom he has to provide for and give an education to, so that they can have a better future. His wife works as a hair stylist, since both of them have to work to provide for the family. He began his business due to the fact that he couldn’t find work. Because of this, he rented a small shop space and began fixing appliances. Little by little, he began to fix a variety of appliances and electronics and since demand for his work has grown, he now also buys and sells some of these items.

Jesús is requesting a loan of $475 to buy inventory to continue growing his business. He also wants to buy replacement parts that will serve to repair appliances and electronics. He expects to pay back the loan over a period of 3 to 6 months and he needs your support to maintain and continue his growth and to realize his dream of seeing his four children educated so that they can live a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Jesús vive en San Juanito, Chihuahua, y tiene el negocio de arreglo de aparatos electrónicos. Esta casado y tiene 4 hijos de 26 años, 23 años, 17 años y el menor de 9 años, a quienes tiene que mantener y darles educación para que tengan un mejor futuro. La esposa de Jesús trabaja como estilista, ya que ambos tienen que trabajar para poder con la manutención de su familia, él empezó con su negocio debido a que no encontraba trabajo, por lo que, lo primero que hizo fue rentar un pequeño local y arreglando aparatos electrodomésticos pequeños y poco a poco empezó a arreglar diversos tipos de aparatos eléctricos y como fue incrementándose su demanda actualmente también compra y vende algunos de estos aparatos.

Jesús esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para comprar mercancía y continuar incrementando su negocio y también invertir parte del préstamo en comprar piezas que le sirvan para poder reparar estos artículos. Espera pagar el crédito en un período de 3 a 6 meses y necesita de su apoyo para poder mantener, continuar su crecimiento y realizar sus sueños de ver educados a sus 4 hijos llevando una mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: To buy inventory and repair parts for electronics and appliances

loans.name: Tep

texts.en: Tep S. is 40 years old and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia, with her husband and child.  She works at her small laundry shop and earns about $2/day while her husband earns about $3/day operating a mototaxi.  She will use this loan to repair her home so that it will not leak.  In the future, she wants to buy a stand in the market to sell vegetables.  Her goal is for her children to graduate from university.

loans.use: to repair her house for the rainy season

loans.name: Gerardo Ramón

texts.es:
Mr. Gerardo is 57 years old, married and has three children. Their children are students and they help their parents taking care of the cows that they have, of which they sell their milk in the neighborhood of their house. They've dedicated themselves to this activity for more than 10 years. Thanks to his effort and that of his wife they were able to maintain the house and the schooling of their children. To be able to have greater income, Gerardo also runs a kiosk that is situated very close to the crossroads denominated Pribebuy branch. His principal clientele are the "chiperas" stationed near his business that are more or less some 15 saleswomen of chips (a very typical snack of our country), and so these are also the travelling salespeople in the area. Gerardo is a highly respected man in his community due to his honest work and his great worth as a person; he forms a part of various community groups with the aims of growing and bettering his neighborhood. The loans previously obtained from la Fundacion Paraguaya he has invested in the purchase of merchandise to stock his kiosk such as sodas, beer, sweets, etc.. He wishes to solicit a new credit that he will invest in the purchase of sweets, sodas, dairy products and snacks since the demand for these products is on the rise and the purchase of these products at wholesale will generate greater discounts that will augment his revenue. He wishes further on to be able to enlarge his dairy buying more cows with the savings that he is amassing thanks to the profits generated by his kiosk.

Translated from Spanish by Pax Bobrow, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Gerardo tiene 57 años, está casado y tiene 3 hijos. Sus hijos son estudiantes y le ayuda a sus padres cuidando de las vacas que tienen y de las cuales venden su leche en el barrio de su casa, se dedican a esta actividad hace ya más de 10 años, gracias a su esfuerzo y la de su esposa pudieron mantener la casa y el estudio de sus hijos. Para poder tener mayores ingresos, Gerardo también administra un kiosco, que se encuentra muy cerca del cruce denominado ramal Piribebuy, sus principales clientes son las chiperas apostada cerca de su negocio que son más o menos unas 15 señoras vendedoras de chipas (una comida muy típica de nuestro país); como a si también lo son los vendedores ambulantes de la zona. Gerardo, es un señor muy respetado en su comunidad por su trabajo honesto y sus grandes valores como persona; el forma parte de varios grupos comunitarios, con finalidades de crecimiento y mejoramiento de su barrio. Los préstamos obtenidos anteriormente de la Fundación Paraguaya lo ha invertido en la compra de mercaderías para surtir su kiosco tales como gaseosas, cerveza, golosinas, etc.. Desea solicitar un nuevo crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de golosinas, gaseosas, productos lácteos y snacks pues la demanda de estos productos están en alzas y la compra al por mayor de estos productos le generarán mayores descuentos que aumentarán sus ganancias; él desea más adelante poder ampliar su tambo comprando más vacas con los ahorros que está juntando gracias a las ganancias generadas en su kiosco.

loans.use: purchase of sweets, sodas, dairy products and snacks - golosinas, gaseosas, productos lácteos y snacks

loans.name: Boymurod

texts.en: Boymurod S. is 40 years old and has a secondary education. After school he worked as a driver in an auto park. He has been selling vegetable and fruits in a market (potatoes, tomatoes, pepper, onion, carrot, brinjal, apple, pears, and grapes) foor four years. He has a car which is appropriate for carrying goods so it is helping for his business. He buys vegetables and fruits straight from the fields at a wholesale price and sells them to venders in the market. For the loan amount he is going to buy vegetable and fruits and increase his businesses sales. This loan helps local habitants to obtain vegetables and fruits for a lower price not far from their home. This client is going to pay off the loan amount in 6 months.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits and to increase sales.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor gets up very early every day to work diligently picking bananas and pineapples. She learned how to do this work when she was veyr young, and she takes care in how she handles the fruit. All of these efforts have allowed her to open a small shop in her home, where she provides various products to the people in her community. Flor has two children, 5 and 6 years old. They are her source of motivation to continue working so hard. One of her children suffers from serious bronchitis and needed to be hospitalized. This results in an enormous cost for the family. Because of this, and to prevent more difficulty in the future, she wants to invest in her business and sell a great quantity of products so she can continue supporting her family. Please help this hardworking woman so she can continue to improve the quality of life for her family.

Flor, se levanta todos los días muy temprano para internarse diligentemente en la producción de plátanos y piñas, hábilmente cuida de cada fruto ya que ella aprendió esta actividad desde muy niña.Todo este esfuerzo le permitió abrir una tienda en su casa donde expende múltiples productos a los pobladores de su comunidad. Ella tiene dos hijos de 5 y 6 años que son su fuente de motivación para seguir luchando, sin embargo uno de ellos sufrió una fuerte bronquitis por lo que tuvo que ser internado en el hospital de Santa Ana.Aquello significó un enorme gasto para la familia y ante este hecho y para prevenir otros, desea reinvertir en su bodega y así lograr comercializar una mayor cantidad de productos, de manera que pueda seguir apoyando a su familia con esta actividad. Apoyemos a esta noble mujer para que siga incrementando la calidad de vida de su familia.

Translated by Kiva volunteer, Emily Charnes

loans.use: TO INVEST IN THE SMALL GENERAL STORE SHE RUNS FROM HER HOME, EXPAND THE PRODUCTS SHE CAN SELL AND INCREASE HER INCOME.  SHE NEEDS TO COVER MEDICAL COSTS FOR ONE OF HER SONS, AND CONTINUE TO PROVIDE FOR THE FAMILY.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Maria Teresa is a hard-working person, doing everything she can to get ahead and to be able to give her daughter everything she needs. Maria Teresa took a vocational course in sewing and tailoring and she now has a business making sweaters, tableclothes, bedspreads, all kinds of embroidery, and many other products besides. She sells her products in the surrounding area and her neighbors and friends sometimes submit orders. Separately, she has a child-care business. Her neighbors place their highest trust in her: they leave their children in her care while they work. As if that weren't enough, she also makes gelatins, "mazamorra" (a local dessert maD. with corn, fruit, lemon, sugar, etc.) and candy that she sells from her house in the Peruvian "departamento" of La Libertad.

Before receiving her first loan from her community bank, Maria Teresa only knitted sweaters for some friends. Then, with a S/.300 (300 Peruvian soles or about US$100) from the Bellavista community bank, she bought material and started her business. She's saved what she's earned and with a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.500 (about US$167), to be repaid in 4 months, she completed the purchase of a knitting machine that will give her pieces a better finish.

Maria Teresa told us that her hope is to have a well-established workshop for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Maria Teresa es una persona muy trabajadora, hace todo lo que pueD. para salir adelante y para poder darle todo lo que necesita su hija. La señora María Teresa recibió estudios técnicos en confecciones y ahora se dedica a fabricar chompas, tapetes, colchas, alfileteros, todo tipo D. bordados y muchas cosas más, los ofrece por las urbanizaciones, a veces le piden sus vecinos o sus amistades; a parte se dedica al cuidado D. niños y sus vecinos confían mucho en ella, dejan a sus niños en sus manos mientras ellos trabajan; por si fuera poco también prepara gelatina, mazamorra, dulces para venderlos en su domicilio que se encuentra ubicado en la calle Los Ángeles en el distrito D. La Esperanza, Provincia D. Trujillo, Departamento D. La Libertad.

Antes D. recibir su primer préstamo en su Banco Comunal, la señora María Teresa solo tejía chompas para algunas amigas, luego con los S/. 300 (aproximadamente $ 100) que recibió en su Banco Comunal “Bellavista” compró material, con lo inició su negocio D. confección. Fue ahorrando lo que ganaba y con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/.500 (aproximadamente $167), el cual será pagado en 4 meses, completó para comprar una máquina remalladora para darle mejor acabado a las prendas que confecciona.

La señora Maria Teresa nos expresa que su mayor dicha seria tener una fábrica D. confecciones bien implementada.

loans.use: Buy a knitting machine.

loans.name: Rose's Tupendane Group

texts.en:
Rose is 38-years-old and is married with 6 children (ages 23, 19, 17, 15, 13, and 11). She and her husband also take care of her mother, who is 90 years old.

Rose is a food vendor and started this business in 2004. She works from 7am to 5pm daily, and makes a monthly profit of about $25 a month from this business. She hopes for a loan to buy additional stock to increase her business. She will share this loan with Matha, a member in her loan group. Matha sells clothes for a living.

loans.use: To buy food stock

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en: Sadiq B. (whose son is pictured) owns and operates a household goods store in the northeasterly Azerbaijani town of Devechi. He is 57 years old and is married with one son. Sadiq has been working in this business for the last 12 years and is currently seeking $1,300 of funding ($1,200 to come from Kiva and the remaining $100 to come from Norwegian Microcredit) so that he can invest in and develop his business.

loans.use: To further develop his business

loans.name: Roziya

texts.en: M. Roziya lives in the J.Rasuov region; she is married and has 5 children.  She is in the business of pastry and confectionery selling.  She always has a wide assortment of freshly-baked pastries. Now she would like to apply for a KIVA business development loan of 3600 STJ for 9 months to import new goods and further increase her assortment.

loans.use: Increase assortment of inventory and to import more goods

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Mrs. Dipa K., a 35-year-old lady, lives in Sainbu-Bhaishapati, Lalitpur. Mrs. Dipa K. lives in a single family with her husband and two children. Her daughter is studying in grade 10 and her son is studying in grade 6. Mrs. Dipa is a center chief in her group. Being a center chief she has take responsibility for her center members.

Mrs. Dipa and her husband, Mr. Ramesh K., opened their veterinary pharmacy 2 years ago. They sell different types of domestic animal medicine in their shop. They both contribute equally in their shop because they don’t have any other job.

Now Mrs. Dipa is requesting her fifth loan of US$ 475 to expand her business and buy necessary medicine for her shop.

loans.use: To buy veterinary medicines for her shop

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is a skilled, hard-working entrepreneur from Ordzhonikidze, Ukraine. She is married with one child. Anna opened a store in the central market of her home town about six months ago where she sells women’s clothing. She is an organized and effective manager with an excellent reputation among other entrepreneurs. Presently, she has about $5,000 in turnover capital, and her profit exceeds $500 a month.

Anna has requested a loan of $525 to purchase additional inventory. With the increased profits she expects to earn, Anna plans to continue expanding her trade and provide service that is second to none. She masterfully uses unique skills that she has learned and cultivated while working. We believe Anna's willingness to keep her reputation as a trustworthy and professional entrepreneur will help her reach even greater success in this business.

loans.use: Purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Jam Bugum 2 Group

texts.fr:
This group of women farmers who united to increase their income used their first loan of 500,000 cfa to start a business raising cattle. The group has so far received four loans of 500,000 cfa, each of which has allowed them to increase their production capacity and thereby ensure their financial independence.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

Le groupe réunu des femmes agricultrices qui pour accroitre leurs revenus ont avec un premier pret de 500.000f cfa commencé une activité d'embouche bovine.Le groupe a déjà bénéficé de quatre prets de 500.000f cfa chacun ce qui leur a permis d'augmenter leur capacité de production et d'assurer ainssi leur indépandance financiére.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
20 years ago, Rosa started selling thread for embroidery. Her husband suggested that she do so since he works in a thread factory. Because of competition, however, her sales dropped and she decided to switch businesses. This is how she decided to sell elastics. Rosa buys the elastics by kilogram in the factory at which they are made. Then she converts them into smaller pieces with her own brand name. She has also rented a car to be used as a taxi for the past 6 years. Additionally, she sells cosmetics through a catalogue. The loans for which she has asked have helped her buy elastics and maintain her car. Rosa would like to start a clothing store, but also stay in the elastic sales business.

Translated from the Spanish by Susanna Heinz, Kiva Volunteer.

Hace 20 años, Rosa empezó a trabajar vendiendo hilo de bordar. Fue su esposo quien le dio la idea de dedicarse a esta actividad, ya que él trabajaba en una fábrica de hilos. Sin embargo, luego apareció la competencia extranjera, lo que le motivó a cambiarse de rubro, ya que las ventas bajaron. Fue así que decidió vender elásticos mercerizados. Rosa compra el elástico por kilos en la fábrica que lo produce. Luego, ella los convierte a piezas por metraje, donde le coloca su propia marca. Asimismo, Rosa tiene un auto que lo alquila como taxi desde hace 6 años. También vende cosméticos por catálogo. Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para la compra de elásticos y para el mantenimiento del auto. A Rosa le gustaría poner una tienda de ropa, pero seguir en el negocio de la venta de elásticos.

loans.use: To purchase the elastics she sells and maintain her vehicle

loans.name: Gassama Et Freres Group

texts.fr:
The new hardware store is located on Boulevard of the 54m in Tilene. Ba Seckou G. runs this family business. He is requesting this loan to strengthen his stock of iron and concrete. This will allow them to make a bigger profit.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

La nouvelle quincaillerie est situe le boulevard des 54m a tilene. Cette entreprise famialle est dirigee par Ba Seckou G.. Il sollicite ce credit pour renforcer son stock de fer et ciment. Ce qui leurs permettra de realiser davantage de benefice.

loans.use: Hardware store

loans.name: Llensi

texts.es:
La señora Llensi, socia del Grupo Mientras Tanto “LUZ Y ESPERANZA”, vive en la región y provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, golosinas, productos de limpieza. El negocio está dentro de su domicilio, ubicado en el AA. HH nueva esperanza - 14 de enero L-16 donde acuden diariamente a comprar los moradores, transeúntes del lugar.

Se inicia en el negocio porque quería apoyar a su esposo con las necesidades del hogar y educación de sus menores hijos. 
 
Con el préstamo de S/. 500.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en sacos, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas,  fideos, detergentes y papel higiénico en paquetes, gaseosas de diversas marcas, tamaños y sabores, entre otros. Quiere surtir bien el negocio para así poder llegar bien a sus clientes y satisfacer sus necesidades.

Llensi tiene 23 años y 2 hijos, los cuales aún dependen de ella. Cuenta con el apoyo del esposo para atender en el negocio. Su meta en el futuro es tener una tienda de abarrotes y poder vender al por mayor y menor a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Llensi is a member of the “Light and Hope" Grupo Mientras Tanto, (a "Grupo Mientras Tanto" is an interim group of borrowers not large enough to form a communal bank). She lives in the region and province of San Martín, in the district of Tarapoto and dedicates herself to the sale of groceries, snacks and cleaning products. Her business is in her home, located at AA. HH New Hope-January 14 L-16, where residents and passers-by come to shop daily.

She began her business because she wanted to support her husband with household expenses and the education of their young children.

With the loan of 500 Soles (about $175), to be repaid in 4 months, she will buy staples such as rice, bags of sugar, milk, oil, packaged goods, pasta, detergent, rolls of toilet paper, and sodas of various brands, sizes and flavors. She wants her store to be well-stocked in order to serve her customers well and to satisfy their needs.

Llensi is 23 years old and has 2 children who depend on her. She relies on her husband to help tend the business. Her goal for the future is to have a grocery store and to be able to sell both wholesale and retail to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Melissa Hays, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy staples such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, packaged goods, etc.

loans.name: Beatrice James's Jumuiya Kiluvya Group

texts.en:
Beatrice J., age 42, is single with two children (ages 25 and 18). She has a business of selling vouchers which she started 3 years ago. She works from 7.30am to 7pm daily and is able to make a monthly profit of about $60.

In the past, Beatrice has taken out three previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania to start selling sodas. She paid back her loans successfully. She hopes for a new loan to increase her stock of sodas and vouchers. Beatrice will share this loan with her group, Jumuiya Kuluvya, which totals 16 members. These members hold each other accountable in paying back their loans.

In the picture, Beatrice is second from right in a white blouse.

loans.use: To increase on stock of vouchers and sodas

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La Sra. Maria tiene 20 años de edad, habita en un barrio de la capital de Managua que se llama Memorial Sandino, es madre soltera de una bebe de 18 meses, le ha tocado dejarla con su mama que se la cuide ya que esta trabajando en una agencia de pollo Tip Top despachando comida rápida, es un trabajo duro ya que desde hora temprana sale de su casa para tomar una ruta que le lleve a su trabajo, empezó a trabajar desde hace quince meses ya que su marido falleció en un accidente, y tenia que buscar una alternativa para sastifacer sus necesidades como su bebe. Con la solicitud de dinero la quiere para invertir en infraestructura en la construcción de un cuarto para vivir aparte con su hijita ya que habita en la casa de su mama. A largo plazo es poder tener otro trabajo que le genere más ingresos y poder ahorrar para poder hacer su casa ya que es el sueño de toda mujer, poder tener salud para ver a su niña
texts.en:
Maria is twenty years old. She lives in a neighborhood of the capital, Managua, which is called Memorial Sandino. She is the single mother of an eighteen-month old baby, who she leaves with her mother to care for her little daughter while she is working in a chicken agency, Tip Top, serving fast food. It is a hard job since she leaves at an early hour from her home to get to work. She began working here fifteen months ago since her husband died in an accident and she has to find an alternative way to satisfy the needs of her baby. With the requested loan she wants to invest the money in constructing a room to live separately with her daughter since she currently lives in the house of her mother. In the long run, she wants to have another job that will give her a better income and be able to save money to make her home since that is the dream of every woman and to see her daughter with good health.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a room

loans.name: Sardarn M.nawaz Group

texts.en:
Sardarn baji is the wife of M. N. and resides in a city called Vehari in Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the past 50 years. She is the mother of three sons. Her elder son works in a poultry form and prepares chicken feed. The next is a delivery man and delivers fruits and vegetables from one place to another. Her youngest son drives an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Sardaran baji’s husband runs a tea stall in the community. People come to him to take tea. He charges Pak. rupees 5 for each cup of tea. Sardarn baji makes embroidered dresses at home and sells them in clothing shops and earns profit. She is applying for a loan to buy material (tea and sugar and milk) for her husband’s tea shop.

She is joined in her loan group by several more members. Zahooran baji wants a loan to buy wood to re-sell. Sajida baji wants a loan to buy seasonal fruit for her fruit-selling business. Kaneez baji wants a loan to buy clothes to re-sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her husband's tea stall

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is a member of the Retoño (“Sprout”) Village Bank.  Esperanza is 39 years old and is the single mother of one child.  

Esperanza lives in a rental property in the Los Artesanos neighborhood.  She travels to different regional markets to buy grains and cheeses, which she then sells in bulk to market vendors in Ayacucho.  Sometimes, she also works as a street vendor and sells her wares directly to the public.  Esperanza also knits custom-ordered sweaters.  

Esperanza needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy grains.  She dreams of building her own home and of providing her son with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow

Esperanza es socia del Banco Comunal Retoño. 
Esperanza es madre soltera, tiene 39 años y 1 hijo, Esperanza vive en una casa alquilada en el barrio de Los Artesanos, Esperanza viaja a las diferentes ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, quesos, que luego los comercializa por mayor a los comerciantes de los mercados, y en algunas oportunidades lo vende directamente de manera ambulatoria. Además Esperanza teje chompas variadas que realiza según pedido. 
Esperanza necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cereales. 
Esperanza sueña con construir su casa y brindar una buena educación a su hijo.

loans.use: Buy grains in regional markets

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel O. is twenty-nine years old. He is married and has no child at the moment. His wife is a hairdresser by profession. Sammy and his wife reside in Somanya in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Somanya is the native town of a tribe in Ghana called the ‘Krobos’. Though people of other tribes have migrated there as a result of their occupations, the Krobos are the dominant people in this land.

Samuel is a commercial driver. He owns a mini-bus which he uses as commercial transport. He conveys passengers and goods from his community to Accra and its environs. He has been driving for twelve good years and is full of rich experiences. Sammy says he wants a loan to repair his car so as to keep it in good working condition. It is his dream to put aside savings enough to buy a new and bigger bus.

loans.use: To repair his commercial vehicle

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marilyn B. has a food vending business. She is 34 years old and has four children. Her husband, Jose Noel B., is very supportive of her in her business. They work together to support the needs of their children.

Her business is located near the school. This gives Marilyn her regular customers and income. She uses her profit  from selling food to cover her family's daily expenses.
