She is asking for a CEVI loan of Php 8,000 ($175 USD). She will use the loan to buy food ingredients, and other items her business needs, to augment her income. She is also looking for some other possible income areas. In this way, she will have more sources of income for the family.

CEVI provides their clients credit assistance as well as training and insurance coverage to help their businesses grow.

loans.use: To buy additional ingredients for her food stand.

loans.name: Thi Lan's Group

texts.vi:
Chử Thị Lan sinh năm 1954. ( Mã số: 010105030012) Chồng chị đã mất, các con đã lớn và xây dựng gia đình thỉnh thoảng mới về thăm nom. Chị hiện đang sống cùng hai đứa cháu ngoại đang độ tuổi đi học. Chị có nghề đan chổi tre có thu nhập theo ngày, thu nhập bình quân của chị khoảng 2.000.000 VND/tháng. Chị vay mức vốn vay: 4.142.000 VND để mua tre về làm chổi. Chị là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay vốn gồm có: 
 Chử Thị H. sinh năm 1970,( Mã số: 010105030013)  chị vay mức vốn 4.142.000 VND để mua tre làm chổi nan.
 Trần Thị Tẩy sinh năm 1958 ( Mã số: 0101050300114 ) Chị cũng có nghề phụ là làm chổi, chị vay mức:4.142.000 VND để mua tre về làm chổi.
 Vũ Thị Yên sinh năm 1955. ( Mã số: 010105030018 )  Chị vay mức vốn: 4.142.000 VND để mua tre về đan chổi. Thu nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 2.000.000 VND/tháng.
 Nguyễn Thị Hà sinh năm 1977. ( Mã số: 010105030017 )  Gia đình chị có cửa hàng ăn sang, thu nhập bình quân khoảng 2.500.000 VND. Chị vay mức vốn: 4.142.000 VND để đầu tư cửa hàng.
 Cao Thị Nguyệt sinh năm 1982 , ( Mã số: 010105030016 )  chị làm ngề đan chổi tre, tham gia mức vốn: 3.270.000 VND để mua tre về đan chổi.
 Bùi Thị Lâm sinh năm 1962, ( Mã số: 010105030015)  chị làm thuê có thu nhập, thu nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng: 2.000.000 VND. Chị vay mức vốn: 3.270.000 VND để chăn nuôi gà.
texts.en:
Mrs. C. T. Lan (ID No: 010105030012), as born in 1954. Her husband passed away and her children have their own families so they only visit her once in a while. She currently stays with her two young grandchildren. She makes brooms for a living with a daily income. Her average monthly income is 2 millions VND. She would like to borrow 4,142,000VND to buy bamboos to make brooms. She is the group leader of a group consisting of:
  • Mrs. C. T. H. (ID No: 010105030013), born in 1970. She would like to borrow 4,142,000VND to purchase bamboo to make brooms.
  • Mrs. Tran T. T. (ID No: 0101050300114), born in 1958. She would like to borrow 4,142,000VND to purchase bamboo to make brooms.
  • Mrs. Vu T. Y. (ID No: 010105030018), born in 1955.She would like to borrow 4,142,000VND to purchase bamboo to make brooms. Her family's iaverage monthly income is 2 millions VND.
  • Mrs. NguY. T. H. (ID No: 010105030017), born in 1977. Her family has a breakfast eatery with a monthly income of 2,500,000VND. She would like to borrow 4,142,000VND to invest in her eatery.
  • Mrs. Cao T. N. (ID No: 010105030016), born in 1982. She would like to borrow 3,270,000VND to purchase bamboo to make brooms.
  • Mrs. Bui T. L. (ID No: 010105030015), born in 1962. She is a worker for hire, with an average monthly income of 2 millions VND. She would like to borrow 3,270,000VND to rear chickens.

    • Translated from Vietnamese by Y. Thanh Pham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: making bamboo brooms

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica sells second hand clothes. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N140,000 to purchase more second hand clothes to sell. She is 40 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Asli

texts.ru: Давлатов Асли проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 47 лет, женат и имеет пятерых детей. Работает в дехканском хозяйстве , а так же в сфере животноводства. Имеет хозяйство , где разводит крупно рогатый скот. Обратился зха кредитом для того, чтобы купить дойную корову. Это поможет ему обеспечить семью молоком , а так же кисло молочными продуктами.
texts.en:
Asli D. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi district. He is 47 years old, married and has five children. He works at a dekhan farm and also in the sphere of animal husbandry. Asli has a farm where he breeds cattle. He requested this loan to buy a dairy cow. This will help him to provide his family with milk and other dairy products.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
The happy face in the picture is Mrs. Rin P., 40, who lives in a rural area of the province of Siem Reap. Mrs. P. and her husband currently make a daily income of $5 per day working as carrying workers in the fish market. The couple has five children who are single; most of them are not long in school.

To help respond to the family's demands, two of their children work as carry workers at the same place. The family has been building their house for a long time but their house still needs spare parts. That is why P. has decided to seek a loan, to buy housing equipment to finish building their house.

loans.use: To buy housing equipment

loans.name: Kanoumafin Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kanoumafin est composé de femmes 2 veuves et 4 femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 52 ans et 4 enfants et habitent toutes le quartier Bamanan kin de Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Ce groupe de femmes est aussi encadré par l’ONG ROCAM dans le domaine de la teinture, alphabétisation, assainissement et la réorganisation des tontines en caisses de micro crédit  avec un intérêt de 10% par mois. 
Ce groupe fait  le commerce de produits cosmétiques, de pagnes, de céréales, de chaussures, de condiments alimentaires, du savon etc.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont intégré le programme crédit solidaire de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursé les prêts précédents. 
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 57pièces de pagnes wax, 2 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs de riz, 1sac de haricot, 1 sac d’oignon de 25 kg, 1 sac de savon local contenant 300 morceaux et 20 paires de chaussures. Elles se ravitaillent en pagnes wax et chaussures au grand marché de Bamako, en céréales à Koutiala, en oignon et savons à la foire de Diamarabougou. Les produits sont revendus à crédit ou au comptant dans les foires de Diamarabougou, Sibila, Boussin, Dougabougou et Siribala à une clientèle mixte. 
Elles comptent  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 43 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour augmenter leur fonds de commerce et acheter petit à petit des trousseaux de mariage pour leurs filles.
texts.en:
The group Kanoumafin is composed of women (2 widows and 4 who are married) mostly in monogamous families. The women average 52 years of age and 4 children each. They all live in the Bamanan Kin district of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). This group of women is also trained by the NGO ROCAM in the dyeing of cloth, literacy, sanitation, and organizing micro-credit tontines banks with an interest rate of 10% a month. This group does commerce in cosmetics, pagnes (colorful West African cloth), grains, shoes, condiments, soap, etc. To satisfy customer needs, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their fourth solidarity loan, after having indeed repaid their preceding loans. This current loan will be used to buy 57 bolts of Wax pagnes, two sacks of corn, two sacks of rice, a sack of beans, a 25-kg sack of onions, a 300-count sack of local soap, and 20 pairs of shoes. The women resupply themselves with Wax pagnes and shoes at the grand marketplace of Bamako; with grains in Koutiala; and with onions and soaps at the Diamarabougou fair. The goods are resold to a mixed customer base, cash or credit accepted, at the fairs of Diamarabougou, Sibila, Boussin, Dougabougou, and Siribala. The group members intend to realize an average monthly profit of 43,000 francs CFA that will use to augment their working capital and to buy trousseaux, little by little, for their daughters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Bi Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is married with four sister-wives and has eight children. Lydia has seen death come unexpectedly when one of her children was bitten by a snake and died within four hours. In her small village of Baicham, in the hills of Belo, Cameroon, she uses her farm as a source of income for her family. With this loan, Lydia plans to pay for labor costs to clear and weed her farm. She will also use some of the money for home improvement.

Having been a farmer for many years, she knows that she will produce a successful crop with this money. She has already contributed 35,000 CFA (about $70) of her own money to these projects. For her house, she has already finished molding the bricks. By employing young adults to work on her farm, i.e. “stopping idleness,” she sees that she is helping the community.

With the profits from this loan, she will pay for her children’s school fees, improve her living conditions and increase her farm inputs. This is Lydia’s second loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2008. Lydia takes out GHAPE loans because “GHAPE is out to help the poor” and she prefers paying back her loan in small instalments.

About GHAPE Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and a strong bond of trust has developed between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To pay labor costs for clearing and weeding farm

loans.name: Azam

texts.en: Z. Azam is 30 years old and is married with three children. For the past nine years he has been running a small road-side shop selling hardware. His shop is located by an auto-repair yard as well as a large carpentry business, so his sales are increasing. Azam has been engaged in this business for the past nine years. Currently he is in need of a loan of 3,000 Somoni to expand his hardware product line to supply the increased requests he is receiving. Be an important part of the growth of Azam‘s business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell

loans.name: Shahodat

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 

Шаходат Гайбуллоева торгует на рынке. Продает парфюмерию и хозяйственные товары. Растит детей, у нее 1 сын и 2 дочери. Трудно приходится Шаходат без мужа, он умер 6 лет назад. В годы своей жизни они занимались торговлей вместе, теперь в этом Шаходат помогает ее сын Акмал. Помогает маме торговать, расставляет продукцию по полкам, присматривает за магазином, когда мама отлучается.  
 Шаходат хочет получить кредит, для того чтобы использовать его в расширении ассортимента товара.
texts.en:
Shahodat G. sells perfumes and household goods at the market. She is raising her children – she has 1 son and 2 daughters. It is difficult for Shahodat without a husband, who passed away 6 years ago. During their years of life, they were involved in sales together, and now Shahodat’s son, Akmal, helps her. He helps his mother sell, organize products on the shelves and look after the store, when his mother has to step away. Shahodat wants to obtain a loan in order to use it for expanding her goods assortment.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding goods assortment

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene has owned and run a small retail shop for the past six years. A 25-year-old mother of two, Irene has requested her first loan of Ksh. 20,000 in order to buy a stock of cereals, wheat and maize flour. She hopes that this loan will help to raise her income and allow her to pay school fees for her children. One day, Irene wants to buy a plot of land and build her own home away from the Mukuru slums where she currently lives and works. Irene describes herself as sincere and loving.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a deposit-taking microfinance company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: Buy stock of cereals

loans.name: Las Estrellitas De Marquez Group

texts.es:
ALCOM LAS ESTRELLITAS D. MARQUEZ	

Marciana C. D. Martínez tiene 60 años es casada con 4 hijos, vive en Márquez   Callao.
La señora Marciana integra el grupo ALCOM LAS ESTRELLITAS D. MARQUEZ,  conformado por 12 socias.
Conoció al grupo mediante una invitación donD. la animaron a formar parte actualmente es la presidenta y lleva en ese cargo  año y medio.
Ella nos cuenta  que empezó vendiendo productos D. belleza, ofrecía los productos que tenia en stock  se inicio con un mini bazar donD. exhibía sus productos ala vez que se ayudaba con la venta D. regalos y gaseosas.  su labor era tan sacrificada que muchas veces se quedaba hasta las 12 D. la noche,  por un tiempo fue ambulante en un mercado llevando sus productos  D. belleza, esto lo hacia con el fin D. mejorar la economía D. su hogar y colaborar con su esposo en la adquisición  D. un terreno para su vivienda y la construcción D. este mismo, con  el esfuerzo D. ambos lograron adquirir un auto con el cual trabaja su esposo ya que la empresa para la cual laboraba quebró y quedo sin trabajo.
La señora marciana se siente orgullosa D. los logros obtenidos ya que mejoro su calidad D. vida y la D. su familia, Este  negocio le ha permitido brindarle una mejor educación a sus 4 hijos actualmente apoya a su hija q estudia una carrera.
Con el préstamo que EDAPROSPO le otorgara invertirá una parte en su negocio y otra parte para avanzar en la construcción D. su casa para poder alquilar cuartos y D. esta manera asegurar su futuro y el D. su familia.

* La señora Marciana  C. D. Martínez aparece sentada rodeada del grupo
texts.en:
Marciana C. D. Martínez is a 60-year-old married mother with 4 children. She lives in Márquez , Callao. Ms. C. is a member of the ALCOM LAS ESTRELLITAS D. MARQUEZ Group, which consists of 12 members.

She learned about the group after she was invited to join. She is currently the president, and has held this post for a year-and-a-half.

She states that she started out selling beauty products. She used to sell the products that she had in stock. She first set up a mini bazaar where she sold her products, concurrently selling gifts and candy to get by. She worked so hard that she would sometimes stay until midnight. For a while, she was also a street vendor at a market, selling her beauty products. She did this in order to improve her household income and collaborate with her husband in obtaining a plot of land on which they can start building their house. After much hard work, they managed to obtain the car that her husband uses for work. The company for which he used to work went under and he was left unemployed.

Ms. C. feels very proud of her achievements because she has been able to improve her and her family’s quality of life. This business has allowed her to proviD. her 4 children with a better education. She is currently helping her daughter who is attending college. She will invest part of this EDAPROSPO loan in her business, and the other part in building her house so that she can rent out rooms, thus assuring her family’s future. * Ms. C. is sitting in this picture, surrounded by her fellow group members.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in beauty products

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
La señora Celia es socia del Banco Comunal “Jesús de Nazareth”, ubicado en el Centro poblado de López del distrito de Ilave, provincia de el Collao, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 40 años de edad, es casada y madre de 4 hijos, ella estudio secundaria incompleta (3er grado), y  vive  en la comunidad de Jamachi.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 4 meses, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para la compra de productos de la región.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo adicional, por ello viene solicitando la suma de S/. 1200.00 nuevos soles, este dinero ella lo invertirá en la compra de ovejas para mejorarlos y  venderlos en la feria de Ilave.

Su deseo es darles una educación a sus hijos.

A ella le gustan  los ahorros y las reuniones.

loans.use: Para la compra de ovejas.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 55 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 4 hijos: Marino de 25, Delia de 24, Yolanda de 22 y Néstor de 13 años, a quienes desea darles una buena vida. Su puesto de golosinas es uno de los más concurridos de su barrio, ella es una vendedora muy alegre y convincente, por lo que trata de atender muy bien a sus clientes para que siempre regresen. Si bien la mercancía que tiene no es mucha, Margarita siempre se las arregla para comprar solo lo que más demanda tiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes, tiene 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer todo el día pendiente de su puesto para que no se pierda nada. Para el futuro espera tener una bodega donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes.
Este es el cuarto préstamo de Margarita con MFP y está muy contenta por la oportunidad de crédito, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo para no perjudicar a sus compañeras de banco comunal, donde es muy querida. Con los setecientos nuevos soles solicitados comprará más productos para implementar mejor su puesto de golosinas.
texts.en:
Margarita, 55, is a very happy mother. She lives in her own house with her four children. Marino is 25, Delia is 24, Yolanda is 22, and Néstor is 13. She wants to give them a good life. Her candy stand is one of the busiest in her neighborhood. She is a very cheerful and convincing salesperson. She tries to take very good care of her customers so that they always return. If she does not have much merchandise, Margarita always arranges to buy only what is in the most demand. What she likes best about her work is talking with her customers. She has been in this business for ten years. The most difficult part is having to stay at her stand all day so she does not miss anything. In the future she hopes to have a store when she can better wait on her customers. This is Margarita’s fourth loan with MFP. She is very happy to have the opportunity of the loan. She knows that she has to make all of her payments on time so she does not hurt her colleagues in her communal bank where she is much loved. She will use the 700 PEN that she is asking for to buy more products to better stock her candy stand.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es:
Eduarda tiene 61 años, vive con una de sus hijas en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las tareas agrícolas, actualmente siembra papa, habas y maíz y también cría ganado porcino en su mismo establo. Los cerdos que tiene, los vende mientras espera la cosecha, pues una vez llegada esta temporada su trabajo en sus terrenos de cultivo se intensifica, seleccionando cuidadosamente su producción que posteriormente vende poco a poco de acuerdo a la demanda del mercado. A Eduarda le conviene vender cuando pagan más por  el kilaje y es por eso que tiene un almacén grande donde guarda sus cosechas. Para ella, la ventaja de trabajar en la agricultura es que siempre tiene los alimentos para su consumo a la mano.
Esta es la sexta oportunidad en que  tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella es una persona puntual en sus pagos y se compromete a seguir trabajando de esa manera con sus créditos. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará en la compra de sacos de abono para su próxima siembra de maíz.
texts.en:
Eduarda is 61 years old, and she lives with one of her daughters in her own house. For her entire life, she has been involved with agricultural work, currently she is sowing potatoes, beans, and corn. She also raises pigs as livestock in the same stable. She sells the pigs that she has while she is waiting for the harvest. When the season arrives, her work in the crop lands intensifies, and she carefully selects the production that she would later sell little by little in accordance with the demand of the market. It is better for Eduarda to sell when they pay more per kilogram and for this reason, she has a big warehouse where she saves her harvests. For her, the advantage of working in agriculture is that she always has the food for her own consumption on hand.

This is the sixth opportunity that she has had a loan with MFP. She is a very punctual person with her payments and she is committed to continue working in this way with her loans. The money that she is requesting now will be utilized in the purchase of sacks of fertilizer for the next corn harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ayitédji Joséphine

texts.fr: N. Ayitédji Joséphine est née vers 1956 à Ifangni, village situé à proximité de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Ayitédji Joséphine vit depuis treize ans au quartier Danto à Porto-Novo. Mariée à KODJO Paul, Ayitédji Joséphine est mère de quatre enfants, dont un seulement est à sa charge. Certains de ses enfants sont scolarisés. Ayitédji Joséphine et Paul supportent ensemble les charges de la famille. Ayant arrêté les classes au cours primaire, Ayitédji Joséphine s’est très tôt mise à vendre pour subvenir à ses besoins.  En effet, il y a vingt sept ans déjà que Ayitédji Joséphine vend de la nourriture (pâte de maïs, sauce de tomate, accompagnés de poissons frits) et de l’amuse gueule (fait à base de farine de blé) au CEG Danto. Ayitédji Joséphine est également une couturière qui a son atelier de couture à son domicile. Ayitédji Joséphine fait ses emplettes au marché Ouando à Porto-Novo. C’est pour la première fois que Ayitédji Joséphine sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé, pour renforcer son activité et accroître son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
Ayitédji Joséphine N. was born about 1956 in Ifangni, a town located near to Porto Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Ayitédji Joséphine has lived for thirteen years in the neighborhood of Danto in Porto Novo. She is married to Paul Kodjo. Ayitédji Joséphine is the mother of four children, of which only one is in her care. Some of her children attend school. Ayitédji Joséphine and Paul bear together the family expenses. Having quit primary school, Ayitédji Joséphine began selling very early to provide for her needs. In fact, for twenty seven years already Ayitédji Joséphine has la nourriture (pate of corn, tomato sauce, accompanied by fried fish) and l’amuse gueule (made from a wheat flour base) in the CEG Danto. Ayitédji Joséphine is also a dressmaker that has her sewing workshop in her residence. Ayitédji Joséphine makes her purchases in the Ouando market of Porto Novo. This is the first time that Ayitédji Joséphine has requested a loan with ALIDé, to build her business and increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn, fried fish and condiments (tomato sauce, onions, hot peppers, etc.)

loans.name: Hamadi

texts.en: Hamadi H. is a businessman from Dar es Salaam. He is married and has two children. He runs a food shop business in the Kitunda district of Dar es Salaam, and has been in this business for three years. Hamadi purchases goods wholesale and sells them to his customers retail. He is requesting a loan of 600,000 TZS to buy more goods so he can meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: To expand his business

loans.name: Mayra De Jesus

texts.es: La señora Mayra de Jesús Rodríguez, es una señora dedicada a la venta de ropa, zapato, carteras y demás accesorios, ambulante en diferente departamento del país, desde hace cinco años, la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es que no tiene un transporte seguro para trasladar la mercadería, ya que en ocasiones a perdido su producto, con el primer financiamiento logro tener mas inventario y abastecer mas clientes , ella inicio esta actividad con la liquidación de su trabajo anterior , a la vez cuenta con el apoyo de sus cuatro hijos los cuales ayudan en el negocio en diferentes días ya que estos estudian para poder ayudar a su mamá en un futuro económicamente  y poder darle mejores condiciones de vida. Agradece ala institución por el financiamiento el cual comprara ropa, y zapatos para incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Mayra de Jesús Rodríguez is a dedicated woman who sells clothes, shoes, purses, and other accessories. She is a street vendor in a different department of the country. She has been doing this for five years. The greatest difficulty she has is not having safe transportation to transport her merchandise. She has occasionally lost her products. With her first loan she was able to get more inventory and provide for her customers. She started this activity upon liquidation of her previous work. She has the support of her four children, who help in the business on different days. They are in school to be able to help their mother economically in the future. They will also be able to provide better living conditions. She is grateful to the institution for the loan, which she will use to buy clothes and shoes to increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more soap, salt and clothing in bulk

loans.name: Ney

texts.en:
Mrs. Ney S. lives in Chung Ankor village in the Takeo province. Her husband is presented in the picture. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land on which she cultivates rice. On this plantation, she faces an obstacle because she does not have enough money to buy farming supplies to support the field. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline to support the rice farming. 

Her husband, Mr. Pin Phum, is a construction worker. This couple has a child who is just 2 years old.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and gasoline to support rice farming

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
N. Christine M. is a businesswoman and is married with three children, all school-going. She lives at Kigunga and her business is situated in Kigunga Trading Centre.

Christine is using the loan to purchase garments or clothing material for making designs for her customers, hence expanding her business. Her future dream is to expand her business and try her best to have all her children complete their education successfully.

loans.use: To purchase garments or clothing material to expand her business

loans.name: We Heart Dae Group

texts.en:
These are members of 'We Heart Dae' group from the township of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. They are petty businesspeople who want a loan of SLL 500,000 each to enable them to expand their businesses. 

The leader of the group is 40-year-old Fatu K. on the left in the photo. Fatu, who is married to a businessman and the mother of 4 children, sells market food like onions, 'margi' (used to give sauce a sweet taste), rice, and sugar. Fatu has 20 years of experience in this business. With her share of this loan, she will buy 'margi' in cartons, bags of onions, and bags of rice to add to her business.

loans.use: Buy margi in cartons, bags of onions, and bags of rice to add to her business inventory

loans.name: Urinova Bahtigul's Group

texts.en:
U. Bahtigul is 41 years old. She is the leader of this group. Her husband is a builder. She has four sons. The eldest son works with his father, and the second oldest son is in Russia. The other sons study at school. She is involved in the cattle fatting business. She currently has one calf and one milk cow. She also produces milk products and sells them in Aravan. This loan will be used to buy one milk cow with calf in order to increase milk production. In the future, she hopes to open a big farm.

Hamid, age 40, is divorced. He has three grown sons, and all of them help him with agriculture. He has one hectare of land on which he cultivates cotton. He has been involved in this since 1996. This loan will allow him to buy cotton seeds and mineral fertilizer.

Haticha is 42 years old. She is a married woman with five children. Her husband is a builder and electrician. Usually, the building season opens in spring and continues until late autumn. In winter, her husband is usually at home, looking after the household. This loan will be used to buy cement, lime, and paint in order to repair their house.

Adinahan is 22 years old and is not married yet. She lives with her parents. Her father is a tractor driver, and her mother is a housewife. They have a little household where they fatten cattle. This loan will be used to buy four sheep. She is now preparing for a wedding and buying dowry for herself.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and the Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To buy one milk cow with calf

loans.name: Larry Luis

texts.es: Larry de 33 años de edad, labora para el MINSA Chontales desde hace 15 años como conductor, tiene 2 niñas de su primer matrimonio, Brittany de 8 años y Yatzari de 5 añitos estudiando primaria y preescolar respectivamente, actualmente vive en union libre con la Sra. Yessi Navarrete quien le apoya con los gastos del hogar.  Anteriormente Larry fue beneficiado con kiva logrando la construccion de un cuarto para sus hijas, ahora esta solicitando su 6to credito y espera seguir siendo beneficiado con kiva para poner ceramica a la salita de su casa, embaldozar el cuarto que actualmente es de tierra y si da comprar la puerta de la sala para brindarle mayor seguridad a su vivienda, pues como los 2 trabajan en el dia la casa queda sola y pueden llegar a su casa a robarle lo que con esfuerzo a comprado. Expresa que gracias a los creditos que le han financiado ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, y espera poder seguir haciendolo con el apoyo de instituciones como kiva y AFODENIC.
texts.en:
Larry is 33 years old. He has worked for MINSA Chontales for fifteen years as a driver. He has two daughters from his first marriage. Brittany is eight years old and Yatzari is five years old. They are in elementary and preschool respectively. Currently he lives with Mrs. Yessi who helps him with his home expenses. Previously Larry had a loan from KIVA that helped with the construction of a room for his daughters. Now he is asking for his sixth loan. He hopes to continue his relationship with KIVA. He would like to install tile at the entrance of his house. Currently the location has dirt. He would like a door for the living room in order to give his home more security. Since the couple both work during the day the house is empty during this time. Anyone could come to his house and rob it using some effort. He is thankful for the credit that they have financed. He has been able to improve the living conditions for his family. He hopes to continue progressing with the help of institutions such as KIVA and AFODENIC

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile in the living room and tile the bedrooms.

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en: Teopista is a 60-year-old widow with five children ages 8-25. Three of her children go to school and the other two have died. Teopista owns a four-room house with electricity and piped water where she lives with eight people.  Teopista takes care of additional family members  The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala and she works seven days a week.  She serves about 20 customers a day selling charcoal.  The major challenges she faces in her business are monthly market dues, medication, thieves, feeding the family, and increasing prices of charcoal. Besides this charcoal business she also sells bananas and roasted maize.  Teopista has been with MCDT for six and a half years and is requesting her eleventh loan working with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more sacks of charcoal and bunches of bananas. Teopista hopes her business will grow bigger and she aims to own a permanent business structure.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal and bunches of bananas.

loans.name: C5197 Inkoramutima Group

texts.en:
Felicita is 33 years old and married. She has three children who are 3, 7 and 11 years old. Felicita is the president of a group called Inkoramutima. This group is commonly known in the business of sewing clothes. This is their fourth successful year in this business, which they run from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. every day.

Felicita and her team need to request a Kiva loan to buy additional sewing machines, including one over-sewing/over-casting machine and some clothing items needed in their business. With this loan, this team hopes to earn more profits which, in turn, will be used for the further reinvestment in their business. They hope to develop a sustainable business and build a secure future for their families. They also have a vision of rearing domestic animals, mainly cows, sheep and goats.

loans.use: Additional sewing machines, including one over-sewing/over-casting machine, and some clothing items

loans.name: Oyun-Erdene

texts.en:
Oyun-Erdene is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters in Arhangai province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a 'ger', the traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Oyun-Erdene operates a meat-trading business in her town. She started her business in 2000 with a working capital of (~ 650 USD). After years of successful operations she has managed to increase her working capital to more than 4,500,000 tugrugs (~  3251 USD). 

Oyun-Erdene purchases meat at wholesale prices in the 'soums' of Bulgan and Tsenher, and resells it for a profit. Over the years, she has gained much experience and built up a loyal customer base. Oyun-Erdene is an honest person who has good communication skills. She is requesting a 4,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.use: To purchase meat

loans.name: Laing's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Laing S. is 63 years old and is the leader of a group loan. She was selected by nine members who are located in Preak Ta Hang village in Kandal province.  Each member of this group loan will uS. the loan for a different purpoS.. Mrs. Laing S. and her husband, Mr. Oeng Seab, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate corn. Mrs. Laing S. decided to ask for a loan to buy corn seed to support her farming crop. This couple has a child who is at home and helps on the farm.

loans.use: To buy corn seed

loans.name: Felicidad De Emprender Group

texts.es:
LAS CLIENTES QUE PERTENECEN A LA BANCA FELICIDAD DE EMPRENDER, TIENEN LA CARACTERÍSTICA DE TENER UN MUY BUEN HUMOR, SE LA PASAN ALEGRES Y RIENDO YA QUE EL ESPACIO DE REUNION SE CONVIERTE EN UN ESPACIO DE ENCUENTRO EN EL QUE ELLAS SE OLVIDAN DE LOS PROBLEMAS POR LOS CUALES ATRAVIEZAN, POR ESO ES QUE ELIGIERON EL NOMBRE DE "FELICIDAD".

LA PRESIDENTA LA SRA. SILVIA ES UNA SEÑORA MUY ALEGRE QUE HA PASADO POR MUCHOS PROBLEMAS A LO LARGO DE SU VIDA, ES PAPÁ Y MAMÁ DE SUS DOS PEQUEÑOS QUE ESTAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, SOLA TIENE CUMPLIR LAS DOS FUNCIONES, ELLA SOLA MANTIENE EL HOGAR, TIENE UNA TIENDA DE MUEBLES EN LA FERIA  16 DE JULIO, LOS DIAS JUEVES Y DOMINGO, EL RESTO DE LA SEMANA SE DEDICA A LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE CELULARES A MEDIO USO LOS CUALES LOS REVENDE A MEJOR PRECIO, TIENE CASA PROPIA LA CUAL QUIERE HACER CONSTRUIR PARA VIVIR MEJOR, EL DINERO DEL CREDITO LO UTILIZARA EN LA COMPRA DE CELULARES AL POR MAYOR Y DESPUES VENDERLOS Y TENER MAS UTILIDAD Y ASI PODER MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE TODA SU FAMILIA. 

LA SEÑORA REBECA ES LA TESORERA, ES UNA CLIENTE JOVEN QUE ESTA FORMANDO SU HOGAR, AYUDA A SU TIA EN COSTURA DE PANTALONES Y C. ESTE PRIMER CREDITO COMPRARA TELAS PARA INDEPENDIZARSE EL ANHELO QUE ELLA TIENE ES LOGRAR UN TALLER DE COSTURA PROPIO.

TODAS LAS SOCIAS ESTAN AGRADECIDAS C. EMPRENDER Y KIVA POR LA CONFIANZA BRINDADA EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
The customers that belong to Emprender's FELICIDAD community bank share a characteristic: they are good humored. At their meetings, they tell jokes and laugh, the space where they meet becoming for them a place where they can forget their troubles. That's why they chose the name "Felicidad" (which means "happiness"). The president, Sra. SILVIA, is a happy woman who has had her share of life's problems. She is father and mother to her two children, both school age, and she fills both roles. She takes care of the house and operates a furniture business at the 16 de Julio market on Thursdays and Sundays. The rest of the week, she buys cell phones and sells them for a profit. She owns her own house and she wants to improve it. She will use the loan to buy wholesale supplies of cell phones that she will then resell. Her earnings will help her improve her family's quality of life. The treasurer, Sra. REBECA, is a young woman still making her own way in the world. She helps her aunt make trousers and she will use this loan to buy material so that she can set up her own business. She hopes to have her own tailoring shop one of these days. All the members are grateful to Emprender and Kiva for the confidence they have shown in extending these loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Quetonu Group

texts.en:
Grace M., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Quetonu.  She is 35 years-old, unmarried and has one child who is eight years old. She is a university graduate. She cares for two siblings. 

For six years, she has been selling used clothes at the Via Town Market, Monrovia, Liberia.

She plans to use her 6,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes. 

Her goal is to improve her business and continue to support her child for a better future.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Frances is inset in the lower right because she was absent during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes.

loans.name: Yanira Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yanira del Carmen, tiene 35 años de edad, residen en el Municipio de Cacaopera del Departamento de  Morazán, está acompañada y tiene dos hijos de las edades de 8 y 12 años, ella tiene un negocio de ventas de verduras y frutas.
Ella tiene dos años de manejar el negocio, y está ubicado en un lugar de mayor demanda y tránsito de personas de la localidad, atiende su venta de 7:am a 5:pm en la  vida pública, ella es una persona trabajadora, honesta, que con las ganancias de su venta mantiene las necesidades de su familia.
Ella actualmente necesita un préstamo para compra de productos como son: tomates, cebollas, repollos, plátanos y naranjas entre otros con esto ella espera mejor sus ventas, y dar a su clientes variedad de productos que le demandan y por falta de dinero no los puede comprar.
Las aspiraciones de Yanira son crecer su negocio y de ser posible a futuro comprar con sus ahorros  un Vehículo para salir a vender a otros lugares de esa forma, mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y apoyar a sus hijos con los estudios.
texts.en:
Yanira del Carmen, 35, lives in the municipality of Cacaopera in the Morazán department. She has a partner and 2 sons, aged 8 and 12. She has a business selling vegetables and fruit. She has been running this business for 2 years. It is located in a place with high demand, where many local people pass through. She attends to her store from 7am until 5pm. In the community she is a person who is known to be hardworking and honest. With the earnings from her store, she is able to support the basic needs of the family. She currently needs a loan to buy products such as: tomatoes, onions, cabbage, bananas, oranges, and other items. With this she hopes to increase her sales and give her customers the variety of products that they want but that she was not able to buy due to lack of funds. Yanira's aspirations are to grow her business and possibly in the future buy, with her savings, a vehicle so that she could sell in other places, so as to improve the quality of life of her family and support her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar: tomates, cebollas, repollos, plátanos y naranjas.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Joice K. currently sells various items like sugar and salt in a shop.  She is requesting a loan to stock more boxes of washing powder and soap to sell.  Joice is 31 years old and is married.  Her husband is a teacher. The couple has 3 children, who attend school. 

With the extra profits resulting from her loan, Joice hopes to be able to extend the floor of her shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more boxes of washing powder and soap to sell

loans.name: Elma

texts.en: Elma D. is from the village of Owaon. She is 54 years old and is married with two adult children. Elma owns and operates a general store, selling daily-use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month. In 2007, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Elma is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP which will be used to repair her house. This loan will be her 7th from PMPC. She also plans to use any additional revenue generated from her business to make improvements to her house. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma L. is from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga. She is 38 years old, married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling of household items in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Gemma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used for house repair. This loan will be the eighth taken out by Gemma from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: For house repair

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma C. is a widow  who lives in Magsasaka, Brgy. Teresa, Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: a general store, a farm, and a fishing business. She has one child who is 25 years old. 

Vilma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past nine loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Vilma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 63,000 PHP, bettering the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing 25,000, which she intends to use to buy more stocks for her general store and gear and parts for her fishing boat. She hopes that she could save enough from her earnings for the future education of her grandson and improve the quality of life of her family.  Vilma C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: inventory for general store; fishing gear; fishing boat parts

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife D. lives in the village of Hinaplanan, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 38 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She makes a living running a specialized store where she buys and sells bananas. Marife has been in this line of work for more than eight years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marife joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid five previous loans from HSPFI and is applying for a new one, for 5,000 PHP, to buy additional items to sell to her customers. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to continue expanding her business.  

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa L. is from the village of Igpit, Luz Banzon, Jasaan,  Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Elsa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a business providing motorcycle or habal-habal services to local community members. Her husband is the driver. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Madira

texts.en:
Madira J. is 42 years old and lives in the town of Arua in the West Nile region of Uganda.  He is married and has four children.  Three of his children are currently in school.  Madira has a business in selling hardware and other accessories  He has had this business for over 10 years.         

To help expand his business, Madira has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more items like radios, cables, and adapters.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Madira hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees.  In the future, Madira hopes to return this loan and get another loan.

loans.use: To buy more items like radios, cables, and adapters

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María participa del banco comunal “Pueblo de Indios Emprende” perteneciente a la comuna de San Vicente de Tagua Tagua. Ella tiene una botillería en su casa, hace aproximadamente 20 años, la cual atiende junto a su hija. Su esposo también le ayuda cuando no está en su puesto de verduras en la feria. Tanto María, su hija y su esposo trabajan con Fondo Esperanza. Su hija, quien tiene un hijo de 5 años, además hace pan amasado, los fines de semana, para vender también en la casa. 
Con este préstamo María invertirá en bebidas con y sin alcohol.  Su sueño es tener una casa firme (de material sólido), ya que producto del terremoto del pasado 27 de febrero perdió por completo la que tenía, al igual que toda su mercadería. Luego del terremoto María, su esposo, su hija y su nieto vivieron 1 mes en una carpa, hasta que por medio de Fondo Esperanza obtuvieron una mediagua (pequeña casa provisoria hecha de paneles de madera). 
María está muy agradecida del apoyo que le ha dado FE a ella y su familia, no solo por los préstamos, sino por la preocupación que ha demostrado por ellos, sobre todo después del terremoto. 
San Vicente de Tagua Tagua es una comuna de la zona central de Chile, perteneciente a la región del Libertador General Bernardo O’higgins, emplazada a orillas del río Estero Zamorano. Su principal fuente económica se basa en la producción de limones, naranjas y paltas.
texts.en:
Maria is a member of the “Pueblo de Indios Emprende” communal bank in the community of San Vicente de Tagua Tagua. She has a small liquor store that she has run from her home for the last 20 years, where she and her daughter both work. Her husband also helps out when he is not working at the vegetable stand he has at a local fair. Maria, her daughter and her husband all work with Fondo Esperanza [the Kiva field partner]. Her daughter, who has a 5-year-old son, also makes fresh bread on the weekends to sell from their home.

With this loan, Maria plans to buy both alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks. Her dream is to have a well-built house, made of good solid materials, because she lost both her house and all of her merchandise in the earthquake that hit Chile this past February. After the earthquake, Maria, her husband, her daughter and her grandson lived in a tent for one month. Through Fondo Esperanza they were able to get a small temporary dwelling made from wood panels. 
 
Maria is very thankful for the support that Fondo Esperanza has given to her and her family, not only for the loans but also for the concern that they have shown them, particularly after the earthquake.

San Vicente de Tagua Tagua is a community in Chile's central zone, in the region of Libertador General Bernardo O’Higgins, located on the banks of the Estero Zamorano river. The main economic activity in the area is the cultivation of lemons, oranges and avocados.

loans.use: Alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Rosalia Petrona

texts.es: Rosalía Petrona tiene 50 años es casada y tiene 2 hijos menores de edad. La señora tiene ubicada en la terminal de buses, su actividad que es la venta de frutas y verduras  la cual es administrada personalmente por ella, además de esto su mama. Sus ventas son siempre de contado, igualmente tiene que comprar al contado. Ella empezó con este negocio desde hace 6 años y medio, este dio inicio cuando su esposo estaba desempleado, sin embargo ella observo que el negocio era rentable, por lo que decidieron continuar con el mismo. El crédito solicitado por la señora será invertido en la compra de inventario para su negocio. Su sueño siempre ha sido llegar a tener un pequeño terreno para cultivar frutas y verduras ya que así le favorecería.
texts.en: Rosalía has been married for fifty years and has two grown children. She sells fruits and vegetables at the bus terminal beside her mother.  Her sales are on the spot and she purchases her inventory on the spot. She started this business six and a half years ago when her husband was unemployed. Never the less, her business is profitable, which is why she has continued with it. The loan that she is requesting will be used to buy inventory for her business. Her dream is to own a small piece of land where she can grow the fruits and vegetables that her customers would desire.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Las Inseparables Group

texts.es:
La B.C. “Las Inseparables” inicia su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Cascada, es un grupo nuevo que se ha reunido para recibir los servicios de crédito, capacitación y atención en salud.    La banca comunal está compuesta por once integrantes.  Los negocios que desempeñan son: tienda surtida y tejido de mantas, venta de ropa, venta de frutas, hilado de lana de vicuña, venta de verduras, tiendas de barrio.

La presidenta de la banca comunal, la señora Jeanete,  está casada, es madre de 3 hijos. La señora Jeanete se enteró de los servicios de Pro Mujer a través de los volantes que se entregaron en su zona, tiene como negocio una tienda de barrio en su domicilio. Esta tienda es atendida desde las siete y media de la mañana hasta las ocho de la noche, debido al horario de atención recibe la colaboración de su hija. Este negocio le permite estar en la casa para la atención del hogar y atención de sus niños.
El crédito que está solicitando le servirá para la compra de mercadería para la tienda.
texts.en:
The "Las Inseparables" community bank is a new group created to obtain credit, training and healthcare as part of the Cascada Focus Group under Pro Mujer. This is their first loan.

The community bank has eleven members. They are involved in the following businesses: general store, stores selling blankets, clothing, fruit, vegetables, groceries, and spinning vicuña wool into thread.

Jeanete, the president of the group, is married and has three children. Jeanete became aware of the services offered by Pro Mujer via the flyers distributed in the area; she has a small grocery store.  The store is open from 7.30 am to 8.00 pm, and her daughter helps out with these long opening hours. The business enables her to be at home and look after the house and the children.

The loan will be used to buy merchandise.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yaba

texts.fr: Yaba est mariée et a 27 ans. Elle est née à Bassar et réside à N’kafui.  Elle gère comme activité génératrice de revenus, la vente de produits congelés et compte dans cette activité 2 ans. Ensuite, elle revend à côté de la clinique  de l’Aéroport à Hédzranawoe. Elle compte dans cette activité 2 ans. Elle demande un nouveau crédit  pour augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en: Yaba is married and 27 years old.  She was born in Bassar and resides in N’kafui.  She manages an income-generating business selling frozen products and has two years of experience with this.  Yaba sells her goods next to the clinic at the Hédzranawoe Airport.  She is requesting a new loan to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: Buying frozen products

loans.name: Andrés Segundo

texts.es: Andrés Gutiérrez es un hombre de 61 años que trabaja fuertemente acompañado de su cónyuge (en la fotografía),  que es como si fuera su mano derecha en la vida y tienen 4 hijos en las edades de 15 a 24 años. Andrés inició en el año 1997 su negocio de vender gorras, bolsos, maletas, pañoletas  gafas y actualmente lo combina con el oficio de taxista,  que es otra actividad por la cual genera ingresos para el bienestar de su familia. Tanto sus hijos como su cónyuge le apoyan en su negocio y trabajan de 9.00 am a 9:00 p.m. de domingo a domingo. Con una basta clientela, después de muchos años de estar en el mismo sitio,  el negoció conforma un importante numero de compradores ocasionales y fijos, pues esta ubicado en la zona peatonal y muy comercial de uno de los centro comerciales del sur mas importantes, por lo que posee una amplia competencia, pero todos se conocen y se recomiendan, es decir cooperan los unos con los otros. Su negocio presenta una liquidez de 9,3% endeudamiento de un 9% y una rotación de inventarios de 25 días. Este es su sexto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización con la que ha fortalecido su negocio mediante apalancamientos financieros, formación empresarial y asesoría por parte de su profesional de campo. El sueño familiar es tener una casa propia y lograr apoyar a sus hijos, hasta que logren la prosperidad futura, porque justamente esta es la razón por la cual trabajan unidos. Con su credikiva que es su sexto financiamiento, comprará pañoletas, gorras, bolsos provisionándose para renovar su actual inventario y vender en la mejor época del año, momento en el cual repuntan las ventas.
texts.en:
Andrés Gutiérrez, 61, works hard together with his spouse (in the photo).  It’s as if she were his right hand in life.  They have four children ranging in age from 15 to 24.

Andrés started his business in 1997 selling caps, purses, luggage, scarves, and sunglasses.  He currently combines this with being a taxi driver which is another activity that generates income for the family’s wellbeing.  His children and his spouse support him in the business and work from 9am until 9pm from Sunday through Sunday.  With a large clientele after all these years in business in the same place the business has an important number of occasional as well as regular buyers because it’s located in a very commercial pedestrian zone in one of the most important shopping areas in the south.  Because of this, he also has quite a bit of competition but everyone knows one another and recommends each other, that is, they cooperate among themselves.  His business earns 9.3% profit and has a 9% debt; his stock turns over every 25 days.

This is his 6th loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization with which he has strengthened his business through financial leverages, business training and advice from the field rep.

The family dream is to have a house of their own and to support the children until they attain future prosperity because this is precisely whey they all work together.

He will use the Kiva loan, which is his 6th loan, to buy scarves, caps and purses thereby stocking up for the best season of the year which is the moment when sales peak.

loans.use: To buy head scarves, caps and purses.

loans.name: Julia Adelaida

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz y Progreso.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Julia, tiene 54 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete  hijos todos mayores de edad, dos de ellos viven en su casa, también con ella vive un nieto de seis años que es como su hijo y que estudia en la escuela. El marido es comerciante de pescado.
 
Se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo dice que le encanta vender.  También tiene una  mini tienda de viveras de consumo,  como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, etc. en la cual trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, en ella vende también  la ropa ya que la mayoría de sus clientes siempre compran en su tienda lugar que aprovecha para mostrar sus productos de catalogo. Sus productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y en ropa ya que tiene varios encargos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 11 años y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho. Sus metas son tener una casa bien arreglada y hacer una cisterna porque donde ella vive no hay agua potable.
texts.en:
The Luz y Progreso communal bank meets every 15 days in the city of Portoviejo, which is the capital of Manabí and has been known for many years as the “City of the Royal Tamarind Trees.”

This is where we find Julia, who is 54 years old and has a common-law marriage from which she has seven children. All of her children are now adults and two of them live in her house, as well as a 6-year-old grandson who is like her son and is a student. Her husband is a fish merchant.

She works selling clothing from a catalog and says that she loves to sell. She also has a mini-grocery store where she sells rice, sugar, oil, detergent, etc. and works every day from 6am to 8pm, sometimes later. There, she also sells the clothing since the majority of her customers always buy in her store where she takes advantage of the opportunity to show her catalog products. Her products are delivered to her store.

She will use this loan to further stock her store by purchasing rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and cold cuts, as well as clothing since she already has several orders. She has been with the communal bank for 11 years and she likes it because the loans have helped her greatly. Her goals are to have a nice-looking house and to make a tank because there isn’t drinking water where she lives.

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold cuts, and clothing

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
El señor Ernesto vive en casa propia en la zona San Pedro, de la ciudad de La Paz, es viudo, el señor es rentista, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene. Con anteriores créditos realizo las refacciones en su vivienda, se encuentra satisfecho con los créditos que le otorgamos.

Este préstamo solicita para la compra de material para construir un muro divisorio que es muy necesario en su casa.

Por su estudio socio económico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Ernesto lives in his own house in the San Pedro area of the city of La Paz.  He is a widower, and he supports himself with the income he gets from his retirement.

With previous loans he repaired his house.  He is happy with the loans he was granted.

He is requesting this loan to buy material to build a dividing wall that is much needed at his house.

His socio economic evaluation qualifies him for a new loan.  This is the second time that he has requested a Kiva loan.

loans.use: Cost of materials to build a dividing wall at his house

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
El Señor Felix C. C. tiene 33 años y vive en la ciudad de Cochabamba en el Pueblo de Quillacollo a 30 minutos al sur de la ciudad. Felix no se caso aun y no tiene hijos él vive solo con su hermano menor. Felix es Albañil hace más de 20 años, no tiene un trabajo fijo pero no le falta trabajo, puesto que tiene mucha experiencia en el rubro y hay escases de personas que brinden este servicio.

Felix vive en una casa que no es de su propiedad el esta como inquilino y esta la razón por la cual nos pide el crédito. Felix necesita el crédito para comprar un pequeño terreno por la zona donde vive y con sus propias manos construir una pequeña casita donde pueda vivir tranquilo y ya no preocuparse de pagar alquileres. Es este el mayor sueño de Felix.
texts.en:
Sr. Felix C. C. is 33 years old and lives in Pueblo de Quillacollo, which is 30 minutes south of the city of Cochabamba. He is not married and does not have children. Felix lives alone with his younger brother. He has worked as a mason for more than twenty years. Even though he does not have a steady job, he does not lack work. He has plenty of experience in this field and does not lack customers for whom he provides his service.

Felix lives as a tenant in a house that is not his, so he is requesting this loan. He needs the loan to buy a small plot of land in the district where he lives. With his own hands, he will build a small house where he can live peacefully and not worry about paying rent. This is Felix’s greatest dream.

loans.use: Purchase a plot of land on which he will build a house

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios R. is from the village of Sta. Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 41 years old. Remedios is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Remedios sells seafood products, including fish like sardines & mackerel in the local community. Remedios has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Remedios joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. That loan was used to purchase additional inventory & use as working capital to run her business. 

Remedios is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell, such as milk fish and salmon. This loan will be her 3rd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Ainagul's Group

texts.en:
Ainagul I. is the leader of this group. She is a resident of Karabalta, a small town near to Bishkek (the capital of Kyrgyzstan). She is 49 and married to an electrician. Together with her husband, Ainagul has raised three sons and a daughter. The daughter studies at school, and the two older sons are married and live separately with their families. According to Kyrgyz traditions, the youngest son lives with his parents.

 In order to earn money to cover family expenses, Ainagul sells convenience goods at home. She started this activity seven years ago with the initial investment of 15,000 soms and now she earns 5200 soms per month. With money received from the loan Ainagul wants to increase her turnover and purchase a variety of convenience goods for sale. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase convenience goods

loans.name: Vidal

texts.es: Vidal tiene 52 años de edad y es casado. Vive en casa propia la cual está ubicada en la ciudad de Morropon en Piura, a unas cuatro horas de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Se dedica a la venta de abono y a la crianza y comercialización de animales. Cría los animales en la parte posterior de su domicilio y cuando estos alcancen un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Cuenta con una clientela ya establecida y fiel. Lleva varios años de experiencia en este rubro, el cual conoce a la perfección porque lo aprendió de su padre. Ha solicitado un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para comprar alimentos balanceados y más animales menores para criar. Su mayor anhelo es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y aumentar sus ingresos para solventar sus gastos personales y de su hogar.
texts.en:
Vidal is 52 and married.  He lives in his own house, located in the city of Morrpon in Piura, about four hours from Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. He sells fertilizer and raises and sells animals.  He raises the animals in the back of his house, and when they reach a good stage of development, he sells them to traders who visit the area where he lives.  He has an established and loyal clientele.  He has many years of experience in this line of work, of which he has a perfect knowledge because his father taught him about it.  

He is seeking a loan from microfinance partner Edpyme Alternativa to buy nutritionally balanced feed and more small animals to raise.  He wants to invest in his business and increase his income to pay off his personal and living expenses.

loans.use: to buy feed and to small animals to raise

loans.name: Lenny

texts.es:
Lenny es una muchacha que se caso muy joven sin terminar sus estudios de bachilerato, tiene una hija pequeña a la que cuida porque aun no va a la escuela, su esposo trabaja como taxita en la zona, ellos viven en la Maica Central, una zona donde la mayoria de los vecinos se dedican a la produccion de leche cruda.

Lenny tiene apenas 4 cabezas de ganado lechero y 2 terneras (crias de vacas) de las que produce 60 litros diarios y los vende a las que elaboran quesillos en la zona, su esposo le ayuda con los ingresos que tiene como taxita, son jovenes muy emprendedores pero la vida no siempre ha sido justa para ellos, porque Lenny perdio a su bebe en el vientre hace unos meses por realizar trabajos pesados cuidando a las vacas, eso puso en peligro su economia, por esa razon ambos esposos solicitaron el credito para poder comprar un camion forraje y no tener que comprar por kilos porque al final les cuesta hasta el doble.

Ellos son personas responsables y emprendedoras que comenzaroncondos cabezas de ganado y ahora ya tienen mas y han podido comprarse un vehiculo, que es su herramienta de trabajo. desean siempre crecer y poder dar asu hija la educaion que ellos no pudieron recibir.
texts.en:
Lenny is a girl who married young without completing high school. She has a young daughter whom she cares for, as she is not yet in school. Her husband works as a taxi driver in the area and they live in Maica Central, an area where most residents work in raw milk production.

Lenny has just four dairy cattle and two calves (baby cows) which produce 60 liters a day. She sells the milk to the cheese producers in the area. Her husband helps with the income he earns as a taxi driver. They are very enterprising young people, but life has not always been fair for them, as Lenny lost her baby in the womb a few months ago from the hard labor involved in caring for the cows. This put their finances in danger, which is why they both requested a loan to buy a truck and not have to buy by the kilo, as it costs twice as much.

They are responsible and enterprising people who started with two cattle and now have more and have been able to buy a vehicle, which is a tool for their work. They want to always grow and be able to provide their daughter with the education that they were not able to receive.

loans.use: to buy a truck

loans.name: Brigith

texts.es: La señora Brigith se dedica a la venta de diferentes artefactos para el hogar; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de ollas, escobas, lámparas, etc., pues sus clientes le han hecho muchos pedidos; con las actividades que realiza cubre los gastos que tiene. Vive en anticretico ubicada en la zona  Cotahuma de la ciudad De La Paz, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Brigith makes a living selling a variety of household products. She is requesting the loan to purchase pots, brooms, lamps and other items that are in high demand from her customers. Her work covers her expenses. She leases a home located in the Cotahuma area of the city of La Paz, and is married and has two children. This is the second loan she has requested through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase pots, brooms, lamps and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy constructin materials to finish a concrete wall which is lined in zinc and he wants to make this improvement.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
En el departamento del Cusco, capital Cusco conocido desde hace muchos años como la "Capital Arqueológica de América", se reúnen cada treinta días las socias del Banco Comunal “Todos Unidos” en la oficina central de la Asociación Arariwa, Cusco, Perú.

En este banco comunal conocimos a la señora Margarita y nos cuenta que nació en la ciudad de Andahuaylillas, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos. 

Es ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de comida en el mercado central “San Pedro” de la ciudad del Cusco. Margarita desde hace 27 años que tiene su propio local en el mercado, ella prepara la comida desde las 4 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la mañana por lo tanto ella sale a vender a las 6:30 de la mañana hasta las 5 de a tarde todos los días. En esta oportunidad Margarita requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo arroz, fideos, verduras, carnes y otras cosas que se necesita para preparar los platos de comida.
texts.en:
Every thirty days, the members of the "Todos Unidos" (Everyone United) community bank meet in Asociación Arariwa's central office, in the city of Cusco, in Cusco department, Peru.  For many years, this area has been known as the "Archaeological Capital of America".

Here we meet Margarita who is a member of the bank.  She tells us that she was born in the city of Andahuaylillas, is 50 years old, married, and has four children.

Margarita is a housewife who, in order to make her own money, also sells meals in the "San Pedro" central market in the city of Cusco.
