Margarita has owned her own premises in the market for 27 years.  She prepares her meals from 4.00am to 6.00am and goes out to sell them from 6.30am to 5.00pm, every day.  On this occasion, Margarita needs a loan to buy supplies such as rice, noodles, vegetables, meat and other items that she needs to make her meals.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, noodles, vegetables, meat, etc.

loans.name: Jonathan Christian

texts.es:
Jonathan de 24 años, vive en una zona peri-urbana en la Perimetral. Es soltero pero tiene un hijo de 1 años que mantiene. Su actividad es de hacer flete (transporta personas o mercadería a otros lugares).

Hace tres años llego a ser misionero y se unió a a su pareja y ahora reunió dinero y compro una camioneta haciendo trabajo de cargas de mercadería a otros lugares y a personas  a los necesitan. Se levanta temprano t sale recorrer por todo los sectores para ver si hay trabajo. Con la ayuda del préstamo quiere darle mantenimiento a su vehículo para mejorar su servicios y en un futuro poner un local con mercadería y comprarse otro carro.
texts.en:
Jonathan is 24 years old and lives in a peri-urban area of La Perimetral.  He is single but has a 1 year-old child who he supports.  His business activity is transporting people and merchandise.

Three years ago, Jonathan became a missionary and got together with his partner.  He gathered together some money, bought a truck and started providing a service transporting cargo (and also people) to other places.  He gets up early and drives around different sectors to see if there is any work.  With the help of this loan, he would like to have some work done on his vehicle so that he can improve his services.  In the future, he would like to set up business premises where he can sell merchandise and also buy another vehicle.

loans.use: to have his some work done on his vehicle

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is married with eight children. Juliana is 56 years old and lives in Goin, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

She sells a variety of products such as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and other household needs to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns Php 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to purchase more products such as soap, shampoo, and anything that is needed in a household.

Juliana has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: to purchase more products such  as shampoo, toothpaste, soap and other household needs.

loans.name: Salama Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bahati, représentante du groupe d’affaire « Salama»,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 45 ans, veuve, mère de 6 enfants, tous étudient, parmi les quels, il y a des infirmiers et d’autres ont leurs propres foyers. Elle est vendeuse des ognons et ails. Bientôt 8 ans passé que son mari fut lâchement décédé suite à une courte maladie. Elle étale ses marchandises au centre commercial agricole de Birere, dans un entrepôt public. Il y a 16 ans révolus qu’elle exerce ces activités. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  6 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  2 sacs d’ognons, 2 sacs d’ails.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire une seconde maison pour ses enfants orphelins. La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Salama» est composé de 15 clientes.Cependant, leur collègue d’affaire a souhaité participer à la photo du groupe. D’où 16 figures visibles.
texts.en:
The customer Bahati, who is the representative for the business group "Salama", is an entrepreneur. She is 45 years old, a widow, and a mother of six. All her children attend or have attended school; some are nurses and others have their own families now.
She sells onions and garlic. Her husband sadly passed away eight years ago after a short illness. She displays her wares at the Birere agricultural sales center, in a public warehouse. She has been in this business for over 16 years. Moreover, she just went through six cycles with Hekima loans. This new loan will be used to procure two bags of onions and two bags of garlic. In addition, she ambitions to keep her children in school and to build a house for her orphaned children.
The customer thanks Hekima for its action in favor of underprivileged women excluded from traditional banking. It is worth mentioning that the "Salama" business group is composed of 15 customers, but that since their business partner wished to be part of the group picture, 16 people are visible on the photo.

loans.use: to purchase two bags of onions and two bags of garlic.

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es: Dulce Maria es una clienta de 36 años, vive con su hijo de 8 años hijos, en casa propia. La actividad que desarrolla es la venta de repostería la cual la realiza los días lunes a domingo en su domicilio, cuenta con clientes conocidos en su barrio. Dulce también tiene que levantarse temprano y buscar los ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de sus productos. Invertirá en la compra de huevos, colorantes, harina, queso y leche. Este crédito le permitirá continuar desarrollando su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Dulce Maria is 36 years old and lives with her 8 year-old son in her own home.  Her business activity is selling baked pastries and desserts.  She carries out this business from Monday to Sunday in her home.  She has regular customers in her neighborhood.

Dulce has to get up early in the morning to go and find the ingredients she needs to make her products.  She will invest this loan in buying eggs, dyes, flour, cheese and milk.  This loan will enable her to continue developing her business and improving her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy eggs, dyes, flour, cheese and milk

loans.name: Benedicto

texts.es: Benedicto, tiene la edad de 65 años, esta soltero  y vive solo actualmente. El pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de los insumos para la siembra de café. El cuenta con el terreno apto para la siembra de este cultivo por lo cual está invirtiendo en ese nuevo proyecto Cafetalero. El quiere tener el terreno produciendo para su bienestar propio y generar las ganancias para los pagos de su crédito. El piensa en asegurarse su futuro económico con este nuevo proyecto de siembra de cafe y sacarle todas las ganancias que se puedan para completar todas sus metas a largo plazo que tiene como persona. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Benedicto is 65 years old, single, and currently lives alone. He will use this loan to purchase supplies for planting coffee. He decided to invest in this new coffee project because he has enough suitable land for planting this crop. He would like to have his land producing for his own well-being and to generate income to repay his loan. He is thinking about securing his economic future with this new coffee-planting project and he would like to use the profits to complete all of the long-term goals he has as a person.

This is the first loan Benedicto has received through FUDECOSUR. He has never had previous loans through the state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered him this loan with greater ease and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant coffee

loans.name: Crispus

texts.en:
Crispus, age 36, is married to Ruth. He is a mechanic and has been running this business for six years.  This is the second loan he is getting from KADET LTD; he intends to buy more tools for his trade.
 
With the anticipated profits, he plans to open a garage of his own.

loans.use: to buy tools for his trade

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité deggo a été créé le 07/05/2010.IL est composé de 23 membres femmes issues du même village.Elles ont pour activité principale le petit commerce.

Madame Fatou en position debout  sur la photo et à l'extreme droite,est la responsable du groupement.Elle est âgée de 46 ans et s'occupe de 13 enfants.

Son activité consiste à faire une transformation de l'arachide en huile,elle dispose d'une expérience moyenne pour ce type de commerce.

Son prêt lui permettra de s'approvisionner en quantité suffisante d'arachide pour obtenir une meilleure production.

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et de faire de l'élevage.
texts.en:
The Deggo solidarity group was created on May 7, 2010. It consists of 23 women from the same village who mainly conduct small trade.

Mrs Fatou, standing on the far right-hand side of the photo, chairs the group. She is 46 years old and cares for 13 children. She produces groundnut oil and has medium experience in this activity. She will use her loan to buy a sizeable amount of groundnuts to get a good production volume. Her goal is to bolster her saving level and rear cattle.

loans.use: to buy groundnuts to produce oil.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling in a shop to local residents. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business. Mary dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en:
Yuri is a bee-keeper from the village Zeda Dimi, Imereti Region, West Georgia. He is 52 years old and lives with his family (his wife, Eteri, and his 27-year-old son). All family members are involved in this family agricultural business, which is the main source of income for them. They own 2 milk cows and calves. Eteri produces on average 40 kg of traditional Georgian cheese, which is sold to local dairy product retailers. Also they have 150 vine trees from which Yuri produces wine which he sells at a local market. 

Along with the above mentioned, Yuri has 16 bee-hives and bee-families. He has much experience in bee-keeping. He harvests honey twice a year and sells it at a local market. The total average monthly income for the family is 750 GEL. 

Yuri requested credit to purchase 4 or 5 additional bee-hives and bee-families. He will get more honey and more income from honey sales. Yuri plans to reinvest received profit in the bee-keeping business in order to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase 4 or 5 beehives and bee families.

loans.name: Gai's Group

texts.en:
Gai was born in 1958. She lives in Le Phap village, Uy No commune. She has three children. Her husband is a builder. He has income. She grows rice and also raises poultry and sells vegetables in the market. She has this job for many years. She has a monthly income of about 2.000.000 Vietnamdong(VND). Since 2003, she has participated in SEDA and always repaid punctually. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 1.090.000 VND to breed pigs and poultry. She is the leader group of 5-member group loan.

 About other borrowers in her group::
 Tho is 51 years old. she wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to repair her house.
 Hoa is 23 years old. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to expand her store.
 N.  is 61 years old. She has 5 children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to breed pigs.
 Thuong is 29 years old. She has 4 children. She wants to borrow 5.014.000 VND to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to breed pigs and poultry

loans.name: Artak

texts.en:
Artak is 45 years old and lives in Ijevan city with his wife and daughter. Artak’s wife stays at home to care for their child. In the past, he was employed at a woodworking complex in Armenia, then worked in Russia for three years. In 1997, he returned to Armenia and set up his own business of selling fruit and vegetables. From time to time, he rents a truck to travel into the countryside to buy produce to sell, then returns to Ijevan city to sell these items from his stall. 

Artak's business has allowed him to support his family, but he is applying for a loan for 700,000 AMD to buy his own truck so that he can travel more often and buy more produce. His goal is to decrease his expenses and increase his income. This is his fourth loan from Nor Horizon; he repaid the first three fully and on time.

loans.use: to buy a truck to use when buying and transporting produce.

loans.name: Acatjamata Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ACATJAMATA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Patacamaya, está compuesta por doce integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva de la cual la señora Lidia es la presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de leche y queso, venta de leche.

La señora Lidia  indica que es la primera ves que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de una promotora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de elaboración de queso que viene trabajando hace treinta y tres años atrás, aprendiendo el mismo de sus vecinos.

El préstamo que sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de material para la elaboración de queso) que adquirirá de La Paz y posterior a la elaboración lo venderá en las ferias. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación en crédito.

En la foto no esta presente una de las socias por razones culturales, ella es la mseñora María
texts.en:
The “ACATJAMATA” communal bank is starting its first lending cycle with Pro Mujer.  This group is made up of twelve members, and is led by a board of directors with Señora Lidia as the president.  The businesses that these communal bank members are progressing are varied, including selling milk and cheese, and selling milk.

Señora Lidia states that this is the first time that she is working with Pro Mujer, and that she joined the institution at the invitation of one of the promoters.  She currently has a business making cheese, which she has been doing for the last 33 years.  She learned this trade from her neighbors.

The loan that she is looking for is to grow her capital by purchasing materials for making cheese, which she will acquire in La Paz, and after making the cheese she will sell it at the markets.  This form of work allows her to earn income to support her family, as she is married and has four children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she enjoys the training about credit.

One of the members, Señora María, isn't present in the photo for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy materials for making cheese.

loans.name: San Jose Barrio Group

texts.es:
El grupo "Barrio San Jose" esta ubicada en una comunidad muy alejada de cetro de la comunidad, tiene muchas milpas donde se cultiva el maiz, el nombre del grupo lo eligieron las mismas representantes del grupo barrio porque ellas se encuentran en un barrio de la comunidad y San Jose porque cercas de ahi esta la iglesia y el santo patrono de la comunidad se llama San Jose es por eso que el grupo se llama "San Jose Barrio" y esta integrado por 8 integrantes todas son mujeres campesinas y muy trabajadoras, esta vez todas han pedido el credito para invertir en sus negocios, Doña leticia comprara borregos y puerquitos, la señora Fernanda comprara borregos, Araceli comprara Puercos, la señora Aurelia comprara puercos y pollos, Maria Guadalupe invertira en su papeleria, Doña Teresa comprara puercos.
Y finalmente doña Ofelia la representante del grupo tiene 41 años de edad esta casada desde hace 7 años, con el señor Jose Noe quien trabaja de obrero, juntos han procreado 4 hijos, Anel Edith de 13 años de edad esta en tercero de secundaria, Anelis de de 12 años de edad esta cursando primero de secundaria, Noe Govani de 10 años esta quinto año de primaria y Alma Belen de 6 años de edad esta cursando ya primer año de primaria.
Doña Ofelia es ama de casa sin embargo se dedica a la crianza de animales esta vez ha solicitado el credito para comprar 2 marranos, 15 pollos, alimento y maiz. En la actividad lleva ya 10 años en su casa tiene 2 marraonos, 4 pollos y patito.
Ella los compra pequeños y los vende cuando ya estan grandes, con sus ganancias ella puede comprar alimento, calzado para toda sui familia o vuelve ha comprar mas animales.
la meta que tiene es hacer crecer su ganado para poder obtener mayores ganacias y mejorar su caliada de vida y vivienda
"Estamos muy agradecidas por el apoyo que nos dan ya que ha sido de gran ayuda para poder mejorar nuestra caliadad de vida para nosotras y nuestras familias"
texts.en:
The “Barrio San Jose” group is located in a remote area very far from the center of the community. There are many fields where corn is grown. The “Barrio” part of name of the group was chosen by the members of the group because they live in a neighborhood (Barrio) in the community. The “San Jose” comes was chosen because the church in the area and the patron saint of the community is named San Jose. 

The group has eight members. They are all very hard-working, country women. This time, all the women have requested the loan in order to invest in their businesses. Leticia will purchase sheep and piglets. Fernanda will buy sheep. Araceli will buy pigs. Teresa will buy pigs also.

 Finally, Ofelia, the representative of the group, is 41 years old. She has been married for seven years to Jose Noe who is a construction worker. Together, they have four children. Anel Edith is 13 years old and she is in the third year of secondary school. Anelis is 12 years old. She is in her first year of secondary school. Noe Govani is ten years old and is in the fifth year of primary school. Alma Belen is six years old. She is in her first year of primary school. 

Ofelia is a housewife. However, she also raises animals. This time, she is requesting a loan to purchase two pigs, 15 chickens, food and corn. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has two pigs, four chickens and a duck. She buys them when they are small and sells them when they are big. With her earnings, she can buy food and shoes for her family or she can purchase more animals. 

Her goal is to increase her amount of livestock in order to earn more income and to improve her quality of life and her home. 

The group says, “we are very grateful for the support you have given us, it has been a great help to be able to improve the quality of our lives for ourselves and our families.”

loans.use: purchase 2 pigs, 15 chickens as well as food and corn.

loans.name: Resurection Plus Group

texts.en:
Bonheur, 38 and single, is the leader of the Community Bank named “Resurection Plus”, which is composed of 11 members united in solidarity to receive loans from Kiva through the MFI HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Bonheur has been in the business world since 1999. He operates a general store in the western part of Kinshasa. He is a loyal client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having already received ten different loans and repaid them properly. He intends to use the next loan to increase the inventory of his goods by buying sacks of sugar, milk, rice, etc. to resell with the aim of increasing his profits. Each day, Bonheur's business brings in a profit of $40. His ambition is to build a facility to store goods in his area. He is happy and will continue getting loans from Kiva through MFI HOPE DRC in order to develop his business.

loans.use: to increase his inventory by purchasing sugar, milk, sardines, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Yesenia Catalina

texts.es: Yesenia,de 31 años de edad, habitante de la Ceiba comarca localizada en las afueras del departamento de Leon,casada,madre de tres hijos  se dedica a la crianza de cerdo y siembra de maiz.Esta muy agradecida por la ayuda recibida atraves del prestamo Kiva utilizo el financiamiento para comprar cerdos de raza y comprar concentrado para alimentar este tipo de animales vio la necesidad de especializarse en  el cuido de este tipo de animales para producir cerdos de calidad y buen peso.Ella esta solicitando este segundo prestamo comprar mas cerdos  de raza para produccion,pues una de sus metas es tener una granja de cerdos reproductores de buen peso y tamaño caracteristicas solicitadas por sus clientes, ademas quiere construir una galera para tener en mejores condiciones a sus animales.
texts.en:
Yesenia is 31 years old and lives in Ceiba, a settlement located on the outskirts of the Leon department.  She is married, has three children, and raises hogs and corn.  She is very grateful for the assistance she gets through Kiva.  She used the money from the previous loan to buy hogs and feed.  She saw the need to specialize in raising this kind of animal in order to produce good quality hogs of optimal weight.

She is asking for this second loan in order to buy more hogs, as one of her goals is to have a hog farm with hogs of good size and weight, as her customers have requested.  She also wants to build a pen in order to provide better conditions for her animals.

loans.use: to purchase pigs for breeding.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal ”VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN”; El banco comunal se encuentra ubicado en el distrito de Arin en la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia; la socia tiene 33 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, La socia se dedica al cultivo de maíz y hortalizas, ella tiene varias chacras  (terrenos agricolas) y están cerca de su casa. Posteriormente vende sus productos una vez que hayan llegado a su tamaño en los diferentes mercados del poblado de Urubamba. 

El crédito que ha solicitado la socia será destinado para la compra de maíz. La socia es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa que siempre ha sabido salir adelante para mejorar en la vida y poder tener lo que desea. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la copra de maíz y de semillas de hortalizas para sembrar.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "VIRGEN CONCEBIDA DE ARIN", which is located in the district of Arin in the province of Calca, department of Cusco.

The member, Mrs. Sonia, is 33 years old and has two children.  She grows corn and vegetables for a living.  She has several patches of land near her house.  When her produce is ready to sell she takes it to the different markets in the town of Urubamba.

She plans to use the loan to buy corn.  She is a hard-working, enterprising woman who always has known how to get ahead and improve her lifestyle and get what she wants.  The loan will be used to buy corn and vegetable seeds for planting.

The member is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy corn and vegetable seeds for planting.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in the Likoni area of Coast Province, Kenya. She has two children. Jane owns a retail shop which has been in operation for the last eight years. Jane accumulated some personal savings and began selling items in small quantities.

She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to purchase more retail stock e.g. sugar, sweets, biscuits, etc. Jane learned of Milango from her friends and decided to join in order to access credit. Her main challenge is high transport costs which in turn raises the cost of goods. 

Jane is also engaged in supplying items to other shops by using a motorbike. Her future aspirations include setting up a wholesale and purchasing a pick up.

loans.use: to purchase more retail stock e.g. sugar, sweets, biscuits, etc

loans.name: Igor

texts.ru:
Игорь женат, у них есть взрослый сын Сергей. Игорь с семьей живет в селе Малые Копани и занимается огородничеством. На 40 сотках земли он выращивает 0.5 тонн раннего редиса, 15 000 кустов клубники, а также 2 тонны картофеля. Более того еще 2 га земли Игорь сдает в аренду другим фермерам. Сельским хозяйством Игорь занимается уже около 30 лет. На данный момент его чистая прибыль составляет более 6 000 гривен. 

Игорь планирует вложить кредит КИВА в 15 000 гривен в покупку семян, пленки, удобрений, дров, а также проведение капельного орошения и ремонт теплицы для подготовки в следующему сельскохозяйственному сезону. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Igor is married, and they have an adult son, Sergei.  Igor and his family live in the Maliye Kopani village, and he is involved in farming.  He grows 0.5 ton of early radishes, 15,000 strawberry plants and two tons of potatoes on 40 sotkas of land.  In addition, Igor leases another two hectares of land to other farmers.  He has been involved in agriculture for about 30 years.  Currently, his net profit amounts to over 6,000 hryvnia.  Igor plans to invest a Kiva loan in the sum of 15,000 hryvnia into the purchase of seeds, plastic, fertilizers, firewood and also installation of drip irrigation and repair of a greenhouse to prepare for the next agricultural season.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, plastic, fertilizers, firewood and to install a drip irrigation system and to repair a greenhouse in order to prepare for the next agricultural season

loans.name: Manuel Francisco

texts.es: Manuel  de 38 años  vive al sur occidente de la ciudad y tiene 3 hijos en las edades de 10 a 15 años. Él tiene un negocio a través del cual vende frutas, en diversos barrios de la ciudad y con el cual se ha defendido para su sostenimiento y el de su familia. Inicialmente fue ayudante de un taller de ebanistería, donde estuvo por muchos años y conoció muchas personas, por eso cuando    cuando decidió emprender su propia aventura de negocios y acudió a ellos, se convirtieron en   su primera clientela doméstica para iniciar su mercado. Hoy se ha extendido por varios barrios de la ciudad  y necesita crecer aun más. En la actualidad está aplicando a su credikiva, con el cual comprará en mayor volumen una de las frutas que mas le piden sus clientes, en esta época, como el aguacate, negocio al que se dedica desde hace 11 años y lo conoce muy bien. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propia casa y ampliar su negocio,  hasta volverlo una distribuidora bien ubicada donde pueda generar mayores ingresos para él y para muchos mas vendedores.
texts.en: Manuel is 38 years old and lives in the southwest of the city. He has 3 children between the ages of 10 and 15 years old. He has a business through which he sells fruit in the many city neighborhood and with which he’s supported himself and his family. Initially he was an assistant in a cabinetry shop where he was for many years and got to know a lot of people. So when he decided to start his own business venture he approached them, and they became his first business clients in the market. Today he’s branched out to various city neighborhoods, and he needs to grow even more. Now he’s applying to his Kiva lender, and he will buy bulk quantities of one of the fruits that’s most requested by his customers in this season, avocados. He’s been working in this business for 11 years, and he knows it well. His dream for the future is to have his own home and to expand his business until he turns it into a well established distributor that can bring in more income for him and for many other vendors.

loans.use: to buy avocados in bulk

loans.name: Maria Judith

texts.es: La señora María se dedica a la venta de ropa,  es soltera no tiene hijos, la señora vive con sus papas y hermanos, ella vive en casa familiar que se encuentra ubicado en la localidad de Colomi,  tiene un puesto de venta en dicha localidad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa hace ya varios años, realiza su venta los días jueves y domingo, ya que esos días son feria Colomi. El préstamo es para la compra de material de construcción y mantenimiento de la vivienda, ya que quiere ampliar con la construcción de un cuarto y así poder brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, la Sra. María es una persona muy amable y gentil siempre pensando en la bienestar de sus hermanos y de su mama, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que le brindan ya que de esta manera mejora la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
María's business is selling clothes.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  She lives with her parents and siblings in their family home which is located in the town of Colomi.  She has a stall in the town where she has been selling clothes for several years.  She makes her sales on Thursdays and Sundays as these are market days in Colomi.

This loan will be used to buy building supplies and to carry out work on the house.  She would like to extend the house by building a room so that she can provide her family with greater comfort.  María is a very kind and gentle-natured person who is always thinking of her siblings' and her mom's well-being.  She feels grateful to the institution for the support that they give her as it helps her to improve her whole family's quality of life.

loans.use: to add a room to her home

loans.name: Gatrida

texts.en: Gatrida is a mother of three children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She owns a cocoa garden where she gets cocoa to sell to the clients and also has an additional source of income where she sells fresh foods like tomatoes, onions and cabbages. This helps her to get income to support her family. She is a hard working lady and has future plans of buying more cocoa plantations to make sales and increase her incomes. Gatrida would like to make bigger sales for Christmas hence requesting a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Falilatou

texts.en:
Mrs. Falilatou M. was born on Janary 24, 1967 in Lomé. She comes from a large family. After her primary education, which she regretfully ended, she took up the business of selling kitchen utensils, soup tureens, and other such items. She is married with two (02) children and also cares for the daughter of a friend. Her husband is an unemployed mechanic and almost all the living expenses rest on her shoulders. She has engaged in this business for 12 years and has mastered certain business techniques as a result of her experience. She benefitted from two past loans which she managed well and repaid on time without incident. She is a confident woman and deserves financial support to further her business.

Falilatou is asking today for a loan of $950 which will allow her to buy in bulk from wholesalers in order to respond to the demands of the market. The realization of this project will allow her to enlarge her business and to increase returns and revenues to address the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame M. Falilatou est née le 24 Janvier 1967 à Lomé. Elle est issue d’une famille nombreuse. Après ses études primaires qu’elle arrêta avec regret, elle s’est lancée dans le commerce de vente des ustensiles de cuisine, soupières et autres. Elle est mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants et en charge la fille d’une amie. Son mari est un mécanicien sans activité et presque toutes les charges se reposent sur la femme. Elle exerce ce commerce il y a 12 ans et maîtrise certaines techniques de commerce par son expérience. Elle avait bénéficié par le passé de deux crédits qu’elle avait su bien gérer et rembourser parfaitement sans incident. Elle est une femme de confiance et mérite d’être soutenue financièrement pour accroître ses activités.

Falilatou sollicite aujourd’hui un crédit de $950 qui lui permettra de s’approvisionner en gros chez les grossistes afin de répondre aux exigences du marché. La réalisation de projet lui permettra d’accroître son activité et de facto, augmenter sa rentabilité et ses revenus pour les besoins de sa famille.

loans.use: To buy and resell kitchenware

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.en: I have worked selling clothing, cosmetics, perfumes, household goods, etcetera for four years. Through the years I have established a fixed clientele that comes to me to order any appliance or personal items they need. With my income I have been able to support my children and help them throught school. Now I would like to invest in clothing since I have very little and need to satisfy my clients’ needs.

loans.use: Purchase of body creams, lotions, stockings, underwear, tanners, etc.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng C. is widowed with five children. She is currently living with her son and two married children in the same house. Mrs. C. learned to weave from her neighbor 5 years ago and currently weaves silk products at home with her two daughters. She has continued training her daughters and grandchildren to weave the silk. The family is pursuing a silk-production business. Mrs. C. has borrowed loans from MAXIMA for  to buy silk materials and sewing thread for the looms of herself and her daughters. With these loans and increased business, her family's situation has improved. With her expanded business, she will not only repay this new loan but also build another loom for her daughter, who just got married. She is committed to transfering her knowledge to her family's younger generation to continue the business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and sewing thread

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en: This single man is 31 years old. He lives in Khachmaz town. Zaur  has had his own auto-repair business since 2004. Now he needs a loan of  $1100  to buy spare parts so he is able to offer a better service to his clients and to attract more new clients, too.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Mr. Benjamin O. is 45 years old, and has seven children. He has a lot of  experience farming, and acquired his knowledge from his father. Benjamin resides in Ubiaja, but he is a native of Igueben, in Edo State. He has been in the farming business since 1980. He is a dedicated LAPO client and has been a member of LAPO for 2 years. He is seeking a loan US$325 to expand his farm.

loans.use: To expand his farm

loans.name: Ana Rosa Peña

texts.en:
Ana Rosa, 37, is a very active woman and passionate about business.  She has three children (two boys and a girl) that attend a secondary school of the township.  Her husband is a doctor and has a pharmacy.   The couple also has a grocery store which has been run for more than two years.  The store was managed by two of Ana’s relatives.  Four months ago, she decided to assume direction of the business.
There are a lot of changes she wants to make in the grocery store.  First, she wants to remodel where she runs the store. In order to reduce inventory costs, she wants to buy in bulk the goods she offers to the customers.  She will be looking for another provider in the same township instead of getting the products from Santo Domingo, the capital.  She is very determined to make the business grow and radically improve the sales volume.
The entrepreneur is very positive and trusts that she will get the funds she is requesting so that she can achieve her goals for the grocery store and be able to keep on improving her family’s condition.

loans.use: The entrepreneur needs funds to buy goods in bulk in order to supply her grocery store.  She assumed leadership of the store recently and wants to make a lot of changes

loans.name: Marvin José

texts.es:
Marvin runs a small convenience store. He's 34 years old and lives with his wife and two children. To grow his business, Marvin needs to invest more resources into his store and purchase more products to supply it. He also wants to improve its looks by buying bricks for it. His wife works at home and helps with running the store.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

Marvin es un pequeño comerciante con 34 años de edad, vive con sus 2 hijos y su esposa, como negocio posee una Pulpería. Como parte del crecimiento necesita invertir más en su pulpería y requiere comprar más productos para surtir el negocio, y además mejorar la imagen del mismo comprando ladrillos para el piso. Su esposa es ama de casa y le ayuda con la administración de la pulpería.

loans.use: Purchase products for convenience store and bricks for remodeling.

loans.name: Thi Ty

texts.vi:
Ms Tỵ, 27 years old, has 2 young children. She is a young woman but very active and hard working. She has held various odd jobs to make ends meet. Today she and her husband operate a business where they would buy waste paper from people then resell to paper company. The business is quite stable and so is their family situation.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer.

Chị Tỵ, 27 tuổi, có 2 con nhỏ, là phụ nữ trẻ nhưng rất năng động. Chị đã làm rất nhiều nghề để phát triển kinh tế gia đình như: đi chợ, làm thuê... Hiện nay, chị là chủ cửa hàng thu mua giấy bóng. Hàng ngày, chị cùng anh Thi, chồng chị, thu mua giấy bóng của những người đi chợ. Giấy bóng thu mua được nhiều, chị đem bán lại cho các nhà máy tái chế, vì vậy thu nhập của gia đình chị khá ổn định và thường xuyên.

loans.use: Buy waste paper

loans.name: Maria Elisa

texts.en:
Maria Elisa is 47 years old. She is married and has two teenage children. Her eldest is studying architecture at the university and her youngest is still in high school. Maria is a member of the “Kantuta” community bank . She has belonged for eight months. In that time, she has learned the importance of saving.

Maria owns a dessert shop and café. Previously, she owned a restaurant, but changed two years ago because she enjoys desserts. She now makes all of the products herself, unlike her restaurant, where she employed a cook.

Maria needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy a semi-industrial mixer, as well as other supplies, such as flour, sugar, and butter.

One of the most important aspects of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account each associate has. Maria plans to use her savings to further improve her business and to pay for her daughter’s education. Her dream is that her café will succeed and her daughters will be professionals.

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of 3000 soles (3 soles = $1) to buy a semi-industrial mixer, as well as other supplies, such as flour, sugar, and butter.

loans.name: Kalsoom's Group

texts.en:
I am Kalsoom A. R., the leader of a small group of women. They include Safia A., who needs this loan for their fruit business. Nawab B. is borrowing for her brother, who sells construction supplies. Rasheeda R. will use the loan to expand their fruit business. Ayesha B. is a widow and she is borrowing for her son who operates a billiard centre.

I live in Kot Radha Kishan, a small town in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of seven. All of my children are married and live separately. My children could not attend school because of our very poor economic conditions. My husband has operated a fruit shop since his teens. Earlier, he used to sell fruit from a cart, but after acquiring three continuous loans from Asasah, a microfinance institute, we have now shifted our fruit business into a shop. I used to stitch clothes, but I do not sew any more. I request you to help all of us so that we can further improve our lives.

loans.use: Expand fruit business

loans.name: Xoname

texts.en:
Xoname A. prepares food for sale. She has two children. She is married to a mechanic whose income is too small to meet the family’s financial needs. Business is going well and she wants to increase her income to help support her husband.

She is asking for $525.00 as an additional capital to buy more food items for her food production and sale.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy more food items for her food production and sale

loans.name: Les Revellons Group

texts.en:
Mytilene lives in Trou-du-Nord, Haiti, with her 4 children. Everyday she fills several barrels with gasoline, and sells it from the street to cars and motorcycles passing by. With this loan she will buy more gasoline and new containers to hold it and make it easier to transport. She says that her biggest challenge right now is paying for her children to go to school, but she hopes that over the next 6 months her profits will increase.

This is a new “Bank of Hope” for Esperanza, and we want to thank all Kiva lenders for partnering with us to support these talented entrepreneurs. God Bless!

loans.use: To buy gasoline and containers.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr:
Ama B. is 43 years old, married, and the mother of five. She is a food retailer in the marketplace in Adéta, a village located about 150 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. With this loan, her third from FECECAV, Ama wishes to buy sacks of corn and to stock up on them in order to limit repeated trips, since stocking up is accomplished on farms. The profits she will earn from her business will enable her to provide for her children and to improve their living conditions.

Translated from French by Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteer

Madame Ama B. est âgée de 43 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de nourriture dans le marché d’Adéta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale Togolaise. Avec ce crédit, son troisième de FECECAV, Ama souhaite acheter des sacs de maïs, les stocker pour limiter les déplacements répétés puisque l’approvisionnement se fait dans les fermes. Les profits qu’elle dégagera de son activité lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants et améliorer leurs conditions de vie.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime is an exemplary father and husband. Since he was young, he has proven to be hard working, enterprising and diligent. This is why after long years of effort and dedication he was finally able to open his carbonated drinks factory which he baptized with the name “Piranita.” Initially, this business did not seem to be very profitable but his perseverance transformed his company into an indispensable source of income for his family and for the four enterprising young people who he employs in his small factory. By employing these four people, he contributes to lowering number of unemployed people in his country. Jaime, his family, and his young employees have great plans for this business and are sure that with your help they can solidify the majority of their projects. Jaime presents himself before you to ask for a loan in the amount of $1075.00, which he will invest in expanding his factory. He commits himself to repaying the loan in no more than six months. Lets be an important part of the growth of this business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

Don Jaime es un ejemplar padre y esposo, desde pequeño demostró ser muy trabajador, emprendedor y diligente, es por ello que tras largos años de esfuerzo y dedicación pudo finalmente abrir su pequeña fabrica de bebidas gaseosas, bautizada con el nombre de “Pirañita”. Este negocio, en un principio no parecía ser muy rentable, pero su constancia hizo que convirtiera su empresa en un indispensable ingreso económico para su familia y la de cuatro emprendedores jóvenes a quienes brinda trabajo en su pequeña fabrica. De esta manera colabora en disminuir la tasa de desempleados en su país. Don Jaime, su familia y sus jóvenes empleados tienen grandes planes en su negocio y están seguros que con tu apoyo podrán cristalizar gran parte de sus proyectos. En esta oportunidad, Jaime se presenta ante vosotros para solicitarles un préstamo por el monto de 3000 soles, dinero que será invertirlo en ampliar su fábrica de gaseosas comprometiéndose en devolver el préstamo en un lapso no mayor de los 6 meses. Seamos parte importante del crecimiento de este negocio.

loans.use: Expansion and improvement of carbonated drinks factory.

loans.name: Gladys Roxana

texts.es:
Roxana is 24 year sold and she studied until 4th grade of elementary school. She speaks Aymara and Spanish and she lives with her partner with whom she has a son who is 5 years old. She lives in M. in the Centro Poblado de Camiachi in the district of llave in the province of El Collao.

She buys, sells and feeds up bulls which she buys in the markets of Pilcuyo, Llave, Acora and Camiachi and she sells them in the same markets after 2 months.

She started this business when she became a member of the group '22 de septiembre' where she had an initial credit of 300 soles with which she bought a baby deer which she raised for 6 months and then sold.

With this credit of 300 soles which she will repay in 4 months, she will buy 2 bulls to raise.

She says that being a member of the group she has learned to be responsible and punctual in her payments. She is grateful for the credit which helped her to increase her earnings and her capital.

Her greatest dream is to buy a house in Tacna and to keep going with her business of raising livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Roxana tiene 24 años, estudio hasta cuarto de primaria, habla el idioma aymará y castellano; convive con su pareja con quien tiene un hijo varón de cinco años de edad. Ella vive en la Parcialidad de M., Centro Poblado de Camicachi, Distrito de Ilave, Provincia de El Collao. Ella se dedica a la actividad de compra y venta de vacas y engorde de toros que los compra en las ferias de Pilcuyo, ilave, Acora y camicachi y los vende en las mismas ferias después de dos meses. Ella inició con el negocio desde que se incorporó como socia al Banco Comunal “22 de Setiembre”,donde tuvo un crédito inicial de S/. 300.00 nuevo soles con lo que compro una ternerita que lo crió seis meses y después los vendió. Con este crédito de S/. 3,000.00 nuevos soles, que será pagado en cuatro meses, comprará dos toros para engorde. Manifiesta que siendo socia del Banco Comunal aprendió a trabajar, ser responsable y puntual en sus pagos; esta muy agradecida por el crédito le ayudo a incrementar sus ingreso y su capital. Su mayor sueño es comprar su casa en Tacna, seguir con el negocio de engorde de ganado.

loans.use: To buy 2 bulls/Compra de 2 toros (ganado).

loans.name: Valentina

texts.en:
Valentina sells clothing in one of the local markets in the town of Kahovka, Kherson region. She has been a skillful entrepreneur for 13 years. She started her own venture when she could not financially survive on the salary from her previous job. Her business inventory has grown to the scale of about $2000 in value and her net monthly profit is about $450.

Since divorcing from her husband, she has adjusted to her new lifestyle.  She wants to secure steady sales and income since she is the sole breadwinner for her family.

Valentina is seeking a loan of 5000 Grivnas ($1075) to increase the assortment of merchandise in her kiosk.  She believes that this loan will provide her with enough capital to meet her customers' demands, as well as provide the basic needs of her family.  This would definitely be a win-win situation.

loans.use: To increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.ru: Резвонова Шарифа  жительница района Джиликуль.Возраст 44года,женат,имеет 2 детей.Образование средне-техническое.По специальности продавец.Клиентка имеет на местном рынке  торговую точку.Торгует посудой и бытовой техникой. Имеет опыт в бизнесе 4 года.Торговля является единственным источником дохода ее семьи.На полученный кредит Шарифа хочет увеличить ассортимент торговой точки.Планирует погасить кредит в течении 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Sharifa R. lives in the Jilikul region. She is 44 years old, is married and has 2 children. She has a high school-technical education and is a salesperson by profession. The client has a sales location at the local market. She sells dishes and household appliances. Sharifa has 4 years of experience in this business. Her business is the sole source of income for her family. Sharifa plans to use her loan to increase the product assortment at her sales location. She plans to pay back the loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Khann

texts.en:
Mrs. Khann N. is a villager in Kdey Tnort Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who earns only a little rice revenue. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because her field is infertile which has a bad effect on her crop. To solve this problem, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides to support her field to make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Nhoeb Ur, is a construction worker who can earn only a small income to support his family. Mrs. Khann N. is 41 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to make her crop more productive

loans.name: Klara

texts.en:
Klara is a small entrepreneur from Beregovo. She owns a business selling retail items like crystal, souvenirs, plastic flowers, etc. in the local marketplace called “Progress”. She has been in business for 5 years. Her net profit is about 3,000 Grivnas a month.

Klara is a serious and prudent business owner. Her perseverance, together with lending services from Nadiya Ukraine, has enabled her to gradually expand her business. Klara’s working capital has grown to 15,000 Grivnas now. Klara’s pleasant manner and willingness to meet her customers' needs have helped her keep a loyal clientele.

Klara is requesting a loan of 2,500 Grivnas to purchase an assortment of retail items in bulk to sell this holiday season. Her responsibility, stable business growth, and prompt payment record characterize Klara as a consistent and serious entrepreneur capable of loan repayment.

This is a short-term seasonal loan that will be repaid in two months.

loans.use: To increase turnover capital

loans.name: Sergei

texts.en:
Sergei is married with a teenage daughter. He is a businessman from Kamenka. He runs a cosmetics and perfume sales business in the local city market. Sergei has had much experience working with this type of merchandise and has gained a good reputation among his customers and colleagues. Sergei has been working as a market vendor for 15 years. Currently, he already has about 40,000 Grivnas invested in inventory. His income is about 3,000-4,000 Grivnas a month. 

Sergei has repaid 9 previous loans to Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. This time he is seeking a 5000 Grivna loan to finish construction of a new vending kiosk, increase assorted merchandise, and attract new potential customers as a result. Sergei’s family is very supportive of his business endeavors. They try to help him as much as they can. Sergei is hoping to repay the current loan in 6 months.

loans.use: To open and stock a new vending location

loans.name: Tahira Kanwal M.gulnar Group

texts.en:
Tahira Kanwal baji is a 30-year-old married lady and has resided in a city called Multan, Pakistan for the past 2 years. Her husband's name is M. G. and he is an egg-seller. He sells egg in shops and earns a profit. Tahira baji is the mother of two kids: one son and one daughter. Neither of her childre is of school-going age yet.

Tahira baji is a very hard-working lady. She does all the household work and stitches clothes to share the burden of her husband. Her husband regards her highly for her honest and true feelings for him. She is applying for a loan to buy eggs to expand her husband’s egg-selling business.

She is the group leader for some more women from her locality. Akbari baji wants a loan to buy tools to repair electric items. Alia baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes. Najma baji wants a loan to buy cosmetics and a hair dryer for her beauty parlor. Manyari baji wants a loan to buy scrap for her scrap business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy eggs to re-sell

loans.name: Durlescu

texts.en: V. Durlescu is a young entrepreneur who wants to start his own farming business. He is very motivated because he inherited 20 hectares of arable land from his grandparents in Gradiste, a village in the Cimislia district. As any young man who dreams of being independent, he wants to build a successful farm by himself. He would like a loan from MicroInvest to buy working materials for growing grain and vegetables, and to build a green house to start seedlings.

loans.use: Start a farming business

loans.name: Kayumjon

texts.en:
S. Kayumjon is 50 years old. He is married with three children. Kayumjon is the sole breadwinner for his family and his only income comes from the cultivation and sale of large livestock at the local market. 

Every year, he buys young heifers from the farms in adjacent villages. He raises them with the help of his wife and children and then sells the adult cows and bulls to local butchers. Today Kayumjon is thinking about expanding his business, since the income from his present herd isn't enough to provide for his family. He plans to purchase additional young cattle. To do this, he needs to invest an additional $1,200 in his business. In order to receive this amount, Savridin has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner organization, IMON International.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.
 
But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous Group

texts.en: Twelve people living in Peam Sala village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan group, and they will use the loan for various purpose. Mrs. Thol T. is a 42-year-old village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. P. Ngenh, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mrs. Thol T. is applying for a loan in order to dig the well for her family and she would use the rest of money to buy gasoline and to pump water to support the field. She has five children: one is employed in a garment factory while another is a fisherman, one stays at home to do housework and the remaining two are attending the local school.

loans.use: to dig a well for her family, to buy gasoline and to pump water to support the field.

loans.name: Zamina

texts.en:
Zamina S. is a 36-year-old woman who is dedicated to her business raising sheep. Zamina has been in this business for the last eight years. She is married and has three children. She is dedicated to them and tries to give them the best she has.

Zamina wakes up early in the morning and spends all day looking after her sheep. She decided on sheep breeding because it is very profitable business and brings good income to her family. Now Zamina would like to increase her herd and purchase 20 sheep. For this purpose she has applied for 2000 USD as a loan.

loans.use: purchase 20 sheep

loans.name: Ni Putu Okayoni

texts.en:
Ni Putu Okayoni (DNR.M-0650) is a 28 year old woman who lives in the town of Ds. Tuwed, Melaya. She is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ni Putu Okayoni owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale. Ni Putu Okayoni has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 750,000 IDR a month from these activities.

In 2007, Ni Putu Okayoni joined DINARI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ni Putu Okayoni has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000,000 IDR from DINARI. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Ni Putu Okayoni is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 IDR, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. The loan will be the third loan taken out by the borrower from DINARI. Ni Putu Okayoni plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support her immediate members.

About DINARI:

The mission of DINARI is to strive for the preservation of the environment, to empower the poor, and to provide socio-economic development opportunities to small business owners.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

Ni Putu Okayoni - (DNR.M-0650) merupakan 28 tahun wanita. Dia (perempuan) tinggal di kota Ds. Tuwed, Melaya. Dia (perempuan) menikah dan memiliki 3 anak usia sekolah. Untuk membiayai hidup, Ni Putu Okayoni memiliki & menjalankan usaha. Bisnis beroperasi di sektor pertanian. Tujuan utama bisnis tersebut adalah membudidayakan tanaman. Meskipun bukan satu-satunya sarana untuk menghasilkan pendapatan, sumber utama penghasilan bisnis tersebut terutama berasal dari menanam & memanen buah & sayuran untuk dijual. Ni Putu Okayoni sudah menjalankan bisnis ini selama lebih dari 5 tahun. Dari kegiatan-kegiatan ini, Ni Putu Okayoni menghasilkan sekitar 750,000 IDR sebulan.

Dalam 2007, Ni Putu Okayoni bergabung DINARI untuk mendapatkan akses ke layanan keuangan untuk membantu meningkatkan -nya kondisi kehidupan dan kemampuan untuk menjalankan kegiatan bisnis. Ni Putu Okayoni meminta pinjaman untuk pertama kalinya dari DINARI. Pinjaman sebelumnya ini digunakan untuk membeli pupuk seperti pupuk kandang. Dia (perempuan) sekarang meminta pinjaman baru sebesar 6,000,000 IDR. Pinjaman saat ini akan digunakan untuk untuk membeli benih, bibit, & tanaman muda tambahan untuk dipelihara. Pinjaman ini akan menjadi 3rd pinjaman yang diambil oleh peminjam dari DINARI. Ni Putu Okayoni berencana untuk menggunakan pendapatan tambahan yang dihasilkan dari bisnis untuk mendukung keuangan anggota keluarga langsung peminjam.

Tentang DINARI:

Misi DINARI adalah memperjuangkan kelestarian lingkungan, memberdayakan kaum miskin, dan menyediakan kesempatan pembangunan sosial ekonomi bagi pemilik usaha kecil.

*Catatan: Untuk memaksimalkan efisiensi & menurunkan biaya, pinjaman ini ditempelkan menggunakan templat sehingga dapat diterjemahkan otomatis oleh Kiva. . Mengingat bahwa terjemahan manual atas profil memakan biaya besar, Kiva menciptakan templat ini untuk Mitra Lapangan untuk memungkinkan mereka terus menempelkan pinjaman dalam Bahasa sambil memberikan informasi yang bermutu & akurat kepada para pemberi pinjaman Kiva. ."

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi S. est un homme de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Kpalimé, une ville située à 120 kilomètres de Lomé. Il exerce ce commerce depuis 5 ans. Pour être plus compétitif sur le marché, koffi souhaite avec ce crédit approvisionner son magasin.
texts.en:
Koffi S., 35, is married and the father of 2 children. He owns a general store in Kpalimé, a town situated 120 km from Lomé. He has been working at this business for 5 years. To be more competitive in the marketplace, Koffi hopes to stock his store using this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing merchandise for resale

loans.name: Lê Thị Thu

texts.en:
H. Lê Thị Thu (2320080712) is a 32-year-old female living in the town of Kim Động. She is married and has two infant children.

H. owns and operates a business raising chickens for sale. She has just started operating this business and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month.

In 2008, H. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business.

H. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. The loan will be her 2nd loan from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase breeding livestock

loans.name: Ajoke

texts.en:
Ajoke is 32 years old and is married with four children. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria.

Ajoke sells sarongs and she is also a fashion designer. She hopes for the loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more sarongs and tailoring materials to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase sarongs and tailoring materials to sell

loans.name: Khut

texts.en:
Mr. Khut L. is 55 years old and his wife, Mrs. Noch Chom (shown in the picture), is 48. This old couple currently earns a living raising pigs as well as planting vegetables for sale. They have three school-aged children and a married child. One of their children is employed in construction. 

Khut L. is taking out his loan to buy a boat, which he will use to begin fishing around Tunle Sap River. He proposes to buy a cow to help with plowing the farmland with the remainder of the loan.

loans.use: To buy a boat, which he will use to begin fishing around Tunle Sap River

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase shoes for resale

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
La señora Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal “Señor de la Justicia”, ubicado en la cuidad de Puno, provincia de Puno, en el departamento de Puno, ella tiene 80 años de edad, es Viuda y madre de 01 hijo (casado), ella estudio educación primaria completa, vive en el Barrio Independencia.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 6 años, su primer préstamo fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, monto que le sirvió como capital para se negocio de compra y venta de abarrotes.

Actualmente, ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, con este monto ella va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, leche, gaseosas, etc. Para su negocio que reabrirá nuevamente ya que sufrió un robo anteriormente, motivo por el cual tuvo que cerrar.

Su deseo es poner una tienda muy grande.

A ella le gustan los ahorros y las reuniones.
texts.en:
Mrs. Felicitas is a member of the Communal Bank “Mr. Justice”, located in the city of Puno, Puno Province, in the Puno state. She is 80 years old, a widow, and mother of one child (married). She completed her primary level education. She lives in the Independencia neighborhood. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for six years. Her first loan was for S/. 300.00 soles, the amount served as capital for her business of buying and selling groceries. Currently, she is asking for a loan of S/. 800.00 soles. With this amount, she is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, milk, sodas, etc. Her business will reopen again after having previously suffered a theft, which caused the store to close. Her dream is to have a very large store. She likes the savings and meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Jo Longnecker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy, rice, sugar, oil, milk, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
To make a living, Tomasa raises pigs for sale. She has been in this business for over 10 years now and earns approximately 400 PHP per day as her net income from this activity.

Tomasa is 49 years old and she lives in the town of Calamagui, San Pablo, Isabela. She is married and has 4 children. They are Jeanette, 27, a college graduate; Atelano, 23 years old, a graduate of an automotive course; Jerick, 14 years old, a second year high school student, and Jack Alison, 12 years old, a Grade VI pupil.

Tomasa is asking for financial assistance to improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which she will use to invest in her business.

loans.use: For business expansion

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna is a 31-year-old married mother of one child. She runs a salon that serves a number of clients as it is the only one in the area. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 KES to purchase stock of salon materials.

loans.use: To purchase salon materials

loans.name: Anarosa

texts.en:
Anarosa I. is a 27-year-old woman living in the town of Vaimea. She is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Anarosa owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fried foods in the local community. Anarosa has been engaged in this business for over 3 years and earns approximately 500 WST a month from these activities.

Anarosa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anarosa successfully repaid a previous loan of 1250 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. Anarosa is now requesting a new loan of 1250 WST, which will also be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products to sell. The loan will be the third loan taken out by Anarosa from SPBD. Anarosa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About SPBD

SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make food products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more provisional goods to improve business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth H. is a Tanzanian married woman and a small-business entrepreneur. She runs a business selling a variety of fruits and vegetables at Makangarawe ward in Dar es Salaam.

Elizabeth purchases her goods from the city fruit market at Buguruni and sells to retail customers at her shop. Her business goods include: bananas, apples, oranges, mangoes and pineapples. She manages to meet her family’s daily demands and the capitalization of the business from her business incomes.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more produce to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more fruit and vegetables to sell

loans.name: God Mercy Group

texts.en:
Alice C. is the leader of a group of 5 borrowers called, “God Mercy.”  She is 42 years old, married with 3 children ranging from 6 to17 years old and their educational levels are from kindergarten to 8th grade.

She is a high school graduate, but could not continue to university due to poverty, but decided to get into business.

Alice lives and works in the Old Road community, a community with both poor and middle class Liberians south of the capital (Monrovia, Liberia.)

Her business is her general goods.  She buys general goods like: rice, sugar, margarine, candles, and etc. from wholesalers and sells retail to residents of Old Road.

She has been running this business for 9 years, and hopes to improve the store in the future.  Alice presents her goods in a unique way, and talks to her customers in a good manner in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her.

She started by selling kerosene with LD125.00 that was given to her by her sister-in-law.  Alice needs this loan to purchase more goods like: rice, milk, sugar, candles and etc to improve business.  She dreams of giving her children a better education and a plot of land to build a house for their families.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like rice,milk,sugar,candles and etc to improve business.

loans.name: Marie

texts.en:
This is Marie P.. She is 29 years old, married, and is from Tombo in Waterloo. Marie has two children: one boy and one girl - one in primary school and one in nursery school.

Marie has been a LAPOSL client for some time now and has taken two previous loans. She is a member of a LAPOSL union (a credit group that acts as a collective collateral and guarantor). This is the first loan she will be receiving with the help of Kiva lenders.

Marie sells palm oil and garri (a couscous-like grain made from grated cassava) at Wharf in Tombo town. With her previous loans she expanded her business by increasing her inventory of the goods she already sells. With her new loan she hopes to increase her business again in the same way.

loans.use: To buy more palm oil and garri

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles S. is married and has five dependents. He has senior high educational background.  Charles sells ready-made ladies' and men's clothes at Kotokraba market in Cape Coast, which he has been doing for the past two years.  His wife is a petty trader.  Charles uses his income to pay his children's school fees and accommodation.  Charles will use the loan to purchase more clothes for resale to improve his business. With the new profits from his expanded business, Charles plans to reinvest into his business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret N. is a businesswoman. She is married to Katende Ibrahim and they are blessed with three children, all of whom are in school. Her business is situated in the Mukono trading center. She is using the loan to acquire first-hand clothing for sale, that is to say shirts, trousers, suits and so forth. Her ambition is to expand the business.

loans.use: To acquire first-hand clothing for sale, such as shirts, trousers, suits and so forth

loans.name: Saniya Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Saniya sont toutes mariées dans des grandes familles polygames traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 28 ans, 2 enfants et habitent le chef lieu de commune rurale Cinzana Gare (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et font essentiellement le commerce d’articles divers, les friandises etc.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle, elles ont décidé d’intégrer  le  programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 2ème  prêt de groupe. Le premier fut correctement remboursé.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 4 sacs de farine de blé, 5 sacs de savon local (kabakuruni), 10 cartouches de thé, 20 paquets de bonbons, 40 paquets de chocolats, 1sac de sucre et 4cartouches d’allumette. 
Elles s’approvisionnent en  marchandises à la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou. La farine de blé est frite avant la vente. Les autres produits sont revendus sur place au marché de Cinzana Gare et à domicile généralement au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 14.300FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser les intérêts du prêt  et acheter de la nourriture pour la famille.
Leur ambition est de diversifier les activités en embrassant l’élevage des petits ruminants.
texts.en:
The five members of the Saniya group are all married in large traditional polygamous families. On average, they are 28-years-old with two children, and live in the seat of the rural area of Cinzana Gare (4th administrative region of Mali). They became acquainted as neighbours or through family links, and are essentially retailers of various items, sweets, etc. Wanting to better satisfy their customers, they decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso loan program where they are requesting their second group loan. The first one was fully reimbursed. The loan will be used to purchase: • 4 bags of wheat flour • 4 bags of local soap (kabakuruni) • 10 cartons of tea • 20 packages of sweets • 40 packages of chocolate • 1 bag of sugar • 4 cartons of matches They get their supplies from the weekly fair in Ségou. The wheat flour is fried before it is sold. The other products are resold locally at the Cinzana Gare market, or from their home, and is paid mainly in cash from a customer base of men, women, and children. They hope to reach an average monthly income of 14,300 FCFA per person, which will be used to reimburse the loan and buy food for their family. Their ambition is to diversify their activities by raising small farm animals.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy various items

loans.name: Tukundane Bakyara Group, Ibanda

texts.en: M. Brian is the leader of his lending group in Ibanda. He is a friendly and hardworking man who, for the last six years, has had a business dealing in art and design from Ibanda Main Street. Brian is married with one child and he also takes care of one dependant. He is happy that, because of the quality products that he makes, his business helps him to take good care of his family. Brian hopes to expand his business further and is requesting a loan to buy more inputs for boosting his business.

loans.use: To buy paints, clothes and boards for his business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Su's Group

texts.en:
Su T. H. is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by SEDA. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Su T. H. (id:010114060001) was born in 1963 and lives in Tien Kha village with her husband and her children. Her husband is a builder. She is a farmer: she grows vegetables and goes to the market to sell. She raises pigs, too. She has a monthly income of about 3,000,000 VND.

Su T. H. has borrowed from SEDA for three years. This time, she wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND (approximately 270 USD) for her pig-raising and vegetable businesses.

About the other borrowers in her group:

Dong T. T. (id:010114060002) was born in 1969. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to buy scrap iron to resell.

Hang T. N. (id:010114060003) was born in 1970. She wants to borrow 5,014.000 VND to invest in her store.

Ha T. T. N. (id:010114060004) was born in 1974. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to breed poultry.

Mai T. N. (id:010114060005) was born in 1969. She wants to borrow 5,014,000 VND to invest in her restaurant.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
Imad is a 42-year-old married man with four dependent children. Since 2000, he has owned a small tailoring shop in his town. He has been involved in this occupation for the past twenty years and makes a variety of products to offer his clients. Imad had profits from a first loan from Kiva and it was sufficient to fulfill his business objectives for the past year. He has been very punctual with his repayments to Kiva partner Ameen and he repaid his loan on time. 

Today, Imad is requesting to borrow $1,500 to purchase a new sewing machine in order to be able to take more orders and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Sarafina

texts.en:
Sarafina O. O. is a married small businesswoman. She runs a business selling used (second hand) clothes at Karume business market in Dar es Salaam. She purchases the business goods from the wholesale shops at Mnazi Mmoja Street in Dar es Salaam and sells to retail customers.

The business income generated is used to meet her family's daily demand and for business capitalization. She needs a loan of T.shs 500,000 to capitalize the business by buying more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods and capitalize the business

loans.name: Ma. Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma, photographed with one of her three children, owns and tills a rice farm in her hometown in Agusan Del Sur. She is married to Alex and both of them dedicate their time to making the farm productive. She also makes sure that her children are properly taken care of. She does her best to make her family happy. Since her children don’t go to school yet, she wants to grab this opportunity to save for their education.

Gemma joined CEVI last year to gain access to its program. One of the things she likes about it is the low interest rate. She is now asking for a loan of Php 7, 000 that she would use to buy fertilizers and other farming materials.

loans.use: Farm Supplies

loans.name: Sonia Martha

texts.es:
Sonia I. de 24 años, vive en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, tiene dos hijos de 4 años y otro de 5 meses. Inicio con la tienda hace tres años para poder mantener a su hijo y ya no depender del dinero que el padre de sus hijos le daba. Empezó a vender enlatados, arroz, cereales afuera de su casa, a medida que pasaba el tiempo fue incrementando su negocio con viveres y vitrinas. 

Ahora ella trabaja desde las 07h00 hasta las 23h00pm todos los días, vende en su tienda arroz, vegetales, granos, bebidas, etc. Aunque Sonia trabaja sola sigue esforzándose para sus hijos. Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, bebidas para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y pasarlo a manos de su hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia I., 24, lives in the outskirts of Guayaquil. She has two children: one is 4 years old and the other is 5 months old. Three years ago she started a store so that she could support her son, and no longer depend on the money that the father of her child gave her.
