She is a farmer who owns 0.5 hectare to cultivate rice on. Her husband, Mr. Tuy Rom, is a construction worker who can make only a small income to support his family. Aside from this activity, he is a breeder who is raising two pigs.

Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so his wife decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets to for breeding in order to improve their living conditions. Mrs. Thoeurn P. is 32 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

All the members in this village bank have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK's main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia's poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK's clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more piglets  for breeding

loans.name: Afiwa

texts.fr:
Née le 13 avril 1956, madame K. Afiwa est une mère d’une famille de cinq (5) enfants dont le mari est un assistant d’hygiène.  En travaillant à son domicile situé à Agoè, un quartier de Lomé, elle a pour activité la vente du maïs et l’élevage des volailles.  Elle a commencé cette activité depuis 2002 et ce travail lui a permit d’aider son mari dans les dépenses de la famille.
Elle a déjà bénéficié d’un crédit au près de WAGES et elle a bien remboursé. Avec ce second crédit, elle pourra acheter 15 sacs de maïs et 10 sacs de soja pour vendre et pour nourrir ses volailles.
texts.en:
Born on April 13, 1956, Ms. Afiwa K. is a mother who has a family of five children and a husband who is a health care assistant. Working in her home located in Agoè, a district of Lomé, she sells corn and raises poultry as her line of work. She started this business in 2002. It enables her to help her husband to cover family expenses. She has already benefited from a WAGES loan, which she repaid. With this second loan, she will be able to buy 15 sacks of corn and 10 sacks of soybeans to sell and to feed her fowl.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and soybeans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To get clothing items to restock small business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose O. is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Benin city, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells hair extensions, provisions and drinks. She has been in this business for a long time. She needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more hair extensions, provisions and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more hair extensions, provisions, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Akoete

texts.fr: Akoete A. est propriétaire d’un dépôt de boissons à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Agé de 42 ans, il est marié et père de 4 enfants. Pour accroître la capacité de son commerce, il désire avec ce crédit alimenter son dépôt pour mieux satisfaire les besoins de sa clientèle étant donné qu’il fait des livraisons en gros. Cette chance lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akoete A. is the owner of a drinks depot in Lomé, the Togolese capital. He is 42 years old, married, and the father of 4 children. To enlarge the capacity of his business, he would like to use this loan to replenish the inventory of his depot so as to better satisfy the needs of his clientele, since he makes wholesale deliveries. This opportunity will allow him to improve living conditions for his family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: replenish the inventory of his depot

loans.name: M/mpya G Group

texts.en:
Catherine has been a tailor in the Ipagala neighborhood of Dodoma for three years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more tailoring items for her business. She is hopping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.  

Catherine is  25 years old and single. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Amina, Helena, and Josephina. Each woman has her own small business in Dodoma.

loans.use: To buy tailoring supplies

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells cooked foods like yam, rice, beans, etc. She has been running this business for a long time. She is 40 years old and married with three children. She needs the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell to her customers. She says thanks to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El socio es el Sr.: Carlos; natural de la ciudad de Cusco, vive en la asociación pro vivienda San Antonio I-5 en el distrito de Santiago en la ciudad de Cusco.

Nuestro socio tiene 45 años de edad el es casado con doña Florentina y tienen 4 hijos de (24, 23, 19, 14) años, el socio tiene una carpintería ubicada en su domicilio, siendo esta su principal actividad, el hace muebles y los acabados los realiza su esposa, ellos trabajan para seguir apoyando a sus hijos con sus estudios y así darles una mejor calidad de vida, el socio solicita el préstamo para poder comprar materiales de carpintería y así hacer un número mayor de muebles para vender.

El socio se encuentra muy feliz con el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago respectivo de su préstamo en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
Sr. Carlos was born and raised in Cusco, where he sill lives, in San Antonio I-5, in the neighbourhood of Santiago. He is 45 years old and married to Doña Florentina. Together, they have 4 children, who are 14, 19, 23, and 24 years old. Carlos runs a carpentry business from his home, building furniture that his wife then finishes.They are working so that they can continue to support their children's studies and improve the family's quality of life. This loan will be used to buy material for furniture making so that Carlos can increase his stock. Carlos is very happy with the support he has received from the communal bank and is committed to making his payments responsibly.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood and tools

loans.name: Aluka Okech Agnes Group

texts.en:
Mrs. O. Agnes is aged 36 years and married with 4 kids (3 girls and 1 boy) plus 2 orphans who are all in schooling. She has been selling through a boutique for over 8 years. She is using the loan to purchase new clothes and new shoes.

O. Agnes is a hardworking woman whose stock is now big and she is contributing to the paying of school fees with her husband. Her dream is to have more stock than she has now.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes and new shoes

loans.name: Nemat

texts.en:
The agriculture business takes a great deal of effort, requiring as it does exposure to the sun, the physical exertion of moving animals from one place to another and the hard work of tending to various crops. Nemat Q. has dedicated himself to cattle-raising for 12 years now to support his humble family which so relies on him.

Currently Nemat is requesting a loan of 1200 USD to purchase two calves that he can raise. It’s important to note that the granting of this loan will not only benefit him, but also his two children and wife, the family he greatly loves.

loans.use: To purchase two calves

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice A. is forty years old. She is married and has given birth to three children. All are currently in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a commercial town called Suhum in the Eastern Region of Ghana. Alice works very hard to support her husband and to provide for the family. Her husband trades in foot wear. She is a trader. She deals in eggs. Alice buys crates of eggs from poultry farms in nearby communities and sells in the market square. She also distributes to retailers. 
She has been in business for over fourteen years and wants a loan buy eggs in bulk so she can increase her stock. Alice is hopeful to be able to afford to send her children to the highest levels in school.

loans.use: To buy crates of eggs

loans.name: Anufa Group

texts.en: Anufa is the group leader of Anufa group. There are four members in this group. They would like to expand their businesses. They want to take a loan of 56000 Afghani. Anufa wants to take a loan for the business of quilt making. Shawer wants to take a loan for a general store. Nafesa wants to take a loan for her husband who has a fruits and vegetables shop. Bebe Hawa wants to take a loan for the business of tailoring. So they are very thankful for AFS and Kiva lenders who can support entrepreneurs.

loans.use: Capital to expand her business

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 31 years old. She is single and the mother of two children. Currently all her children are in community school. She has been a local manufacturer of soap for two years now. She combines materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods, and coconut oil to produce her soaps. She is not able to produce in large quantities for lack of funds. She wants to take advantage of the loan facility to buy more raw materials and processing equipment to scale up production. She hopes to raise her income to support her children's education. It is her desire to provide quality education to the children and would be grateful for that support.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials like palm oil, soda powder, cocoa pods, and coconut oil etc. to make soap.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 42-year-old father of 2 living and operating his food kiosk business in the expansive Mukuru Slum in Nairobi Kenya. He began his food kiosk business 8 years ago after working as house help for some time. He is asking for a first loan of Ksh. 10,000 to buy supplies for his food kiosk. He hopes that one day he will buy land and build his own house. He also desires to give quality education to his children. He describes himself as a good, diligent manager.
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his food kiosk

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.en:
The Santa Lucia committee use their loans to invest in their businesses and diversify their activities. They buy and sell items like flour, meat, eggs, condiments, milk, sugar, herbs, salt, bread makers, vegetables, sodas, beers, wine, secondhand clothing, gloves, scarves, hats, etc. The women have completed their fourth loan cycle and each of them owns a productive micro-business. They will each receive an average of 700,000 guaraníes.

The group members are putting forth effort to improve their incomes so they can offer their children access to good education which will, in turn, give them more opportunities for a professional career.

loans.use: To buy flour, meat, eggs, condiments, milk, sugar, herbs, salt, bread makers, vegetables, sodas, beers, wine, secondhand clothing, gloves, scarves, hats, etc.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia O. is commonly called “Ermie” in her village Barangay Sto. Domingo Bambang, Nueva Vizcaya. She finished high school and no longer pursues her college studies due to financial difficulty. She works hard and helps her parents earn a living. She is now married to Manuel O. but unfortunately, they are not blessed with a child. Although, they maintain a harmonious relationship with each other.
	They help each other to satisfy their immediate needs, and eventually save for the future. Farming is their primary source of income. They cultivate their farm land twice a year by planting rice and some vegetables, which are the common products produced in their place. Aside from that, Ermie is engaged in selling vegetables and snacks in their village in order to generate additional daily income. Wanting to sustain the needs of their palay (rice), Ermie wanted to borrow from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP11,000 to finance their farming needs. She hopes that somehow their rice crops will turn productive in order to increase her daily income to survive the hardship of life.

loans.use: additional capital for farming needs

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años, es una mujer muy optimista y trabajadora, vive en compañía de su hija menor, quien es su mayor tesoro y tiene el deseo de brindarle un hogar lleno de amor y tranquilidad. El pequeño comedor que está ubicado en la plaza de su localidad, lugar donde sus clientes acuden con la intención de degustar la deliciosa sazón que tiene María para preparar los diversos platillos del día, los cuales también lleva a las diversas obras de construcción donde tiene pensionistas que contrataron sus servicios. Lo que más le agrada de su trabajo es degustar de la variedad de platillos que prepara, ya que siempre se caracterizó por ser una cocinera muy exigente y de buen paladar. Sin embargo, en algunas oportunidades tuvo que lidiar con el incremento de precios de los productos, pero su buena capacidad de economizar le ayudó a salir airosa de estos críticos momentos. Por ese motivo y en base a todo el esfuerzo que realiza, María espera conseguir el capital necesario para adquirir un local apropiado donde pueda abrir un restaurante con todas las comodidades para sus comensales. 
Este es su primer crédito con Microfinanzas PRISMA y desde ahora trabaja con ahínco para ser cumplida y comprometida con el desarrollo del banco comunal del cual forma parte. Con los setecientos soles solicitados comprará utensilios de cocina y el menaje necesario para atender a más personas e incrementar sus ganancias y ahorros.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old, and is a very optimistic and hard-working woman. She lives with her youngest daughter, who is her greatest treasure, and she wishes to offer her a home full of love and peace. The small cafeteria that is located in the plaza of her town is a place where her customers come to taste the delicious seasonings that María uses to prepare the different dishes of the day. They also run different construction projects where they have residents who hire her services.

The thing that she enjoys the most of her work is to sample the variety of plates that she prepares, because she has always been known as a very demanding cook with a good palate. However, on some occasions, she had to fight with the increase of the prices of the products, but her good ability to economize helped her to come out of these critical moments gracefully. For this reason, and based on all of the hard work she´s done, María hopes to get the necessary capital to purchase her own place where she can open a restaurant with all of the comforts for her diners.

This is her first loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and she now eagerly works to be accomplished and committed to the development of the community bank which she is part of. With the 700 soles requested, she will buy kitchen utensils and the necessary goods to serve more people and increase her profits and savings.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy utensils and kitchen goods

loans.name: Math

texts.en:
Sewing clothes is the main part of 52-year-old S. N.'s daily routine. Mrs. S. N. provides her service to her neighbors: sewing both traditional clothes and modern clothes. She runs her business very well and a lot of customers recognize the good service she provides.

S. N. is married to Samet, 51, a fish seller, and they have seven children. Two of their daughters are employed in a garment factory. S. N. will use half of her loan to buy more tailoring tools and the rest to accrue capital for her husband's fish selling business.

Note: the photo is of Mrs. S. N.'s husband.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring tools and for her husband's fish selling business

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en: Rachel K. sells cereals and water in a remote but rapidly developing area (the photo shows her water transport system). She has one employee. Her customers for cereals are local families and, for water, it is foremen from local construction sites. She has been in the cereals business for three years and just recently expanded to offer water. Rachel will use the proceeds of her 20,000 shilling loan to purchase more maize, beans, rice, etc. She is married and has a 9-year-old boy and a 4-year-old girl. Hardworking, honest, obedient and disciplined – Rachel's longterm goal is to become a large wholesaler of cereals and a wealthy woman.

loans.use: To increase the stock of maize, beans, etc.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: This is Linda B., a 46-year-old store owner from Tala, Caloocan City. She has five children, one of whom is in high school and two in grade school. Her husband, Jimmy, 43, is a factory worker. Linda has been in business for six years already. She manages her own sari-sari (general) store located at their house. On a monthly basis, she makes more than P10,000. She saves most of her profits to support the education of her children. In 2007, Linda came to know about the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) Credit Cooperative and eventually became a member. She enjoys attending its weekly meetings for women entrepreneurs. Linda has applied for a new loan with the cooperative in the amount of P15,000 as additional capital for her store. Linda says she couldn’t ask for more because all her children are responsible in their studies which gives her all the inspiration to work hard in her business. She is thinking of embarking on additional business ventures soon. About CCT The Center for Community Transformation (CCT) is an organized Christian response against poverty and social injustice. This is carried out through the fusion of social development initiatives and evangelical mission in a uniquely Filipino context. It serves urban and rural poor communities throughout the Philippines, in pursuit of its desire to see changed lives, strong families, and transformed communities centered in the Lordship of Jesus Christ. CCT is a member of the Five Talents family.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Segundo Telesforo

texts.es: El Sr. Segundo M. Fernández tiene 41 años de edad, es conviviente, vive en casa propia junto su esposa la Sra. María La Rosa y sus cuatro hijos, dos de ellos menores en edad escolar y dos mayores de edad. Cliente realiza la actividad de taxista para el distrito de Ocucaje  hace cinco años, además se dedica a labores de agricultura sembrando en terrenos propios en el caserío de El Tambo y Los Pecanos en Ocucaje contando para dicha labor con la ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos mayores. Actualmente está construyendo en su casa un módulo de vivienda para damnificados del terremoto por lo cual requiere de préstamo para solventar gastos de mano de obra y concluir con la construcción de dicho módulo. Son personas muy trabajadoras las cuales brindan educación a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo y pretenden tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es poder concluir con la construcción de su casa. Ambos agradecen la ayuda que le brindemos para lograr hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Mr. Segundo M. F. is 41 years old and lives in his own house together with his wife, Mrs. Maria La Rosa, and their four children, of whom two are of school age and two are adults. Our client has been a taxi driver in the district of Ocucaje for five years. Additionally, he works in agriculture, planting seeds on his own land on the farm El Tambo y Los Pecanos in Ocucaje. He counts on his wife and his older children for help with this work. Currently, in his home he is constructing a housing unit for victims of the earthquake, for which he requires this loan, to settle the expenses of manual labor in finishing the construction. They are very hard-working people who put forth a lot of effort to provide their children with a good education and aspire to have a better quality of life. His dream is to be able to finish the construction on his house. Both he and his wife are grateful for the help we are providing them to make their dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Housing construction

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 40 years old and married with three children. She lives in Ibadan, Oyo State, Nigeria.

Esther sells cooking oil and soup spices at retail prices to her customers and has been in this business for a long time. She is a hardworking woman. She sells for long hours to enable her to meet the basic needs and necessities of her family members.

Esther is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and Africa. Esther is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more cooking oil and soup spices to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil and soup spices to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying and selling pagne cloth

loans.name: Francois

texts.en: Francois is a 31-year-old married man with 2 young children. He owns a jewelry shop where he makes and repairs jewelry. Today, Francois is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy tools and appliances needed to make a greater variety of products and thereby increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase tools and appliances for his business

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael O. lives in the town of Kakamega. He is married to Caroline O. and they have three children. Michael’s wife is a nursery school teacher.

Michael is in the construction industry where he uses a poker machine to put concrete on floors of houses that have been built.

He hopes to get a lender through Kadet Limited to enable him buy another poker concrete vibrator machine to enable him do his business well since the one he has is old and outdated. 

Michael’s dream is to buy a concrete mixer, a complete poker vibrator and a crane. He also hopes to be able to send his children to a higher institution of education.

loans.use: To buy another concrete vibrator machine.

loans.name: H.

texts.en:
P. is a 60-year-old widow living with her six children. She owns a small piece of land where she grows spices and has her own cinnamon garden. She is growing the cinnamon with the help of her children.

P. wants to add more plants in her cinnamon garden in order to increase its capacity. She wants to expand her small business, and help her children too.

loans.use: To buy more cinnamon plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike taxi

loans.name: White C Group

texts.en:
M. A., age 44, is married and has two children aged 11 and 9. He has owned and operated a general store since 2001, working from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily. From this business Matthew is able to earn a monthly profit of about $270.

This will be M.’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, his previous loans, all repaid, having been used to increase his store stock and open another store for his wife. He now hopes to obtain a loan to buy a small plot of land.

M. will share this loan with his subgroup C of White group, whose six members sell food and have retail and general stores. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan. In the picture, M. is in the front with a white t-shirt

loans.use: To buy a small plot of land

loans.name: C2875 Group

texts.en:
Marie Louise M. is the group representative of five members, each with a different business. She was born in 1983 and is married with two children. Her husband is a driver and they both work hard for their family.

Marie Louise owns a small shop which sells different kinds of products. The hours of her business are from six in the morning to six in the evening every day, even during the weekend. This is her 4th successful year in her business.

Marie Louise and her group are requesting a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand their businesses through purchasing more products such as salt, cassava flour, bread and so on. With this loan, the group members have the target of improving their family situations through saving money for their future and paying the school fees of their children.

loans.use: To purchase more products to sell

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo es un señor de 35 años, casado con 2 hijos de 2 y 7 años, viven en la zona del Barrio Fabril, inmediaciones de la Av. Blanco Galindo Km 7 en la Zona de Colcapirua, de la Provincia Cercado. Zona considerada agrícola, pues se encuentra en la periferia de la ciudad de Cochabamba.

Gonzalo se trabaja como chofer de un taxi, que hace su recorrido en la zona, su esposa trabaja en una escuela que se encuentra en la comunidad de Pucarita Chica, a tres horas de viaje de su casa, tomando hasta tres movilidades, pero ellos se acomodan a los horarios y necesidades que tienen y están acostumbrados a levantarse muy de madrugada todos los días, sus pequeños hijos se quedan al cuidado de su abuelita mientras ambos esposos trabajan en las mañanas, pues son muy pequeños y el ultimo tuvo problemas de labio leporino, para lo cual por ayudas extranjeras pudieron operarlo, aun así requería de los cuidados y atención de sus padres para su recuperación pues tuvo complicaciones, para lo cual la esposa de Gonzalo tuvo que dejar durante un año su empleo. Ahora que su pequeño hijo se encuentra mejor y ya se ha recuperado ambos esposos están decididos a trabajar mucho para poder recuperarse de la operación de su pequeño hijito.

Gonzalo solicito el crédito para poder compra repuestos a su herramienta de trabajo (taxi) y realizarle un mantenimiento general a la misma. El nos cuenta que uno de sus mayores sueños es algun dia ganar lo suficiente para poder dejar que su esposa deje de trabajar y se dedique 100% a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is a 35 year old man who is married with 2 children, aged 2 and 7. He lives in the Barrio Fabril zone near Blanco Galindo Avenue at Km. 7 in the Colcapirua Zone of Cercado Province. This zone is considered agricultural, since it is on the outskirts of Cochabamba City. Gonzalo drives a taxi along the zone's routes. His wife works in a school in the community of Pucarita Chica, 3 hours travel from home, requiring 3 changes of buses. But they have adjusted to the schedule and its requirements and are accustomed to rising very early every day. Their young children remain in the care of their grandmother while both parents work mornings, but they are very young. And the youngest has a harelip which was operated on with foreign assistance but he still requires the care and attention of the parents for his recovery since there were complications. For that reason, Gonzalo's wife had to take a year off from work. Now that their little one is better and has recuperated, both parents are determined to work hard in order to recover from the child's operation. Gonzalo requests a loan to buy replacement parts and to carry out general maintenance on his taxi. He tells us that one of his major dreams is to make enough one day so that his wife can stop working and devote herself 100% to their children.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING REPLACEMENT PARTS AND PERFORMING MAINTENANCE ON HIS TAXI

loans.name: 03 Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Thu  Nguyễn is a 35-year-old femaL. living in the town of Hoàng Hóa, Thanh Hóa.  Thu is the group leader of a nine-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 03 Hoàng Hóa.


Thu is married and has three adult children.  To making a living, Thu owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising cattL. for saL..  Thu has been engaged in this business for more than 15 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Thu is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a new loan of 4,248,000 VND, which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future.  The loan will be her first loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thu plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Phạm Thị Hằng is a 54-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


2.  Lê Thị Cúc is a 28-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


3.  lê Thị Kiểm is a 39-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


4.  Phạm Thị Đức is a 52-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


5.  Phạm Thị Trà is a 63-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


6.  Lê Thị Hợp is a 25-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


7.  Nguyễn Thị Huệ is a 30-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


8.  Nguyễn Thị Kim is a 38-year-old femaL. who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the food sector operating a fishing business.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Thu  Nguyễn  (110) là 35 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở  Hoàng Hóa _ Thanh Hóa.  Thu  là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 9 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 03 Hoàng Hóa (03 Hoàng Hóa).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gia súc để bán.  Thu  thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 15 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Thu  kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Thu  đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Thu  đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Phạm Thị Hằng (99) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


2.  Lê Thị Cúc (116) là 28 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


3.  lê Thị Kiểm (98) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


4.  Phạm Thị Đức  (117) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


5.  Phạm Thị Trà (100) là 63 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


6.  Lê Thị Hợp (118) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


7.  Nguyễn Thị Huệ (97) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


8.  Nguyễn Thị Kim (101) là 38 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: To purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in the future

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María, es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 45 años, viven con uno de sus 5 hijos en su vivienda propia junto a su esposo Jorge de 50 años. Posee grandes extensiones de terreno, lugar en donde planta café y piña, que con ayuda de su esposo, quien cuida de sus plantaciones los fines de semana. Ya que de lunes a viernes trabaja vendiendo gelatina de manera ambulante, es así que ya tiene 10 años con esta actividad. Mientras que en el día trabaja en el comedor popular de su localidad preparando los alimentos para la gente de ese lugar a cambio de que le den provisiones para su consumo personal. Por otro lado, su esposo percibe diariamente la cantidad de S/. 30.00 a S/. 40.00 soles, que para ellos le es suficiente para vivir cómodamente, ya que sus hijos son adultos e independientes. Lo que más le gusta a María, es atender a los niños, de esa manera se distrae mucho. En adelante piensa instalar en su domicilio una bodega, pues está cansada de caminar largas horas y tramos extensos para cuidar sus cultivos. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP y se enorgullece de pertenecer a un grupo muy bien organizado, responsable y solidario como lo es su grupo comunal, donde ella trabaja de manera activa.  
Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mercadería como productos de primera necesidad y comestibles, para implementar su tienda.
texts.en:
María is 45 years old and a very hard working woman. She lives with her husband, Jorge, who is 50 years old, and one of her five sons in their own home. She posses a large area of land, where she plants coffee and pineapple with the help of her husband, who takes care of the crops on the weekends. Monday through Friday, she works as a vendor selling jello. She has been doing this for the past 10 years. Meanwhile, she works during the day at a popular cafeteria making food in exchange for groceries for her and her family. Her husband makes about S/. 30,00 to S/. 40.00 soles a day, which is more than enough to live comfortably since her children are adults and independent. What Maria loves most is taking caring of children because they are a great distraction. In the future, she plans on installing a small convenience store in her home, since she is tired of walking for long hours and working long stretches to care for her cultivations. This is her fifth credit with MFP and she is very proud to be a part of such a well organized, responsible, and supportive group. With the loan that she is seeking, she plans to purchase more merchandise, such as household necessities and groceries, in order to expand her store.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic products to expand her store.

loans.name: Visa Business People Group

texts.en:
James A., who is holding the sign, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called Visa Business People. He is 37 years old, single, and has one child. He also cares for three siblings. James was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial difficulties.
For the past four years, James has been selling creme, soap, hair grease, perfume etc. in West Point Market, Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 LRD portion of this 30,000 LRD group loan to buy more creme, soap, hair grease, perfume etc. His dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy more creme, soap, hair grease, perfume etc.

loans.name: Yesu Mma Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Kente cloth is a famous richly woven traditional fabric of single or multiple colors, usually worn during special occasions like festivals, parties, outdoor activities and other social gatherings. Selling kente cloth is a lucrative business for many people like James. James describes himself as a nice person. He is 48 years old and he is the leader of the “Yesu Mma” (translated as, 'Children of Jesus') borrower group. He has operated his kente business for the past 8 years. James is excited to be taking out this loan, with which he plans to purchase kente cloth in bulk. He also operates a little grocery store to generate additional income for his family. He dreams of owning a shop to showcase his kente cloth.

James is married to a woman who is also a trader in fresh yams and they have three children from age 6-15 years. The other members of the group also sell kente cloth.  They plan to invest the loan to purchase stock in bulk to grow their businesses. James hopes to put aside more savings to be able to provide university education for his children.

loans.use: To purchase kente cloth in bulk

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Irene tiene un puesto de venta donde vende dulces, galletas, chocolates y refrescos , y por las tardes vende chicharrón seco.
Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de bajo Irpavi de la ciudad de La Paz. 
El crédito será destinado para capital de trabajo (Compra de dulces, galletas, refrescos, y otras golosinas, para su puesto de venta).
Es cliente antigua en Impro, desde julio del 2006, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de sus cuotas, por lo que le permite acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Irene has a vending stall where she sells sweets, cookies, chocolates, and soft drinks. In the afternoons, she sells dried pork rinds. Her home is located in the lower area of Irpavi in the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used as operating capital to buy candy, cookies, soft drinks, and other types of sweets to sell. Irene has been a long-time client of IMPRO since July 2006. Her credit history qualifies her as a Level 1 client, which means she has an excellent payment history and is eligible to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase candy, cookies, soft drinks, and other types of sweets

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia A. is from the village of Santiago, Talakag, Misamis Oriental. She is 59 years old and married with eight adult children. To make a living, Claudia operates a business buying and selling firewood. Claudia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3500 PHP a month. She chose to reduce the amount of her loan from PHP 8,000 to PHP 5,000 because she finds it easier to pay it back.

In 2009, Claudia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase firewood to sell. Claudia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will also be used to purchase firewood to buy and sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Claudia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI: HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to sell

loans.name: Alice Adhiambo

texts.en:
Alice Adhiambo is a 26-year-old modest lady in the heart of Kisumu city in Western Kenya. She is married to John Ogutu, who is in formal employment. They have two children ages five and two.

Alice operates a retail shop in Kisumu town where she makes a monthly income of 60,000 KES. She has operated this shop for the last three years, and she is grateful that she is able to meet her daily expenses and support her family. She joined Kadet Limited and took out a first loan, which she paid back successfully without default. She is now taking out a second loan, which she plans to use to build another shop, using part of it to stock her current shop.

Her profits will be used to expand the new shop. Her hopes are to open several branches and also ensure that her family has good living standards.

loans.use: To build another shop

loans.name: Mrs. Norn Long Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan has 12 people who live in Trach village in Takeo province. Mrs. Norn L. is the village bank president selected by the other group members, who will use their portion of the loan for different purposes. 

Mrs. Norn L., 58, and her husband, Mr. Horl Ny, are farmers who own a two-hectare plot of land where they grow crop to support their famiL.. Her field has infertile soil, so to improve crop production, Mrs. Norn L. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers. She is a mother of four children: one is a teacher, two are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the other is attending school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy L. is from the village of Dugayung, Amulung, Cagayan. She is 28 years old. Judy is married and has 2 infant-aged children. To make a living, Judy owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Judy is just starting this business.

In 2010, Judy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Judy is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver N. is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is married and has 1 child.  None of her children is currently in school.  Oliver has a business of a retail shop, which she has had for 2 years.  Oliver has another business of a pay phone and selling phone air time  

To help expand her business, OOliver has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar, maize flour and phone air time.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Oliver hopes to generate greater profits and help her side of family.  In the future, Oliver hopes to do business with outside countries.  Oliver is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her increase on business

loans.use: to buy sugar and maize flour

loans.name: Fuente De Desarrollo 1 & 2 Group

texts.es:
Santa es una de los miembros del Grupo Fuente para el desarrollo  1 y 2, son microempresarios dedicados a las ventas de ropa, productos naturales, zapatos, artesanía,  etc; en la ciudad de Samana, una ciudad turística en desarrollo, bordeada por las costas del Océano atlántico y rica en recursos naturales.  Está asociada de Esperanza comenzó con nosotros porque tenía la necesidad de trabajar para superarse.

Santa  está muy emocionada de recibir su cuarto préstamo en Esperanza Internacional, después de haber pagado satisfactoriamente sus préstamos anteriores y haber dado un paso para el crecimiento de su negocio. Ella ha tenido su negocio por alrededor de 2 años, el cual inició con un pequeño préstamo que todo a  otra institución diferentes productos en la playa. Santa está planificando invertir su nuevo préstamo en la compra de Cocos y Frutas. Ella va a utilizar sus ganancias para reinvertir en su negocio, mientras ahorra para poder comprar una guagua y construir su casa.  Su más grande sueño es poder ver a su hijo graduado y convertirse en una persona de bien.
texts.en:
Santa is one of the members of the Fuente Group for Development 1 and 2. They are micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, artisanal crafts, etc. They are in the city of  Samana, a tourist town in development bordered by the Atlantic coast and rich in natural resources. She is associated with Esperanza and started with us because she needed to work to get ahead.

Santa is very excited to be receiving her fourth loan in Esperanza Internacional after having sucessfully paid off her previous loans and having taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for around 2 years and started it with a little loan from another institution to sell products on the beach. Santa is planning on investing her new loan in purchasing coconuts and fruit. She will use her earnings to re-invest in the business while she saves to be able to buy a van and build her house. Her biggest dream is to see her son graduate and become an upstanding person.

loans.use: To buy coconuts and fruit

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
don Francisco G. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en el Caserio San Agustin Namasigue de la ciudad de Choluteca y se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia en su casa de habitacion, sus clientes son sus vecinos del lugar.
todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus clientes, junto con su esposa trabajan duro para sacar adelante su familia, Francisco es padre de 4 hijos.
Francisco tambien se dedica a la crianza de gallinas. 
el prestamo lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir bien su pulperia, desea tener mayores ventas y mas ganancias.
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio hasta tenerlo bien completo y surtido.
texts.en: Don Francisco G., 45, lives in Caserio San Agustin Namasigue, city of Choluteca, and sells everyday supplies.  He has a small convenience store in his home, with clients from the neighborhood.  Every day he rises very early to serve his clients, he and his wife working very hard to get their family ahead.  Francisco is the father of 4 children.  In addition, he raises chickens.  He will use this loan to buy merchandise to supply his store, hoping for greater sales and earnings.  His goal is to increase his business and keep it well-supplied.

loans.use: Purchase of store supplies

loans.name: Marly Benilda

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Guerra De Los Sexos se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la rica cultura histórica que encierran sus montañas.

En este sitio encontramos a la señora Marly, ella tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y fruto de aquella relación ha procreado dos hijos de 12 años y de 1 año y 5 meses, la mayor esta en primer año de colegio. Su esposo es taxista.

Además de ser una buena madre y ama de casa se dedica al comercio,  tiene un local o depósito donde vende telas por pacas, entrega sus productos a comerciantes que luego la venden al menudeo en diversos lugares y también entrega a algunos talleres de costura. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8am hasta las 18h00, además de esto en las temporadas navideñas vende adornos y nacimientos que son muy vendidos en esta época del año. Compra sus productos en Guayaquil y Quito dos veces por mes.

Este crédito es para comprar los nacimientos y adornos navideños y aprovechar la temporada que se avecina. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal y le gusta por los créditos ya que estos le ayudan mucho en su vida como empresaria. Su meta es tener un almacén grande y bien estructurado.
texts.en:
The La Guerra de los Sexos ("The War of the Sexes") Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Picoaza parish in the city of Portoviejo.  It is known for being a very commercial zone, for the Saint Pedro and Saint Pablo traditional celebrations, and for the rich cultural history contained in its mountains.

This location is where we find Marly, age 37.  She is married and has two children.  One child is 12 years old, and the other one is 1 year and 5 months.  The oldest is in the first year of high school.  Her husband is a taxi driver.  

In addition to being a good mother and housewife, she also has a business.  She has a place or depot where she sells bundles of fabric.  She delivers her products to merchants who later sell them at retail prices in different places.  She also delivers to some seamstress shops.  She works every day from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  Additionally, during the Christmas season she sells decorations and Nativity scenes, which are sold a lot during this time of year.  She buys her products in Guayaquil and Quito two times a month.

This loan is to buy the Nativity scenes and Christmas decorations in order to take advantage of the coming season.  She is a founding member of her communal bank, which she likes because of the loans.  The loans help her a lot in her life as a businesswoman.

Her goal is to have a large and well-built warehouse.

loans.use: To buy Nativity scenes and Christmas decorations

loans.name: Dominga

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VAMOS JUNTOS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco  y departamento D. Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Dominga; ella tiene 56 años D. edad, casada  y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. compra y venta D. carne ella lo compra del mismo ganadero y luego lo distribuye a mas precio a los mercados y algunas vecinas que le solicitan. La socia es una señora muy emprendedora y con muchas ganas D. seguir adelante. 

La  socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. más carne para la distribución a sus clientes. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte D. este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago D. sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “VAMOS JUNTOS” communal bank, The bank is located in the district of Cuzco, which belongs to the province and department of Cuzco.   

The member is Dominga. She is 56 years old, married and has 4 children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of buying and selling meat. She buys it from the rancher himself and later distributes it at a higher price to the markets and some neighbors who order it from her. This member is a very enterprising woman who is very enthusiastic to get ahead.  

She is asking for the loan to buy more meat to distribute to her customers. 

She is grateful to the people who are a part of this dream in this way and she is committed to making the payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: The member is asking for the loan to buy more meat to distribute to her customers.

loans.name: Burume

texts.fr: Burume B. est entrepreneur, directeur d’une école primaire Shaba, conventionnée catholique,  âgée de 47  ans, père d’une famille de 6 enfants, tous étudient confortablement. Il est éducateur, il ya 15 ans qu’il exerce cette profession d’enseignement. Son épouse fait  le petit commerce de vente des produits vivriers pour suppléer aux charges de leur ménage.  Monsieur Burume B. bénéficie de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima pour ses différents projets familiaux (construction de la maison et business). Le  client Burume B. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique, particulièrement les enseignants de la RDCongo. Cette photo est prise a l’intérieur du bureau de l’école. Les écritons entre coupe en arrière plan fait référence au « microbe »
texts.en: The entrepreneur Burume B. is the principal of Shaba Primary Catholic School. He is 47 years old, married and the father of six children, all of whom are doing good progress in their studies. He is an educator. He has been teaching for 15 years. His wife sells groceries in order to provide supplementary income for their household. Mr. Burume B. has received a loan from IMF Hekima for various family projects (housing construction and the retail business). As a client of Hekima, Burume Bismimwa appreciates its assistance to the poor who are excluded from the traditional banking system, such as teachers in Congo. This photo is taken inside the school office. The sign in the background makes a reference to a “microbe.”

loans.use: Family projects (housing construction and business)

loans.name: Jose Angel

texts.es: El señor José Ángel S. construyo su vivienda con ahorros para brindar a su familia un mejor patrimonio, solo que aun le siguen faltando algunos detalles a su casa para que quede totalmente terminada. El solicita el apoyo para poner piso firme en la cocina para que el polvo no se levante cuando su esposa este cocinado y los alimentos que preparen vayan en mejores condiciones de salud.
texts.en:
Mr. José Ángel S. used his savings to build his house in order to provide his family with a better asset.  However, he still needs to complete a few details on the house so that it will be completely finished.

He is asking for the support to install permanent flooring in the kitchen to keep dust from rising while his wife’s cooking and so that the food she prepares will be in better conditions of hygiene.

loans.use: To install permanent flooring.

loans.name: Oldalia

texts.en:
Oldalia M. is from the village of Segatic Daku Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 37 years old.  Oldalia is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Oldalia owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of products in the local community.  Oldalia has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Oldalia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Oldalia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20000 PHP from GDMPC.  This previous loan was used to coconut shells. Oldalia is requesting a new loan of 35000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be the third loan taken out by Oldalia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.  It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte, and Misamis Occidental.  Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem belongs to Sahiwal which is a small city of Punjab Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there with her family in the area of Noor park in a two room brick house for over 20 years. 
She is married to G. R. and a mother of none. Her husband works in the factory for a reasonable income. 
A talented lady Naseem, owns and operates her sewing business at her home. She does this work to share the financial burden with her husband. She sews clothes for her neighboring customers and earns good by completing them on time. She learnt this art from her mother and now can sew designer and non designer dresses easily. Her customers satisfied with her work and prefer to approach her to sew their regular wearing dresses as well. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her sewing business. With the loan, she will buy a new sewing machine because his previous machine has become old and not producing a quality work. The new machine will help her in maintaining the quality of her sewing and in completing the orders on time. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan year, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.  She is hopeful that an investment will enable her to get positive results from her business. 
Note: "In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Naseem".

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine for sewing business

loans.name: Elmer Andres

texts.es: El Sr. Elmer Andres G. U. vive junto a su esposa e hijo. Tiene casa propia la cual se encuentra ubicada en el caserio Pampa Chacaltana Ocucaje. Se dedica a la agricultura y por las noches le ayuda a su esposa en la venta de amburguesas. El Señor requiere el crédito para la compra de una mototaxi e incrementar su negocio. El está muy agradecido por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a trávez de este financiamiento.
texts.en: Sr. Elmer Andres G. U. lives with his wife and child.  He has his own home located in the village of Pampa Chacaltana Ocucaje.  Elmer works as a farmer and at night helps his wife sell hamburgers.  This gentleman needs a loan to buy a motorcycle taxi and increase his business.  He is grateful for the support that has been provided through this funding.

loans.use: Operating capital to purchase a motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace Adong lives in the Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed and has no children. She takes care of her brother's children. Grace has a business of selling local brew. She has been in this business for seven years, and she works seven days every week. Grace sells her local brew on retail and at the market. Grace has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of millet and sorghum for making local brew.

The main business challenge for Grace is a low profit margin as well as transport and defaulters. Her goal is to one day build a house. Grace lives in a home that she rents; she does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees for her brother's children and transport of sugar.

loans.use: To buy more bags of sorghum and millet for making local brew

loans.name: Yankadi Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe YANKADI sont des femmes mariées ayant en moyenne 38 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent avec leurs époux et enfants  dans des familles nucléaires à Sido préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont rencontrées à travers  des relations de parenté, de commerce  et de voisinage. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire leurs clientèles et d’augmenter la taille de leur entreprise, elles ont décidé d’adhérer au programme de crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois. 
Elles comptent utiliser leurs prêts pour faire la restauration, le commerce de condiments et Chata K. pour faire le commerce  d’articles divers.
Avec ce prêt Chata K. la présidente du groupe, compte acheter, 5 pièces de draps de lits Burkinabé, 5 paires de tasses thermos. 
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente à la maison, au marché et en ambulant dans le village, en détail, en espèce et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt elles comte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 FCFA  dont une partie sera réinvesti dans l’entreprise et l’autre partie sera utilisée pour des frais de santé  familiales.
texts.en:
The members of the YANKADI Group are married women who are on average 38 years old and have four children each.  They live with their spouses and children in nuclear family households in Sido, a prefecture of Bougouni (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  They met each other through kinship ties, business and as neighbors.

Concerned about satisfying their clients and expanding the size of their business, they decided to join a loan program with the micofinance institution Soro Yiriwaso for the first time.

They intend to use their loan in order to run small restaurants and sell spices; Chata K. will use it to sell various small items.  With this loan, Chata K., the president of the Group, intends to purchase five bedsheets from Burkina Faso and five pairs of thermos mugs. She stocks-up in Bamako from wholesalers  and carries out her individual sales from her home, at the market, and walking throughout the village for cash or credit to a clientele of women and men.

With this loan they hope to earn monthly profits of 15,000 FCFA, of which part will be reinvested in the business and the other portion will be used to cover medical expenses for their families.

loans.use: Purchasing various items

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina S. is from the village of Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 36 years old. Rosalina is married and has four school-aged children. 

To make a living, Rosalina raises bananas for sale. Rosalina has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Rosalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rosalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. 

Rosalina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizer and labor to expand her banana plantation. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Rosalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and labor to expand her banana plantation

loans.name: Pelayo

texts.es:
Pelayo tiene 49 años y nació en la ciudad de Paruro del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Pelayo vive en la comunidad de Cotowincho del Valle Sagrado de los Inkas. El socio está casado y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos. La comunidad Cotowincho se encuentra ubicada a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Urubamba donde cada treinta días se reúnen las socias para realizar sus actividades correspondientes. Pelayo tiene tres actividades económicas que son: la crianza de animales menores, construcción civil y agricultura. Pelayo desde el año 1985 se dedica a la construcción civil pues no le ha ido muy mal. Pelayo en esta oportunidad requiere el micro crédito para comprar animales menores como cuyes.   

Pelayo pertenece al banco comunal “Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca” de la Asociación Arariwa  y trabaja con sus compañeras del banco comunal desde hace varios años.
texts.en:
Pelayo is 49 years old and was born in the city of Paruro, Department of Cusco. He currently lives in the community of Cotowincho del Valle Sagrado de los Inkas. He is married and has four children. The Cotowincho community is located 10 minutes from the city of Urubamba where the members get together every month to carry out their corresponding activities.

Pelayo has three sources of income: the breeding of small animals, public construction and farming. He has been in public construction since 1985 because it hasn’t given him bad results. 

He is requesting this micro-loan to buy small animals like guinea pigs. Pelayo is a member of the communal bank Kuska Llankasun de Rumichaca of the Arariwa Association and has worked with the other members for several years.

loans.use: to buy small animals like guinea pigs.

loans.name: Mylène Estelle

texts.fr:
.Mylène est âgée de 39 ans, célibataire avec 2enfants de 2 à 8ans d’âge dont 1 va l’école.
En 1980 elle commence son activité de vente des divers et  les légumes de saison  avec un capital de 50.000 Frs..
.Avec ce prêt du  cycle 3, elle va acheter 6 filets d’oignon, 2 cartons de tomate concentrée, 1 carton d’aile, 1 caisse de tomate en fruit, 2 filets de pomme de terre, 1 sacs de sels, deux sacs de riz, 1bidon d’huile, 5paquets de cubes.
.Son souhait est de régénérer assez de bénéfice afin d’être grossiste  ainsi que améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et est aussi beaucoup féliciter pour son activité.
Elle beaucoup encouragé par son entourage.
texts.en:
Mylène, age 39, is single and has two children, age 2 and 8, out of whom one attends school. In 1980, she started her business selling various items and seasonable vegetables with a capital of XOF 50'000. With this third loan, she will buy six bags of onions, two boxes of tomato concentrate, one box of garlic, one box of fresh tomatoes, two sacks of potatoes, and bag of salt, two sacks of rice, one can of oil, and five packs of bouillon cubes.

She wishes to generate enough profits to become a wholesaler and improve the living standard of her family. She is very much congratulated for her business, and receives much encouragement from her entourage.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, garlic, potatoes, rice, etc

loans.name: Lucas

texts.es:
Lucas S. C. se vive en la Palma de Puerto Jimenez  y tiene  63 años.
El se ha dedicado toda su vida a la agricultura con la siembre de varios  productos agrícolas. Hoy quiere inicia otro negocio, con la siembra de árboles frutales, para vender sus productos. Para eso necesita un préstamo de ₡594 000 (quinientos noventa y cuatro  mil colones) para la compra de arboles y para pagar la mano de obra. 
El espera mejorar sus ingresos, y ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Raíces Capitales una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Lucas S. C., age 63, lives in Palma de Puerto Jimenez. He worked all his life in farming, sowing various agricultural products. Now he would like to start a new business of raising fruit trees. This is why he needs a loan of 1200 USD, which he will use to purchase the trees and to pay labor costs. 

Lucas hopes to improve his income and to help his children with their studies. He is a member of the financial institution "Comunal Raíces Capitales" which is one of the 110 organizations affiliated with EDESA in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to purchase fruit trees

loans.name: Belén

texts.es:
La señora Belén tiene ya más de cinco años dedicándose a la venta de productos para belleza para dama.
A su negocio le esta haciendo falta más productos ya que tiene varios pedidos para entregar y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la compra.
Es por es que esta solicitando un préstamo para poder realizar el pedido y así entregar los encargo a tiempo y que sus clientas no se molestan y le sigan comprando sus productos. 
Pagara el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio, ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su esposo el señor Abel con el sueldo que recibe como empleado de una compañía de seguridad.
texts.en:
Mrs. Belen has been selling beauty products for women for more than five years.
She needs more products for her business.  She has various orders to fulfill and does not have the money to purchase the products.
The reason for her loan request is to be able to make the purchase and fill the order on time so that her customers are not inconvenienced and continue to buy from her.
She will repay the loan with the income from her business. since her husband, Abel,  covers the household expenses with the salary that he gets as an employee of a security company.

loans.use: to invest in products for her business.

loans.name: Flor Naciente Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “FLOR NACIENTE” iniciará su tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde tiene como secretaria a la señora Seferina. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de coca, costura de pantalones, venta de coca, venta de verduras, chofer de sindicato, venta de salchipapas, venta de  artículos plásticos.
 
La señora Seferina,  indica que hace dos años medio que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de coca que aprendió de las señoras que venden.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital de trabajo (compra de coca), que comprará en Villa Fatima y lo venderá de forma ambulante. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el ahorro y los regalos.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Flor Naciente" will start its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer; they meet in the Pro Mujer central office in Villa Exaltacion.  The group has 8 members, and is led by a board of directors including the secretary, Seferina.  This group has a variety of businesses: the members sell coca leaves, sew pants, sell vegetables, work as drivers in public transportation, sell salchipapas (a typical dish including sausages and fried potatoes), and sell plastic products.

Seferina tells us that she was invited to  join Pro Mujer two years ago, and has been working with Pro Mujer ever since.  Now she has a business selling coca leaves; other women merchants helped her to learn this business.

The loan that she will take now will be used to increase her working capital (to buy coca leaves.)  She will make her purchases in Villa Fatima, and she sells her products in an itinerant manner.  This form of working will allow her to generate resources to support her family; she lives in a common-law marriage and has 2 children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answered that she likes the savings and the gifts.

loans.use: to buy coca leaves to sell

loans.name: Meswaleh

texts.en:
Meswaleh is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of opening a hairdressing school in the future.

With the 25,000 KES, she wants to purchase a sewing machine and cloth materials. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and cloth materials.

loans.name: Lasiti

texts.en:
Lasiti is 52 years old. He is married and has seven children.  He is a farmer and has been farming on his own piece of land for the last eleven years.

Lasiti learned about KADET through marketing done by KADET staff. This will be his second loan.  He is planning to use the funds to buy farm inputs and hire machinery to prepare the land. Wheat has proved to be doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to re-invest in the farm and plant more acres of wheat.

His dream is to buy a bigger piece of land in the future where he can plant more wheat for commercial sales, to buy his own farm machinery, and to educate his children.

Lasiti is a hardworking man who is focused to his set goals.

loans.use: buy farm inputs and hire machinery to prepare the land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an additional batch of new merchandise

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al Banco Comunal “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”; El banco pertenece al distrito de Yungaqui, Provincia de Anta, departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lorenza; la socia tiene 41 años; la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos, de 21, 16, 14, 4 años de edad;  La socia se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores, la socia cría aves de corral, cuyes, chanchos,  también la socia se dedica a la compra de vacas, toros,  la socia ahora invertirá su dinero en la compra de vacas terneras lecheras para de ellas extraer leche y vender leche fresca, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de vacas terneras 2 o 3 vacas tiernas. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de de 2 o 3 vacas terneras.

La socia se muestra muy satisfecha y agradecida por el apoyo que se le brindara mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Introducing Lorenza, a member of “TAYTACHA SEÑOR DE CCOYLLORITY DE YUNGAQUI”, a Communal Bank located in Yungaqui, a district of the Anta province in the Cusco department.

Lorenza is 41 years old and she has 4 children aged 21, 16, 14 and 4. She engages in buying and selling small animals, breeding poultry, “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig) and pigs. She also engage in buying cows and bulls. She will invest her loan in the purchase of calves and dairy cows to get fresh milk to sell. She is requesting a loan to buy 2 or 3 calves. She is requesting a loan to invest it in the purchase of 2 or 3 calves.

She is very satisfied with and thankful to the support she will receive through this loan, and she commits to complying with the repayment of her dues according to the agreed schedule.

loans.use: To buy 2 or 3 calves.

loans.name: Aza's Group

texts.en:
Aza is the leader of this group. She is 39 and married to a farmer. Together with her husband she is bringing up two daughters and a son; the daughters study at school and the son is not yet at school, he is preschool age (under seven). 

 Aza works as a teacher of mathematics in the lyceum. Nine years ago she saved 8000 soms and with that money she started to breed cattle. She sells dairy products and resells cattle at a higher price after fattening them. In this way she earns an additional 3000 soms per month. With money received from the loan Aza wants to purchase more cattle for breeding, fattening and further reselling. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Tsiala

texts.en:
Tsiala is from the village Sartichala, in the Kakheti region. She is 47 years old and lives with her family–her husband Guram and 18-year-old daughter Tamta. 

Guram works in the village, mainly on agricultural works in his and nearby villages. Tsiala is leading the dairy farm owned by the family. They have three milk cows. Tsiala produces yogurt and cheese from the milk and sells them in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). She takes them once a week to the Tbilisi open market and sells to dairy product retailers. Total average income of the family is 650 Laris per month.
